Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: PCHOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: Some reviews had not been good and I had arranged a ten day visit for nine of us so I was apprehensive about what my friends would make of the hotel. It was very good: modern and comfortable rooms with air conditioning and secondary glazing designed to keep the Ramblas noise out. The bed linen was changed daily. The hotel is well positioned, just below the Catalunya Square and reasonable walking distance from most main attractions, with a big market just a few hundred metres away. At present it has no bar but the staff kindly let us bring in wine to have a quiz evening in one of the lounges. Had it had this facility I would have rated the hotel as excellent: I understand that there are plans for one to be created. There are good restaurants all around and a friendly bar next door. I would definitely stay there again and that was the view of the rest of our party.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: StephAC
Reviews.Content: Love the location of this hotel! The staff was extremely friendly. Immediately I noticed the room is clean and modern deco! Many people will complain that the rooms are small but honestly....you really aren't in them that much! We were there for 4 nights and loved the convenience of the hotels location. We walked EVERYWHERE! Even took a run down an abandoned La Rambla one early morning. Few issues: they were doing some construction and it seemed to start VERY early in the morning and not let up ALL day. We had a weird odor in our room the first day but we didn't know if it was the construction or the area. After the first day we couldn't take it anymore....it was a sewage smell. We happened upon a staff member in the hall and he came in to smell and was astonished. They immediately moved us to their only room available...which was a bit bigger than the one we were in. I appreciate their quick response to the issue! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a convenient, clean, and welcoming hotel in Barcelona. Being right on La Rambla may seem a bit 'touristy' but we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A decent and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: roothie
Reviews.Content: I can find little to complain about with regard to this hotel. My husband and I just had a very comfortable five night stay there. The rooms are modern, comfortable and clean. We had a standard double (don't go for the economy - these seem much too small for a couple). The double bed was nice and firm, but was just two singles pushed together. This didn't bother us, but could bother some people I suppose. The bathroom was well equipped with a shower/ tub combination and I found the water temperature and strength good. The location is perfect being right on the Ramblas. It is spitting distance from Catalunya Metro station. Many attractions, shops, restaurants and bars are within easy walking distance as the hotel is so central. We did not have breakfast at the hotel so I can't comment on this (12 Euro each seemed a little on the high side), but there is no need to have breakfast at the hotel as there are so many nice cafes nearby where you can get nice breakfast tortillas or pastries. (I would recommend Buenas Migas just around the corner) A lot of people on here have commented on the hotel being noisy. You do hear the occasional door open and close in the corridor and the toilet flush from other rooms, but it really isn't anywhere near as bad a some people have made out. In fact, we found it quite quiet and slept comfortably. Noise from the street is also fairly minimal. There are few services on site, but I knew this when I booked it. There is a restaurant underneath the hotel: nice food and convenient, but terribly slow service so I wouldn't necessarily recommend unless you really don't want to walk far! The staff seem friendly and helpful (although it was a shame that on checkout the man who served us said hardly a word to us - I would expect some sort of thank you and goodbye). Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you want to be in the centre of things.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: HaveCoffeeWillTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Ramblas for 5 nights in early March. It's in the process of a massive, but mostly complete renovation and the room we had was lovely and on the 5th floor. The hotel staff were cordial and professional. I mainly appreciated how central to everything this hotel was. Even thought located right along La Rambla, the noise was almost nonexistent when we had our windows closed. The biggest issue I had was that the hotel restaurant was under construction. You couldn't hear the noise from our room, but it sound pretty loud when the elevator passed from the third floor down. Also, this meant that the breakfast was served in alternate locations. For the first couple of mornings, we had to go across the street with vouchers to another hotel. Then, a small buffet was set up in the restaurant right next to the hotel. (Same building, but I don't think actually connected to the hotel.) Also, this meant there was no room service and food could not be brought back to the rooms. Obviously, you could purchase it elsewhere as takeout and bring it back, but it was inconvenient. On the other hand, there was a Carrefour about a block down, which was lovely for getting bottled water and snacks. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel to others, especially once they finish the renovations and reopen the hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: adonosch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2011 before embarking on a 12 night med cruise. The location of this hotel is fabulous-walking distance to the shops, sites, restaurants and of course it is right on the Royal Ramblas. Ask for a street view room to enjoy the people watching. The rooms have extra sound-proofing so there is no noise despite being right on the street. This hotel has a very modern decor. Only downside is that there isn't a restaurant or bar in the hotel. There is one next door and attached by the second floor to a diner style place which I wouldn't waste your money or time on considering all the great spots around the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central Location”
Reviews.Author: stormeangel
Reviews.Content: Hotel is so centrally located for everything and every time we entered the lobby area it always smelt very nice. There are renovations works going on but, to be honest, they hardly affected anything at all and there was certainly no noise from them. Our room was clean, warm and comfortable although, for the price paid for the 3 of us at Euro 250 for 2 nights and Euro 260 for 2 nights, we had expected there to be proper beds. We had 1 double bed, a put up bed and a sofa bed. There are no facilities to make tea/coffee and we would really have expected this in a 4* hotel although there is a mini bar. So if you are looking for this you should book elsewhere or, alternatively, bring your own kettle for making hot drinks. We found the staff to be pleasant and friendly for the most part. There is a dining area within the hotel and the breakfasts offer a comprehensive selection of fresh buffet foods for diners. At Euro 12 per person (adults) and half that for children we found that, if you have a big appetite then that's good you can certainly get your 'money's worth', but for us with much smaller appetites going outside to find somewhere for breakfast would have been much more economical. I'm confused as to its 4* rating as my friends and I discussed this and felt that 3* would have been appropriate although we thought that the management thought that the central location would probably warrant it to a 4*. One thing you must check when leaving the hotel is that your bill is right. My friend had paid the first night on her credit card as soon as we booked the nights and, when our bill was printed out, they tried to charge us again for that first night. It took us twice of challenging that before the staff member would even look through the records. We were also charged full breakfast price although we had been told that we would receive a 15% discount if we breakfasted at the hotel. Again we had to challenge that. In fairness, it was rectified, but we felt that we shouldn't have had to bring these matters up.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nell188
Reviews.Content: We arrived after an early morning flight and were able to check in early at about 11:30 which was nice. The staff seemed a bit hard to approach at first but then warmed up. Our first room was not good because it was near the staff service entrance, which had a door that would slam every couple of minutes and the staff were very noisy right next door to us when we were trying to have a nap. Fortunately we were able to move rooms without any problems. The rooms were a bit dark (ours faced inwards) but clean, spacious and nicely designed. We were disappointed that breakfast wasn't included with the amount of money we paid for the room. We found the hotel to be quiet (once we moved rooms) and in a good location, although it is nice to get away from crazy Las Ramblas every now and then.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location to explore Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MartaPortugal
Reviews.Content: The hotel has nice rooms, perhaps a little small, but we don’t need a lot of space when all we want is to leave the room and discover Barcelona! Everything is very clean, there are some renovations going on, but that is the rule in Barcelona: they are constantly renovating everything! :) Location is incredible! The hotel is literally 3 minute walk from Plaza Catalunya, which is probably the main point for buses and metro in the entire city. From the airport you can take the Aerobus, which stops in Plaza Catalunya (passes every 10 minutes, costs around 5 €). And for everything else, take the metro (2 € single ticket). Besides, Royal is located right in the Ramblas, so the minute you leave the hotel, you are on the main street, where everything happens. And only a 10 minute walk from La Boqueria Market, which is amazing! Go there for tapas, amazing fruit juices and little boxes with fresh fruits. It is better than to enter a restaurant in the Ramblas, where you will eat poorly and pay a fortune! I don’t know if I’ll be visiting Barcelona again, but if I do, I will definitely choose the Royal again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kevsobevso
Reviews.Content: The location of this Hotel is excellent and this is reflected in the price. We found the Staff very helpful especially as we were there during the General Strike and they gave us all the information we needed. We paid extra to have a view over the Ramblas and we could not hear a thing through the secondary glazing, and the view was great. The room was clean and tidy, had a safe in it, but why charge over 2 euros for bottled water when you can buy it for 45 cents in the Supermarket a few doors away? There was building work taking place in the Hotel, presumably to create a restaurant/bar as there wasn't any in the Hotel when we were there. Breakfast was offered, at 12 euro/person, in the restaurant on the fround floor.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated 4-star hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brewce599
Reviews.Content: Right on the Ramblas! 1 min. walk from subway and 3 min. from Playa Catalunya where the airport bus (5.30 euros) brings you into town. We felt safe walking the 3 min. with our rolling luggage. The Ramblas is well lit at night and you can return to your hotel after a Paseo without having to go down any dark and narrow side streets. The rooms are recently renovated (some work was still in progress [March 23, 2012]. They were refurbishing a few rear rooms on floor 1 -- but we never had any noise from that). We were in a regular room (# 212) which was super clean and quiet - it was double-glazed twice over. I.e. the window (which can be opened), has two panels each double-glazed and spaced by 4 in. between. This is helpful as the Ramblas does have noisy revellers (not us) -- and, yes, they are even going at 2 am. There is a mini-bar to keep your cheese cool (buy Boursault in the Boqueria market which is just nearby) Perhaps the only flaw is the lack of coffee-making in the room -- but no problem -- there are lots of coffee bars on Ramblas within a few yards of the hotel entrance. Front desk staff are excellent and english speaking. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location. Hotel staff were not friendly or helpful”
Reviews.Author: marcy n
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five. The rooms were large and connecting which was nice. The location was excellent. The rooms were fairly clean. The beds were singles and not very comfortable. The hotel overall was ok. The staff were rude. We stayed in five different hotels in three countries and only found this hotel to have rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: itiberiu
Reviews.Content: We had picked this hotel based on reviews from this web site and it was a good decision. The travel agency that helped us is from Romania, called Itinera Nova, did their best in finding us the best rate (which I recommend for Romanian turists) Now getting back on the hotel review, the location is very good. The ground floor of the hotel was under refurbishment and there was no restaurant to take breakfast. As an alternative the management offered us to go across the street to another hotel, which I founded a little bit unconvenient. Thefore we had to skip hotel breakefast. The rooms are good, clean and quite although we were facing La Rambla. The staf of the hotel is very nice and polite. We had a problem with the air condition, but the staff reacted fast and promptly. I recommend this hotel because of location and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Convienient and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: P_Hall64
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel because of the location and a good deal on lastminute.com The reception staff were efficient but not the most talkative. (I gave up saying Hello in the end) We had a Ramblas view room on the 6th floor which was large with both a bath and shower in the bathroom. The bed was comfortable and lovely to sink into after a long day walking around Barcelona and the room was kept lovely and clean. We pretty much just used the hotel as somewhere to sleep and shower so the Royal Ramblas was perfect for us. My biggest tip is to get the Aerobus from the Airport to Barcelona. The buses leave from outside the terminal every 6 mins and drop you off at Placa De Catalunya which is the last stop. From here, head down the Ramblas and the hotel is on your right not far from the top. You can catch the bus back to the airport from where you're dropped off. A1 for Terminal 1 and A2 for T2 and costs £5.30 each way. We used to get fresh juice and fruit from Mercat de La Boqueria - they do most juices you can think of from kiwi fruit to strawberry. Also check out Sinatra's for tapas and cocktails in the evenings All in all - if you want a hotel which is close to the centre with a comfy room then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely weekend away in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Tina W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The rooms are very clean and tidy. Only a few things I would have liked, tea and coffee facilities and it would have been handy to have a little information in the room. We had a small problem trying to work the A/C as stuck on 19 which not a problem this time of year but maybe in the summer? There is no bar in this hotel but they have a restaurant next door serving food. This is not really a problem as La Ramlas is full of lovely places to eat and drink. Staff were helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than The Last Time – Not ideal for Business”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: As you can see from my previous review, I absolutely despised this property on my last stay. The reception area of the Royal was newly renovated and seemed more open and pleasant then the last time. While the front desk staff were charming and helpful, service was still painfully slow both at checkout and check-in. The scaffolding was taken down during my stay. The newly renovated restaurant next door looked promising. We were given breakfast vouchers for their sister property across the road in the morning – I only tried it once, as it really wasn’t very good (especially if you are a vegetarian). I had a room on the 6th floor, overlooking Las Ramblas. The room was literally twice as big as I had on my previous stay (at the same enormous price) and I even had a full bathroom on this occasion. I would certainly avoid the basic / economy rooms at all cost. There were a few problems. For example, I can’t understand why they couldn’t join the two single beds into one, as I kept falling between the cracks (as the two beds are on wheels). Many of my colleagues also complained about this. The bed was also rock-hard and very uncomfortable, but the pillows were fine. The rooms could really do with irons. I borrowed the iron on the first night and I think it was the only one for the entire building. The hotel rooms could also benefit with a kettle in each room. The other thing about the room, which also drove me a little nuts, was the fact that the air conditioning system had not been turned on yet. You could open the windows to get some fresh air, but then you could hear all of the street noise. For the price we were paying, this was not really acceptable. The bathroom was a good size with large towels and okay to weak water-pressure. The soap provided was too small, but they also gave out shampoo and body wash, as well as toothbrush, hair cap, razer and tissues. I would suggest bringing your own amenities as I did. The room was reasonably cleaned during my 6-night stay, however, when I came back at 3:00 p.m. on the last day, the room had not been cleaned. I popped out for a couple of hours (and put the “please clean sign” on my door) and it still had not been serviced by 5:15 p.m. I pleaded with the staff to remedy the situation as soon as possible, but it was not what I needed after a long week at La Fira. The best thing about this property is the location, but you will pay through the nose for the privilege of an okay, but not spectacular 3-star property (3-star by North American standards by the way). It is still poor for business (wifi is terrible and expensive). The hotel is fine for tourists though...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great rooms great location and great price.”
Reviews.Author: Gem_Rich
Reviews.Content: Superbly decorated and presented modern hotel, from the exterior, to the reception, to the halls, lifts, and communal areas leading to the rooms, and the rooms themselves, very very nice. We had a huge and very comfortable bed. We were on the 5th floor with a great view of las ramblas. What a location, it doesnt get much better. Not noisy at night, superb bars and restaurants within crawling distance - check out the attic reateurant, how good is that place and again reasonably priced. Hotel is a 15 minute stroll into Port Vell and the harbour, only a 30 second walk to the nearest tube station and the city square where the hard rock cafe is. Great city great hotel and great location. My only critique was that the front of the hotel was covered in scaffolding at the ground floor where the restaurant and bar were being renovated, and were therefore not in use. I would have preferred to have been warned of this prior to arrival and it was a bit disappointing not to be able to have a drink in the hotel before dinner, but hey that's life.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: lovestravel172
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in the Royal Ramblas. Our room was a decent size but more importantly it was modern and very clean. The location is superb - couldn't ask for better. It was also very quiet even though it was right on the ramblas. The breakfast room is large with fantastic views of the ramblas and the breakfast is also great. I would definitely stay in this hotel again - and plus it was very reasonably priced too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dhireen
Reviews.Content: Travelling with three people they gave us the smallest double room then folded out the sofa to make an extra bed. Staff barely speak English and not very professional. But did not spend much time there so was not too much of a problem and location cannot get much better.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Memorable Trip”
Reviews.Author: RVVH
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at this wonderful hotel with my partner who took me to Barcelona as a surprise. I was apprehensive about the hotel we would be staying at but once we arrived at the hotel I was pleasantly surprised. The decor of the hotel is gorgeous and very modern. The room we had was the ramblas view superior room. The view from the window was perfect as we could see the main street. The room was very spacious and clean and the decor again was fabulous. I was really happy with the hotel and the room my partner had chosen. The location of the hotel is perfect, its situated directly on la rambla and the main square is about 5 minutes walking distance. Everything was accessible to us and we could walk directly to the shops and restaurants situated close by. The metro bus stop was less than 5 minutes walk away which made it convenient to get a bus to the airport on our departure. The bus is priced very reasonably at just under 6 euros per person which is a lot cheaper than getting a taxi! The staff at the hotel were mostly friendly and willing to help us with directions and places to eat. We found that on our arrival there was renovation work taking place for the design rooms which are being built on the royal floor situated on the PR floor. However we hardly noticed the drilling and the cleaners were nice enough to close the doors in the hallway to shield us from hearing the drilling. The hotel personally made my stay in Barcelona very enjoyable and I loved the liveliness of the square and observing from our room window. Another plus point was the supermarket which was situated downstairs a few doors down from the hotel, which made it easy and convenient to get hold of anything we needed. There was a wide range of restaurants including kfc and mcdonalds which were situated right of the hotel within a 5 minute walk however be warned that you will be ripped off trying to buy a meal from these popular chains! Another word of warning is to steer clear of side streets as they are narrow and dark and move away from the main street. We wandered down these side streets unaware, in search of a nice bar to watch the football however immediately felt unsafe with the type of people on these side streets, so be cautious. There are a wide array of shops and stalls situated on the main street and a place called Patagonia Bar where we had our last meal. When we first arrived at this place we felt it lacked atmosphere and that staff were not friendly and in particular the waitress, however the main young guy at the bar who appeared to be the owner provided a fun and friendly atmosphere and gave us 4 free shots between us along with all of the other people at the bar. So be sure to give this place a chance. Whenever there is a football match, which in our case there was, (Barcelona v Real Madrid) the atmosphere is crazy and amazing, we saw fans parading outside our hotel on the main street and chanting till the early hours of the morning, however we slept peacefully thanks to the solid sound proofed windows. This atmosphere is noisy but amazing and unlike anything you have ever seen. Shopping in Barcelona is great as they have more choice than the UK and clothes are very affordable and pretty cheap I found. I found the Zara's there were great. There are a lot of Zara shops around the square and as you walk left of the hotel along with other well known retailers such as Diesel, Levis, Esprit and H&M. However as I learnt the hard way, there is a lot of walking so take a lot of flat comfy shoes and especially ladies do not attempt to wear heals as by then end of your trip your feet will be very sore and the streets are not friendly to walk in heels. On our second day we decided to take the 'Barcelona Bus Turistic' bus tour which consisted of a blue and red route (and a green route however this is only for the summer months). Each route takes approximately 2 hours providing you don't get off at any of the stops. You are able to get on and off at any of the stops and look around etc and simply hop on the next bus which comes every 7 - 20 mins. We found this bus tour great as we saw all of the major attractions and felt like we saw quite a lot of Barcelona. We saw the famous Sagrada Familia which is an amazing architectural creation by the artist Gaudi and we also saw numerous creations of his along with a stop which was located on the red route which allowed us to get off at a view point where there was a museum but more importantly a breathtaking view of Barcelona, so be sure to get off here to take pictures. This tour is 24 euros per person for both routes and the bus stop is situated conveniently less than 5 minutes walk from the hotel, situated on the main square, which is the same area to catch the metro bus from. On our last day when we checked out, the hotel reception staff were kind and kept our suitcases for us until we left in the evening and we were able to sit in the hotel lobby area. So finally to sum up our stay, we had an amazing 2 nights and 3 days at this hotel and in this beautiful city and we were sad to go!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and suprisingly beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: charlesp
Reviews.Content: Three minutes from the airport bus stop and the metro and directly on the Rambla. Friendly staff. Spotless rooms which were really very beautiful, especially given the price. Restaurant was closed but there are dozens, if not hundreds, of places to eat within 500 yards. Only negative was that they charge EUR 7 per day for WIFI and, really, it was a dismal service. Not recommended for business. Highly recommended for tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location on Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: dallasbonedoc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a one minute walk from Placa Catalunya Metro station which connects you to all the important sites in the city. The airport bus stop was a 3 minute walk from the hotel. Very comfortable and convenient. The restaurant was under remodel due to a fire and there was construction noise during the day, but the room was very quiet at night. There was no breakfast because of construction, but there were plenty of inexpensive options nearby. Overall, a great value because of the great location. We especially enjoyed Las Ramblas and the old town center, Barri Gotic. Everything was within a 10-15 min walk or easily reachable by Metro - we never took a taxi. Would definitely consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right in the center of the city. The staff were smiling evertime. The price was reasonable. We were pleased it. We will recommend our friends.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent as it was a 5 minute walk to the bus stop. Situated at the La Catalunya part of the La Rambla. Staff were all very pleasant and helpful. Spoke excellent English. The room had been newly refurbished in a modern style. Good choice for buffet breakfast. WiFi to expensive - 17EUR per day!!! No bar and a temporary dining room only open for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, kind crew!”
Reviews.Author: Noa N
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect in the middle of la rambla, near the liceu merto station, near plaza catalunia. Amazing service, very kind and fast (the check in and out was really rapid). We had an amazing vacation there, highly recommended!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy!”
Reviews.Author: delftgirl
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful two nights at the Royal Ramblas in October of 2011. The room was clean and very modern as was the bathroom. The staff could not have been more accommodating when we checked in, earlier than their check-in hours. They were most helpful with our questions during the three days we were there. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. It is close to everything a tourist would want, and we felt very safe in the area.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel with good location to cruise port”
Reviews.Author: RayRockville
Reviews.Content: Small interior room with window that looked out onto a central roof and views of other rooms. We took the cheapest double they had since we knew we wouldn't be in the room very much. The only problem is someone was smoking out their window and the smoke penetrated the window in our room even though it was closed. The room was clean but sparce. If you are only going to be in Barcelona for a day or two and are going to go to the cruise terminal this is an OK place to stay. The restaurant was undergoing remodeling so it was closed but there are lots of places to eat close by. Our room rate came with the breakfast which was good but nothing outstanding. We booked room only and then when we got there they offered the breakfast at half off.

Reviews.Title: “A 2 stars hotel at the very best !”
Reviews.Author: Bew55
Reviews.Content: We booked an economy double room so our expectations were quite moderate but this hotel was utterly disappointing. For our basic needs we expected a least a private bathroom. As attested by the hotel website; the toilet is private (sliding glass door) but it is in a cubicle that is smaller than an airplane bathroom. To make matters even worst the light is controlled by a motion sensor so keep moving if you don’t want the light to turn itself off. Moreover, you have to step into the main room to wash your hands or to dry yourself after taking a shower. The main attraction of this hotel is its proximity to La Ramblas so in reserving an economy room I did not expect a beautiful street view but I did not expect either that our windows would open on dark inner airway shaft. Everything is small in this hotel; the complementary toiletries are not enough for two people. The elevators, for a hotel this size, are so small and in high demand so a lot of guests have to take the stairs instead. The hotel restaurant seems to be a variation of a fast food restaurant chain. All in all, from what I saw in this hotel it is definitely not a 4 stars hotel. Maybe the others types of room are somewhat better but they are a lot more expensive. In my view, if you want to be recognized as a 4 stars hotel all rooms should have a minimum level of comfort and services. We were so displeased with our room that we contacted the front desk and the best they could do for us was to suggest an upgrade to better room for a substantial amount of money; an offer we declined.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room on the Royal Floor (Planta Royal), which was about £15 a night more than the other rooms. It was excellent - lovely room, all dark woods and comfy beds with a view over Las Ramblas, but with 2 thick windows, a blind and thick curtains to make sure it was pretty much silent at night. The staff couldn't have been more helpful on checkin or checkout, including booking taxis, offering advice for travelling around the city and then letting us leave our luggage for half a day until our taxi arrived to take us to the hotel. We only ate there once, having breakfast on the second day at it was fine. 13 euros a per person was maybe a bit expensive but there was a lot of choice and I believe it's cheaper if you book it in advance. Downsides: king size bed was actually two doubles pushed together, leading to an inconvenient gap in the middle; tea and coffee in the room was one teabag, one coffee per day; toilet was at the other end of the room but due to frosted glass door had very little soundproofing - you'll hear more than you'd want to!! Overall - spot on for the money with a great location, excellent staff, really well appointed rooms and a general feeling of class and luxury in a relatively cheap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rather expensive”
Reviews.Author: delagioventu
Reviews.Content: Excellent situation on the Ramblas, close to everything. This is the strongest point of this hotel. The facilities are however rather limited. lthough the hotel boasts to have two restaurants, one is actually at a walking distance of 20 minutes and the other one, next door, is rather a fastfood pizzeria. Breakfast is not included in the high priced rooms (12 euros, 6 euros for children up to 12), and is served in the latter fastfood restaurant. The setting is not at all up to standard for a four star hotel. Furthermore, the hotel has little or no other facilities (small lobby, etc). Not ideal for a trip with the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Bucksen
Reviews.Content: We chose this for the location, which is perfect. Rooms are quite small, even the family room, but clean and well maintained. Breakfast is good if included in your deal, so book early. Sofa bed was very squeaky so we put the mattress on the floor. Very quiet rooms. Ours had no view at all, which is a shame, so get a street view if you can. Staff were helpful. One hour free wifi, could do with free all day seeing as other places do.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: angie R
Reviews.Content: Don't spoil your experience of Barcelona, by staying at the Royal Ramblas. For the price, our room was tiny.. it was clean and the cleaners did a great job. As for the front reception, the only staff member to communicate, was Robert. Thanks Robert, for your directions. As for the blonde princess who was too busy flirting with her co worker, to even acknowledge us, or help in any form, maybe you should look at a career change.

Reviews.Title: “Not really royal”
Reviews.Author: mikkami
Reviews.Content: Location and staff are the only things in this hotel, which make it tolarable.. Crambed narrow and dark rooms ( view of wallas - of the other buildings - few meters away). Maybe I was just unlucky with the room. Breakfast - monotone and.. not really fresh.l Choice for dinner? ..Pizza. Well that's far too much of "not enough" for 4 stars in Barcelona... (June, 2010)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pete_coach
Reviews.Content: Being in a city like Barcelona requires that you stay where the "action" is. The Royal Ramblas cannot be in a better spot. We arrived early but that was not a problem for the staff. they were able to accommodate us temporarily until our room was ready. Our room was one on the Royal Floor (Planta Royal). Very nice, very modern and a view of the Ramblas. There was lots of activity on Las Ramblas but we could not hear anything. There is no restaurant in the hotel but they have an association with the restaurant next door. for 12 euros you can get an buffet breakfast but, there are so many places within minutes open and available that you have endless possibilities. The market (St Josep La Boqueria), a 5 minute walk, is by far the best place for breakfast (or lunch or tapas). A very good hotel, very helpful staff and perfect location is hard to find. We were lucky to have found the Royal Ramblas Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Defintely will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: travelbuff88
Reviews.Content: Great location, right on Las Ramblas (the main pedestrian walking street). Close to everything including the Gothic Quarter, market and Catayluna Square. Rooms have been recently updated. Very clean with all the modern conveniences. Shower available in some rooms. Our room had a view of Las Ramblas great for people wtaching and was very quite as there were double windows.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location. Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JDaws1106
Reviews.Content: Pros: awesome location in the middle of everything, very quiet (despite room facing street), very clean, helpful front desk Only one con: bed was uncomfortable would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Sammy2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Ramblas before and after we cruised on the Med. Fantastic location, very clean and very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and Incredibly Clean and Modern!”
Reviews.Author: abs628
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Ramblas hotel this summer for one night after returning from a cruise. The hotel is situated right on Las Ramblas, the main street in Barcelona. Even though the hotel is located right on Las Ramblsa, which can be quite noisy, you can't hear any street noise from your room in the hotel. The hotel's location puts you within walking distance from many of Barcelona's key attractions. Inside, the hotel is incredibly clean and modern. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and since we arrived very early in the morning after our cruise and our room was not ready, they had no problem holding our bags while we went out to explore the city. My only complaint was that the interior walls of the hotel are a little too thin. You can hear doors slamming to other rooms during the night. It is just something to be aware of if you are a light sleeper. If this was improved, the hotel would be 100% perfect! One plus is that the hotel does have triples, which is difficult to find in Barcelona's hotels. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a trip to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: DCLdreamer
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Royal Ramblas and had a wonderful room with an amazing view of Las Ramblas. The hotel was spotless and the bed was so comfortable. There was no noise from the outside at all. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, so we cannot comment on that. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We did have someone outside our door at around 3 a.m. who was probably drunk; he was yelling that he was from the UK wanted his cup of tea brought to him. He then started yelling that there was a fire and kept yelling fire, fire. We were afraid to open our door, so I called down to the desk and they told me he was probably in the hallway just having a cigarette and would probably be going back to his room shortly. It was at least another 15 to 20 minutes later that he finally left. I just wish the front desk handled this differently, as it was upsetting to hear someone yell "fire" in the middle of the night and not have anyone check out what he was doing. I would have given this hotel 5-stars had it not been for the way they handled the drunk guy outside of our door. Our daughter and her family were in the room next to us and they were also awakened by this man yelling fire and were frightened by him. I have to note that the elevators were not slow at all. Read reviews that the elevators were very slow, but we did not encounter that problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful people”
Reviews.Author: HolaHighWycombe
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The front desk were so helpful ringing round on our arrival to try to find a car park high enough for our 2.2 metre car. Also in the night the security spotted we had not closed our door properly and knocked to let us know. Nice to know they are on patrol!

Reviews.Title: “Location location location...”
Reviews.Author: NOTurTYPE
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the heart or Las Ramblas well then you're looking in the right place. We had a street facing suite which was a very nice size considering the location. Electric shade raised to expose the double pane as well as a double set of windows which eliminated ALL street noise. It was funny to see the crowds below all hours of the day and night - It reminded me of the foot traffic in Las Vegas. Our king size bed was two joining twins that never moved apart. The shower stall was separate from the toilet stall - The sink and vanity we mounted in the open between the two stalls. The room had a minibar and fridge which I found useful to stash my own beer in that I would by from the grocery store two doors down (save $). The decor was modern and the color tones were warm yet deep. The AC cooled the room no problem though maintenance had to be called for two separate light bulbs outages. Again, the location is excellent - The Gothic quarter, the beach and marina, the metro, La Boqueria, Saint square are all within minutes walking. I would recommend the crepes guy for breakfast each morning in La Boqueria (the market) - Awesome! Also, I recommend the double-decker bus tour in Barcelona since it consists of three routes (red, blue, green). I normally do not however, because of the the three connecting routes, they do an excellent job at showing you many of the sites worth seeing throughout the Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: pboulanger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel pre and post cruise. The service was excellent, with the staff being knowledgable and friendly. We stayed in a triple room, which had plenty of space for three adults. We couldn't have asked for a better location. Right outside our door was the excitement of Las Ramblas street, some of the best restaurants and a few steps away was a metro station. Gothic square was in walking distance and easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfactory internet capability”
Reviews.Author: SteveVA69
Reviews.Content: The Royal Ramblas is a quality hotel with a great location, but I can't recommend it until they improve their internet capability. First, the wi-fi is weak and fluctuates in signal strength, even in their public areas. Second, they offer "1 hour free of charge per day," according to their web site, but what they don't tell you is that means one continuous hour. For example, you can't use 1/2 hour in the morning and the rest in the evening, without incurring a charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: khanna
Reviews.Content: Great location right on the ramblas. A walking distance to the barre gothic. An easy taxi ride to the other sights, and close to the subway. Checking was a breeze. Room was comfortable and pretty big, by city standards. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Boring Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChanelG
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location, few minutes walk to Plaza Catalunya where buses leave every 5 minutes to the airport. The decor is very nice, contemporary style with earth tones. Small cozy lobby on main floor of hotel with computer and printer (internet for a fee). We had a Royal Ramblas design room on the Royal floor nice view to the busy street but the room was still quite small, no bathtub, a good rain shower head and pretty soap and shampoo bottles. There is no spa, pool, gym or bar in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not value for money!”
Reviews.Author: WARRINGTONCRAIG
Reviews.Content: Recently got back from this hotel and was slightly disappointed. After booking a room on the royal floor at a hefty premium, i was expecting something more than your average hotel room. However, it was clear that the rooms had been modernised and were very clean. There was little noise from outside but very noisy from restaurant/bar next door which was situated below our room. There was also no hotel bar or other facilities. Overall nice clean average, well located hotel but wouldnt recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Ramblas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tabby38
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona as some family members were taking part in the marathon. We found the Royal Ramblas Hotel to be very convenient - right on the ramblas which made for a nice walk down to the beach and also a stones throw from plaza catalunya. There was also a metro station close by to reach other areas of the city. We had a ramblas view room and enjoyed watching the hustle and bustle outside. The glazing was adequate to enable us to still get a good nights sleep. Very comfortable bed. Breakfast was plentiful and good. We loved Barcelona and intend to return some time and would have no hesitation in booking The Royal Ramblas again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Convenience in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ParisAmour18
Reviews.Content: The Royal Ramblas hotel is steps away from La Boqueria a food lover's paradise. Every morning we would wake up stroll over for a vast array of freshly squeezed juices and a pastry or baked item of our choice. Lunch in the market is also great, if you can get a seat at one of the little eateries. The hotel is sleek and modern. The rooms are small compared to standards in the US, but are nonetheless comfortable and clean. The staff is friendly and the location is safe and convenient. There is a large variety for restaurants and nightlife around the Ramblas area. A few doors down is a supermarket and drugstore, which is convenient if you have forgotten something. The lobby is warm and inviting and great for waiting for your party. We were there to take a cruise from the port in Barcelona and this was a convenient location for that. Moreover, if you do not have many days in Barcelona this is a great place to feel immersed into the culture, i.e. food!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MetteogSara
Reviews.Content: My 18 year old daughter and I stayed on the Royal Ramblas Hotel for 4 nights, 24.-28.juli, and ve were very satisfied. Barcelona is a wonderfuld city, and the hotel is located on the best place in town, on the Rambla, and very near to Plaza Catalunia, where the metro and the airbus go from. We had a room on the 6. th floor out to the busy Rambla, but when we closed the double windows, we vere not disturbed by the noise at all. I had a little problem finding out how to start the aircondition, and I went to the desk in the night and vere told, that it only works if both windovs are competely closed. I think it would be good with an information about that in the room. Also I missed an information of that we had one hour free internet acces every day. No one told me, but I discovered, because I needed to check my e-mail. If you just go to the computers it tells you to pay, but if you want to use the free internet, just go to the desk, and ask the staff and they will give you a code. They also forgot to tell me, that I could only log in once a day. I used half an hour in the morning and went back later to use the last 30 minutes, but then it was impossible to use the code. I dont know why, but so it was, the staff said. The men at the desk answer your questions, but they seem a little bit severe, and they don't give you many smiles. But in spite of that we both found it a very fine hotel, and we will recommend it and also would like to stay there again. The breakfast for 12 euro is very good, and you have a good wiev out to the Rambla. The supermarket a few houses to the left of the hotel is also very good with lots of things at low prices and open until 22. So the location of the hotel is perfect for all.

Reviews.Title: “ROYAL Treatmant at the ROYAL Ramblas!”
Reviews.Author: RolexNY
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Royal Ramblas for 1 night before a cruise. The hotel was gracious enough to check us in a little early due to our flight getting in at an early hour and they also upgraded us to a high floor room with a view of the Ramblas! The hotel room was immaculate and surprisingly very quiet because the room had double pane windows to insure a pleasant serene stay. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “It didn't work out but they were accommodating”
Reviews.Author: zamfamtravel
Reviews.Content: We had communicated with the Royal Ramblas directly because we had stayed there previously. Unfortunately, our reservation was never processed so when we arrived after our cruise we had no assigned room(s). At the front desk,( I think his name was Juan) , was most helpful and apologetic when we showed him the confirmation e-mail. He made phone calls to nearby hotels until he was able to locate one ( day one upon the return of cruise ships, it's almost impossible to find a hotel). Unfortunately the available hotel was far from the Ramblas- where we wanted to stay. He offerred to hold our luggage and allow us to enjoy the area until the afternoon when the other hotel was ready for check in. He gave us helpful hints and also booked us for the second night. We never returned to the Royal Ramblas for the second night because the other hotel was very nice and we discovered the busses that were easy to ride to almost anywhere. While we could write a negative comment about this hotel, the staff was so accommodating and helpful in the midst of our crisis that it wouldn't be fair.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Eric_Sl
Reviews.Content: Hello, I was there for 4 days with my 2 child. We had 2 rooms. The rooms are very small, the parking very tiny, and they book more cars that the number of parking they have so you have to fight to park your car at the hotel. The room for the breakfast is very loud and the breakfast not great. The good thing : The hotel is in the center.

Reviews.Title: “Great family room and great location!”
Reviews.Author: tbower54
Reviews.Content: We had a hard time finding an affordable room for a family of 4 in Barcelona for a one night pre-cruise stay. We were so pleased to find the Royal Ramblas hotel and their family room. It was spacious (by European AND US standards), clean, had comfortable beds, a great bathroom, and was quiet. The price also included breakfast which normally costs an addition 12 euro per person. We were also able to check in early (~11am) which we were very grateful for after the red-eye flightwith our 2 young sons. Wonderful hotel...will definitely stay here on our next (longer) visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: travelingwhites
Reviews.Content: My family and I travel alot. This hotel was such a disappointment. We had 2 rooms since there are four of us and both rooms were dirty when we arrived. Even with 2 connecting rooms, we found the space to be small. We had even just finished a 7 day mediterrain cruise and our room was nicer and more spacious than these rooms . On the last day of our stay Air France was on strike. The hotel said that their client internet was down and they could not help us. They told us they had the hotel intenet working but refused to let us pay to use it. The hotel staff could not offer us any help finding an internet cafe. In the end, we eventually went across the street and used another hotels internet for FREE!! I have never had a hotel stay with so many problems. Location is good but tons of great hotels very close. FIND ANOTHER HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Litzza
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Royal Ramblas last summer for 5 days. The location couldn't be more perfect , it is close to everything. The hotel service is not the best but no complaints about it, but our room was located close to elevator and little bit noise. Staff wasn't too friendly but we didn't use their service.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it once was”
Reviews.Author: dcollier
Reviews.Content: It's not a bad hotel but not exceptional. I would probably rate it around 3 stars. The location is very good as you really are in the heart of Barcelona. Stayed here about 5 years ago and, personally thought both the bar and the rooms were better back then. Quite pricey (690 euros for 4 nights) by comparison to most other places I've stayed. One positive point - if you get a Ramblas view, the triple glazed windows really do block out the noise

Reviews.Title: “Took a chance & it was great”
Reviews.Author: miketovatt
Reviews.Content: Staff was better than expected. First trip to Spain, did not know what to expect. So the first impression was this hotel. It was beyond our expectations. Clean, roomy & comfortable. The location was easy to get to all attractions, close to public transportation. We would seek this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Ya it's good”
Reviews.Author: Akshat123
Reviews.Content: It's worth every singl penny downbelow that is carrefor great for shoppers I think that it is great as there is a h and m next to it the hotel is huge well located always happening friendly and kind staff

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Akhilw
Reviews.Content: We payed a huge price for this hotel as it was in the city centre.. I found the aircon not working when we checked into our room 101. Hence we had to call the reception..after almost 4 hours we were told the Aircon was not working for this room and hence we were given another room. The problem is this new room was not facing Las Ramblas.. the reason we chose this hotel. This new room was overlooking a not so good looking building... The service of the staff is quite nice though,.. The breakfast needs some working on though. Also the girl who works for the breakfast needs to learn how to smile...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: SVtravelagent
Reviews.Content: I had booked with Le Meridian, but it was an excessive charge for a room for 3. So I re-booked and couldn't be happier with the location. The Ramblas is a great place to locate for Barcelona. Pre-cruise or after-cruise. I felt completely safe, even after 11 pm. A stone's throw from Hard Rock, McDonald's, Burger King and the market! How wonderful! Only downside to this beautiful hotel is...the restroom is not a room at all, but a partition. Not an issue for me, but teenage boys were a little...horrified. The staff was perfect. The location is awesome. by the way---if you go about 3 blocks on the Ramblas it practically repeats itself---reminded me of Myrtle Beach---souvenir shops! We had dinner @ The Attic(very close) an elite, romantic, interesting place... not terribly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeattleLou
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend this hotel. Our actual stay in the hotel was in February 2009 and we had a wonderful experience. From the recent pictures posted by other reviewers, it seems that the hotel rooms have been tastefully updated from the time of our stay. The hotel location is ideal, rooms were always clean, breakfast was pretty good, staff were friendly and helpful. We never had any issues with noise. We would definitely stay here again when in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: WichitaViajero
Reviews.Content: We stayed before and after our cruise, the hotel was full, and even though we had booked a standard room, we received an upgrade in both occasions. Before we went on our cruise we got upgraded to a Royal Suite, it sure was sweeeet!, very comfortable, roomy, quiet, you could not hear the outside. Many extras we got with this upgrade. The staff was very pleasant, knowledgeable, and helpful. After our cruise we were upgraded to a nicer room, very clean, very nice, the only problem was that you could hear everything that was happening out in the street. I can only imagine how a standard room would be. Your are about two blocks away from placa (Plaza, Square) Catalunya, were you can take the shuttle bus back to the airport for 5.5 Euros a piece. You are about 5 blocks from la boqueria. Wow! Talk about a market, we were in Paris later in the trip, stayed half a block away from Rue Cler, were Parisians go and do their vegetable and fresh produce shopping, it can’t compare, going to la Boqueria by itself, was an experience. Las Ramblas is where everything is happening in Barcelona. You will be right there. You can buy stamps at some “Tabaquerias” (smoke shops) the mail box, which it’s Yellow it’s right across the street from Royal las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid their standard rooms”
Reviews.Author: kayn1
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel pre and post cruise. On arrival the first time after a long flight from Australia, at 9.30am we were told our room was not ready but for 10 euro we could upgrade to a 'superior' room which was immediately available. We took this option and were quite happy with the room, which was clean, modern and overlooked La Ramblas, yet there was no street noise. Note there was no hair conditioner, coffee making facilities or internet in the room but a large TV with English news channels. Staff were pleasant. Negatively, the fire escape was not an enclosed or pressured stairwell but merely stairs in the middle of the hotel. After the cruise, the room we had booked was ready but we wished we had again upgraded. This room was very small, overlooked a wall and appeared designed for maximum electricity saving. The shower and toilet were separated by a frosted glass wall and shared a frosted glass sliding door across the front, so that only one could be closed off at a time. (Water from the shower leaked out into the basin area and also over the floor of the toilet, which we had to dry up. ) They also shared a light which was over the toilet and extremely bright. So far ok, except that the light was movement activated only. It went on when you entered the toilet, stayed on for about 10 seconds and then went off. You had to wave you hand or wiggle the sliding door if you wanted it to come on again. Of course it lit up again when you left the cubicle. Still ok: the problem was it did this when you passed too close to the door and during the night also. If you had to make a visit to the toilet during the night, you could not do so in the dark. This bright light went on and lit up the whole room ...guaranteed to wake a sleeping spouse. With us both having to make a couple of such trips, we found our sleep very disturbed. We could have stopped it by taking the card out of the electricity slot, but then that would have meant putting the light on to reset the heater Then our neighbours arrived home about 4 am with much chatter and door banging....the room was not soundproof! All in all it was very poor preparation for our long flight home, and would perhaps better suit young people who may not need to visit the toilet during the night. Sadly this room had been recently renovated, so the light was there to stay. The workmanship on the renovations appeared quite poor.

Reviews.Title: “Don’t Expect to get a good night’s sleep, but location terrific…”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: After reading the Trip Advisor reviews, I wasn’t really expecting much from this property. While it was better than I expected, I would not use my own money to stay there again. GOOD POINTS: The best thing about this hotel was the location. It is very central on Las Ramblas and close to lots of shops and restaurants. Don’t bother with the mini-bar in your room, just turn right out of the hotel and there is a Carrefour grocery store within a 3-minute walk. Renovations were good and the hotel had an overall clean, crisp feel. Duvet and pillows on the bed were fine. There was a satellite TV on the wall with lots of Spanish Freeview channels, plus a smattering of foreign channels on satellite. Shower strength was good and my room included complimentary shower gel, mini-soap, shampoo, moisturiser, toothbrush, shower-cap, shoe sponge, sewing kit and slippers (ladies take note – no hair conditioner and quality of products was poor). Front-desk staff were friendly. All of my wake-up calls were timely. Housekeeping did a good job. For a European hotel, the breakfast was very good. Lots of choice and the coffee was excellent. I felt safe in the hotel, although you must be careful in Barcelona, as pick pocketing is rampant. BAD POINTS: This was probably the noisiest hotel I have stayed in for years. The walls were paper-thin and you could hear EVERYTHING that your neighbour was doing (both next-door and above). Door slamming in the morning was also a huge problem for a restful night. However, I never heard any street noise. I found the bed quite uncomfortable, possibly due to the slippy, plastic, under-sheet (no worry about critters). It was also very hard. My colleagues who purchased the WiFi said that it never worked properly. My room was tiny and I only had a shower (not a bath and shower, like some of my colleagues had for the same price). It was fine if travelling single, but way too small for a couple. It reminded me of an Ibis hotel, but three times more expensive. As it was Mobile World Congress week, we paid twice as much for our rooms. Horrible value-for-money at 300 Euros a night. The price dropped to 120 a night on the shoulder dates, which I still thought was over-priced for the quality (but I guess we were also paying for the location). It was perfectly adequate with an excellent location – now I just have to catch up on the lost sleep. I would give this property 2 1/2-stars, due to the price / value-for-money.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: clare201102
Reviews.Content: the location of this hotel is very good! but no business center to use computer(internet) and cost of WIFI service is very expensive. excepting for it, everything is so good!

Reviews.Title: “Most convenient place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: YSKwan
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms booked for a party of 7. Rooms are all renovated recently and they are all clean and very nice. Services was good and prompt. Location of the hotel is probably its strongest asset. The metro station is less than 100 meters away and the grocery store is also a couple of meters away. If you wanted fresh fruits. You can either get them from the famous St Josep La Boqueria market which is only 100 meters from the hotel. The hotel is also smack in the middle of the shopping areas. You can still shop even into the late part of the evening. I will not hesitate to recommend this to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Ramblas is an excellent start to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Megat_Ishak_11
Reviews.Content: We Arrived at the hotel early in the morning around 645am, and whilst waiting for the room to Be Ready (Which it WAS around 12noon - MOST Their commendable as hotels allow guests to enter around 2pm) we busied ourselves by exploring Las Ramblas' busy walkway . And What an introduction to beautiful Barcelona it was! I still fondly recall my first impression of this Picturesque city, with the Las Ramblas. As for the hotel - its clean, very modern and Functioning. Great minimalist style with emphasis on your typical european understatement. Breakfast, packaged with the room is pretty decent, Offering fruits, bread, scrambled eggs, strong coffee etc. Nice start to any day of exploring. All in all I'd say this hotel rocks, Because of the hotel itself, and the excellent location Which is smack in the middle of Las Ramblas. If There is a downside, I'd Say That free high speed internet is very much needed - Who Lives Nowadays the net off anyhow? No one, thats who.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and amazing location”
Reviews.Author: JD3779
Reviews.Content: The Ramblas is located right on the Ramblas and has virtually sound-proof windows so that you don't have to listen to the mass of crowds walking below. The location is great for easy metro access and hop on/hop off bus tours. The restaurant in the hotel was great as well. Upon arrival, we were given a free upgraded room because they accidentally ran out of the standard room we originally booked. For this, 5 stars. No free wifi available, which is a negative, but who needs to be on the internet when there is so much to see! Plus, there is a Starbucks a few feet away that has free wifi w/ purchase.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room I Ever stayed In!”
Reviews.Author: metrostager
Reviews.Content: Besides being uncomfortably small, and NOT what I reserved online the staff was indifferent as was priceline. Not a good value for the price and they could not figure out wifi and again, acted as if it was not their problem.Everything was also under construction while we there which made it even more unpleasant. Left and went to a nicer hotel in the Barri Gotic.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: GroeneveldUtrecht
Reviews.Content: Ramblas View Rooms are big enough and well decorated. Bathtub is too small to actually take a bath in. I missed tea making facilities in the room ans some more TV channels in English. Now it was only news channels. Big downpoint is that I actually had to pay 5 euro for keeping my luggage untill after three p.m. That is unacceptable in a 4 star hotel! Reception staff not unpleasant but definitely not very welcoming either. Not too much noise from the street but surely not soundproof. I woke up from one of the room doors in the hall closing.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service but good tourist location”
Reviews.Author: KittyM79
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel on La Ramblas is good and bad. It is an ideal starting off point for exploring barcelona and everything you need is right on your doorstep however it is also extremely busy, a haven for thieves and really quite tacky to walk down. The hotel itself is ok. The rooms are clean and nicely designed with good facilities. The Ramblas view rooms provide an excellent snap shot of La Ramblas but are also excellently sound proofed. Unfortunately the hotel is let down by the rude service on reception. We travelled with colleagues who had their camera snatched in a local starbucks and asked reception staff for advice. They were told that there was no point in reporting it to the police as they would queue for hours, no one would speak English and they would not do anything about it. Then to top it off were told it was basically their own fault! There attitude was very dismissive. Additionally the restaurant is poor quality where you will wait a long time for substandard food. There are much nicer restaurants in Barcelona where the waiters will be nice to you. Do not pay the ridiculous wireless internet prices, at this hotel or any other. Starbucks offer free wireless for 45 minutes with every order, just ask the barista who will give you a code. There is a starbucks on every street.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Yossi59
Reviews.Content: We graetly enjoyed our stay at Royal Ramblas. It is located in the best place in Barcelona, the room was very good, and also the food and services. One reservation: the charge for internet service is extremely high: 18 Euro per day.

Reviews.Title: “once agin at the royal ramblas”
Reviews.Author: jerryg68
Reviews.Content: stayed at the royal last year before our cruise and again this year the location is the very best on the ramblas where all the action is. i highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-great location-quiet”
Reviews.Author: desertcaper
Reviews.Content: We had a Ramblas view suite & room was very quiet & nice size. Staff very helpful for the most part. Located right in the middle of all the action. W got caught in the air traffic controller strike on the day of our departure. Hotel was very helpful, gave us 30 minutes of courtesy internet time so we could try to figure out the status of departures. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what it is...”
Reviews.Author: PHCD
Reviews.Content: Absolutely avoid the "Royal Floor" rooms where yoy hit the wahbasin when entering the room...! and where the hangers fall down when you hang a suit as the plastic support is too old and out of order.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mikaamma
Reviews.Content: The Royal Ramblas Hotel is right in the middle of everything. Immediately out the front door is Las Ramblas, one of the more entertaining areas of the city. The harbor or the city center are just a few blocks away and are easily accessible by foot. Plenty of restaurants, public transit and hop on/hop off tour routes are within minutes of the hotel. The breakfast in the restaurant is OK but not like what I eat at home. Nonetheless, it was enough to keep us going for the morning. The room was European size (small by US standards) but adequate and clean. I was concerned that the room might be too noisy as we faced Las Ramblas on the 6th floor but the windows were enough to keep things quiet. I went for a long walk very early each morning and although it was still dark, I never felt uneasy on Las Ramblas - lots of uniformed security in the area. And the street performers and shops were very entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “I'd highly recommend Royal Ramblas as a base to explore Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: BrianTCork
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Royal Ramblas Hotel for 5 nights in November. Booked one of the Design View room and stayed room only so no breakfast charges included. Got a really good deal from the Hotels own website where if you booked and paid for the room in advance there was about a 20% discount, so the five nights was about €720. First off the location of the Hotel is ideal, it's right at the top of the ramblas at the plaza de catalunya end. This is where the airport bus arrives and leaves from and it takes about 30mins to get in from the airport by bus. It's also where the Bus Turistic blue and red line tours leave from, so you can be out the door of the hotel and on the bus for a day of sightseeing in literally 2 minutes. Barri Gottic is also just a 2 minute walk from the hotel. All said a really nice hotel , the design view room was really nice with a massive bed and air con, the room overlooked the ramblas so we were a bit worried that it might be noisy at night but didn't hear a thing. I'd highly recommend Royal Ramblas as a base to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the most fantastic location right on Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: deedee000
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again, the hotel is right on Las Ramblas and it's so easy to get around. Very clean and quiet hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: average1954
Reviews.Content: Good sized and modern room with double-glazed windows effectively cutting out street noise, great location. Reasonably priced if booked early on internet. But no bedroom slippers or tissues supplied - very essential as floor in not carpeted!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jimlve
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located at the "top" of La Ramblas. Courteous staff; good value for the money; well maintained. Sixth Floor Ramblas-view room with king bed and spacious bathroom provided ample comfort. Double windows prevented any unwanted outside noise while still providing excellent views.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good location and good room amenities but thin walls and dusty room floor...”
Reviews.Author: FSLEONG
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel was excellent, just a short walk from Placa Catalunya where the Aero Shuttle airport bus-stop and Metro station are. The Standard Economy Room has the washbasin outside the bathroom and in the bedroom itself, and much smaller sized (14msq). For a little bit more, we booked the Standard Double Room (22msq). These are Interior rooms, NOT facing the La Ramblas street...a good tip we got from TripAdvisor is to get the rooms facing back of building on the high floors so that you get better sleep at night without the street noise. But the walls are thin so if you had a talkative or rowdy room neighbour, then your quiet time for sleep will be non-existent. You could even hear the footsteps of leather shoes next door and slamming of room doors, but we were fortunate not to have any late night party goers on our floor. When we checked in, linens and sheets were clean and changed and bathrooms were also clean. However, the floor of the room was pretty dusty and was never vacuumed nor mopped clean by the housekeeping service although they came to make the beds and changed the towels. So by the 2nd night, I had to "mop" the room floor with a wet floor towel myself. A little bit pricey perhaps due to its location on La Ramblas, but good choice overall despite the 2 negative points mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: goldkeyrealty1
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, the personel at the hotel were extremely helpfull, with a great attitude and a willingness to assist us in everyway possible The room was inmaculate, the bed confortable, the breakfst was addecuate, with a great view of Las Ramblas. Easy to travel back and forth since is just a blcok and a half from Plaza de Cataluya. We will recomed this hotel to our family and friends, and any one that plans a trip to beautiful Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: TrueBlue53
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed for 4 nights in the Ramblas View rooms (2) on the Royal Design floor. These rooms were a bit more expensive but well worth the extra money as they were roomy and the beds were very comfortable. One can watch the crowd walk on the Rambla from the large windows, and we were just a few blocks from the Market. The front desk staff were all helpful, courteous, and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Beward of Thieves!”
Reviews.Author: thefeff
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but I was a victim of theft while in the hotel's public lobby. A jacket hung over a chair was stolen by thieves and according to the desk staff, theft is a common occurrence even in their lobby. There is but one small sign of caution near the front desk but what is needed is a BIG warning sign as such exists in other establishments we visited and saw while walking up and down Las Ramblas. Such a more pronounced warning would put guests on notice that even in the hotel lobby, their property must be protected. I had mistakenly thought that the public lobby was the last place a theft would happen it. While the front lobby is "protected" by a video camera system the only good it did was to allow me to see how the theives stole my property. Finally, the entire tourist areas of Barcelona are filled with pick pockets and more. DO NOT CARRY WITH YOU ANYTHING YOU DO NOT WANT TO LOSE!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: JMS18
Reviews.Content: this hotel was a surprisingly stylish oasis in the hustle and bustle of Las Ramblas. The rooms were well designed, nicely maintained, and generously stocked with slippers, robes, personal-care products etc. We had a family room, with a nice-sized pullout bed for my kids, and a wall separating their bed from our space. The bathroom was large, with a huge, fantasic spa tub. The kids loved it. While the hotel is centrally located, to be sure, I do not love the busy tourist-y area. On our next (third) trip to Barcelona, I'd choose something in a quieter area. But for first-timers, the location really is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “value and location”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravelNh_Usa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location on Las Ramblas and a few minutes walk to the Placa Catalunya (tour and air port busses). The service was wonderful and welcoming. I had asked for early checkin if available and though the room had not been cleaned, we were allowed to put our luggage in it and explore the city for a few hours. I booked a "courtyard" view and it was quiet. There are double windows to keep the sound out. the only negative is the sound of water that seems to funnel into one discharge pipe. Clean rooms in a modern style. Internet is very pricey at the hotel but the staff told us of an internet store a couple of blocks down the street that was cheap and we could check into our homeward flights.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: howdyhp
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! Royal Ramblas was in a prime location. As soon as you step out, you literally are on Las Ramblas and all the entertainment and shops. Every day of our week long trip, we traveled down a different path and discovered another hidden treasure. We never had to haul a cab because everything was walking distance. Just bring some good walking shoes! Our room was close to the main street, yet the noise level did not bother even our lightest sleeper. The only problem we encountered was getting fresh towels each day. But other than that, our stay was fabulous. If I returned back to Barcelona, I would definitely stay there. Good bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: orlybk
Reviews.Content: at the center of barcelona's las ramblas, we booked it through the internet and were happy to find an up to date, ellegant, clean, quiet, hospitable accomodation for me and my spouce and for my son and his girlfriend. we Had adjoining rooms which wllowed contact yet maintained privacy to all. although in the middle there was no noise at night due to very good insulation. the breakfast was nurishing and sufficient to get you going for the day. the hotel has a parking for 20E per night. all in all - great value for price!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the best location in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Tali-n-Erez
Reviews.Content: wow, we really liked this place. we heard about it from our family and decided to go there. it's expensive but deffinatly worth it: we stayed at a royal rambla view room, which was really nice and most importantly - right on the rambla (but completely quite!). the royal floor is the first floor. the room was big and comfortable. i only wished it had a balcony...hotel staff were friendly and helpful, guided us to the best restaurants in town. breakfast was great too!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RonNaumann
Reviews.Content: enjoyed the location and the breakfast on the rambla. Also very nice rooms for family and couples

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: 155019Peter
Reviews.Content: Great location near all the action. Convenient store 2 doors down is great for quick sandwich, cheese or wine. Nice restaurant in the hotel. Transport to Airport is waliking distance. Only bad experience we had was that hotel tried to charge us double the rates for extra 3 days stay, when our passports were stolen on the street on the last day. Finally we argued with desk clerk and he easily reduced by 50%. But they could have shown little sympathy and charged us proper rate in the first place

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: californiacruisechic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal for only one night. The economy room was quiet, clean and modern. The staff was very efficient and check in took only a couple of moments. The hotel is right in the middle of the action of Ramblas but is remarkably quiet. There is great shopping and you'll find countless restaurants and bars within easy walking distance. The economy room is fairly comfortable but be prepared for a very odd bathroom configuration. This layout reminded me of a cruise ship accommodations and the size was just slightly larger than most cabins. Also, the bed was a bit short, so if you're tall your feet will hang off the edge. The oddest feature is the fact that the toilet and shower are not in a separate room but are right next th the bed. Each has it's own sliding partition and the lights go on when you move the door. The the lights make a beeping sound to remind you to close the door. This could annoy some.
