In addition, the sink sits near the door and it's not easy to keep water from spilling onto the floor of the room. Everything works fine but be aware there is very little privacy with this setup. Royal Ramblas Hotel is a great choice, but I do recommend upgrading the room to superior if you want a bit more space and/or a view. If you are looking for cheaper rates then go for the economy rooms. We will definitely stay here again next time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: TbilisiKate
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, Location -great, but if you like quite place -its not for you.- Ramblas is very crowded place.If you want to be in center of everything , have little time and want to see more in Barcelona - its for you. Breakfast-really reach and not expensive. Room was completely quite with double windows. I booked via internet and as I expect that “Rooms have windows facing internal courtyard of the city block". But on check-in they gave Ramblas view -itwas wonderful. So wish you pleasant stay here and good time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, newly and smartly renovated, helpful staff with very good English.”
Reviews.Author: LaCassaigne
Reviews.Content: Great location at the top of La Rambla and we walked from the hotel to every tourist site and to restaurants. No need for a car or taxis. Room was very smartly re-decorated. Only issue was fine control of the Air-conditioning but the staff were very helpful in sorting that out. Breakfast was good value at 10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ldwheels
Reviews.Content: The Royal Ramblas is a nice hotel located in a great location on Las Ramblas. It is only a two minute walk to Plaza Catalunya as well. You are right in the middle of all the action. The hotel is also a short distance from the marketplace which is a must see. We had a room which faced Las Ramblas street but with a double set of windows, we were not bothered by the street noise during the night. The room was good, the bed was firm and the bathroom was pretty good as well. While this hotel was rated a 4 star by the Spanish standard, in the USA it would probably be a 3 star. The staff at the reception desk did speak english and were fairly helpful. I definitely would stay at this hotel again for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: CleaWien
Reviews.Content: If you search for a hotel in downtown Barcelona, go ahead and book this one. Direct on Ramblas, a partly walking area with lots of tourists, street-artists, coffee houses and restaurants, as well as shopping areas. The rooms are not to big, but spotless with anything you need for a good rest after sightseeing or going out. Ask for a room to the inner side of the hotel, otherwise you won´t get sleep. The rooms are a bit noisy (shower noise from next door rooms, toilet flushes, housekeeping rushes through the gangways...). Reception staff is friendly and speaks english fluently. Wifi is available in the hotel lobby and also in the rooms, but the prices are much to high (between 7-9 Euro for 45 minutes). A big plus would be to have such a service included in the rate or on complimentary base as many hotels already do have in middle europe. We did not have breakfast, as there are so many options to go in the morning and join local people at a coffee house. Just around the hotel is a nice place with a restaurant we highly recommend for Tapas and Sangria: Mirinda. A few more walking minutes you´ll find Carmelitas, join it. Over all we really joined staying in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: CharleyWood
Reviews.Content: I just recently come back from Barcelona where I stayed at this hotel. I found the place to be very clean tidy. The staff were excellent and always ready to help. The location was also fantastic - right on La Ramblas and a two minutes walk to Placa Catalunya where most of the cities bus services go through. It's very handy when you want to leave La Ramblas to go and see what else Barcelona has to offer. I would recommed this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noisy corridors, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: digger24136
Reviews.Content: following the reviews found on this site, i decided to book this hotel as a surprise birthday gift for my girlfriend. I was not disappointed. Both of us loved the hotel, the ONLY fault i would raise is noisy corridors, you can hear people walking past and doors banging. That said with the 2 sets of double glazed windows you get, the outside noise, remains outside. The location is fantastic. It really is. This was our first time to Barcelona. It is bang on the main strip of Ramblas, with a metro stop seconds away. We walked everywhere. Main sights off and around Rambla, up to Sagrada Familia and the gaudi buildings. I would raise one word of warning. DO NOT stray too far into the RAVEL district. More than 2 mins of walking leads you into a less than desirable area. There are prostitutes and persons of dubious character found in the alleys and squares. That said, we walked through with no problems, just a little quicker than normal. Police are everywhere, just be assertive with the street sellers, keep walking and smiling and you should be fine. We were. The other item worth noting is the smoking. It would seem most of Spains population smoke. This includes inside bars, cafes and restaurants. If you do not like smoke then i'd advise you look at the front entrance door. If there is a green+white sign with the words fumar on it, then patrons will be smoking. Red signs and they wont. Didn't find that out till the last day ! I would definatey recommend the city and the hotel!! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Koch046
Reviews.Content: Royal Rambals Hotel is in the heart of Barcelona's excitement. We couldn't have asked for better service, accommodations, or location. We stepped right out our door to the carnival atmosphere of Las Ramblas. The metro is a block away and the beach is just fifteen minutes away. Restaurants and shops are right down the street and around every corner. We'd recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but very small and noisy...”
Reviews.Author: Barufrida
Reviews.Content: Nice location but very small and noisy rooms. Air condition. Was very good. Location is awesome . The hotel lobby smells like seward water (but so does the whole city)0

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, comfortable hotel. Great location. Pick your room carefully.”
Reviews.Author: nmg34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in a family room on the "Royal" Floor. I had some nervousness about staying here as the reviews I had read before arriving had been mixed but we had limited choice of hotels in Barcelona as we wanted a family room in a centrally located hotel with it's own secure car park. My fears were unfounded. Our room was very large with a large sitting room with a double sofa bed, TV and DVD player. This lead through into a large bedroom with a massive bed. There was a bathroom with separate loo, jacuzzi bath (which the kids loved!) and a separate shower cubicle. We were able to set the room temperature ourselves as we had in room climate control. Noise from Las Rambla was not an issue. I'm not sure how the price of this room compares to the other rooms in the hotel but, having read the less positive reviews, I think we were right to pay the extra for the Design room. Staff were friendly and courteous. The car parking charge was expensive (20 Euros per night, but at least we had peace of mind) and the car park itself was most definitely an "experts only" job!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bergen_ole
Reviews.Content: Situated on the lively Las Ramblas, this hotel is perfect for exploring the city of Barcelona. We had a triple room facing one if the small alleys, so noise from the main street was not an issue. The room was large enough, even with three beds, and the bathroom was big and nice. Service was excellent, and a request for late checkout was granted immediately. Breakfast in the adjacent restaurant was a pleasant surprise, with a delicious buffet for only 10 Euros/pax. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Eowyn_Faramir
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located right on the Ramblas. The position is very convenient, right in the centre of the city and near the main bus stop in Plaza Cataluna and the underground stop, which quickly takes you everywhere in a couple of minutes.We had a very comfortable room on the top floor with view on the ramblas. The room was quiet, although on the street, modern and equipped with minibar and flat satellite television. A safe was also available in the closet for free. The bathrrom was spacious enough with bathtub and shower. Breakfast was about ten euros, so if you need just a croissant and a coffee, you would better take it outside. With two/three euros you can grab it in any coffeshop along the ramblas. Receptionists are professional and very kind. There was only a little problem with the ari conditioning: you cannot choose the temperature in your room by your self, you need to call the reception and ask them to set it for you. So the only thing you can do by yourself is to switch it on or off. Apart from this, I would highly recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean, & Modern, on the doorstep to the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Badgeman
Reviews.Content: 30 euros from the airport to the hotel for taxi, we stopped in Room 609 for 4 nights on the front of the building, it was a little noisey from outside even with double glazing. However this didnt prevent a very comfortable stay, staff were very helpful and courteous. We couldnt comment on the Restaurant as we didnt eat there. I would just have to add that the LIFTS were rubbish its just a good job it is only 6 stories high.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Goose9_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel had a great location, right on Las Ramblas. Rooms were clean and spacious for a European hotel. We booked the pre-cruise package and it worked out great. Even though our flight was over an hour late in arriving, the driver was there and waiting. Enjoyed having the late checkout as well. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, good hotel, hard to go wrong here”
Reviews.Author: captaindavebklyn
Reviews.Content: IF you arrive by plane take the Aerobus to Plaza de Catalyuna and you are really almost there. THe hotel is on the top of the Ramblas and the location is really ideal. From here you can walk the Ramblas, head uptown, walk to the waterfront, the Barrie Gothic is close by and pretty much most of the old city is an easy walk. Despite being right on the main street of tourist central, it wasn't loud and i didn't feel like I was in the middle of the noise. The room I had was basic. Nice bathroom, plenty of room, two pushed together twin beds and a small table. here's something I found out halfway thru the trip. Under the window, I had a Ramblas view, there is a pulldown single bed. So you can easily include one kid in your room if you want. The flat screen tv was on the wall facing the bed, however the only English channel they had was CCN International. THey had a restaurant connected to the hotel. We had breakfast there once. I wasn't impressed. There was a cafe just a block toward the Plaza that had a better selection. we never ate lunch or dinner there. We were waiting with friends one night and had a table and a beer, but it's not much of a place to hang out in. I wish they had a better bar. They did have a small lobby area with a few couches and chairs tho. you pay for internet service, and there was one computer there but again, they charged. The front desk staff was great. They made reservations, gave us us a European plug adapter that fit my kid's DS and were generally helpful. They switched rooms for us when we asked to be on the same floor and were helpful. The location is fantastic, the rooms are clean and comfortable and it's a nice solid three star hotel. book it with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Kduay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights at the Royal Ramblas Hotel in mid-June. I don't think there could have been a better location at any price - right on the Ramblas, the place to see and be seen in Barcelona. Our room overlooked the Ramblas and was very clean and quiet (sound-proof windows). Front desk very courteous and professional. Rooms are rather plain (no decorations on the walls) but modern and very clean. Bed was comfortable and A/C worked well. It's a modern hotel in an old world city. Definitely would stay there again. There's a restaurant connected to the hotel but it's very ordinary and not worth eating there unless you really don't care about food.

Reviews.Title: “Families Welcome at the Royal Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Ilovebostons
Reviews.Content: Initially we couldn't find a hotel to accommodate our family of 4, but luckily we happened on the Royal. We were very happy with the room, a pull-out sofa for the children, a queen for us. The service was awesome, the staff accommodating, called the IMAX for us, let us use the internet free for quick check-in, and water in the room was reasonable. If you are a family, don't hesitate, and the walk to the Placa Catalunya is easy, so take advantage of the aerobus or subway. We highly recommend them~!~~

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Ramblas!”
Reviews.Author: sharon69Texas
Reviews.Content: My familiy and I just returned back from a week vacation in Spain and stayed at the hotel Ramblas. What a wonderful stay we had! It was located right on Las Ramblas street and was convenient to everything in that area! The front lobby staff were wonderful and it was a very speedy checkin and checkout. This is one of the only few hotels we could find that could host a family of 4. If you are traveling with kids make sure you request the family plan. The rooms were great. Very trendy - my kids just loved the European decor there. Very nice and spacy for a hotel in Europe with this plan. The bathrooms were great. Nice large tub with jets which were nice especially after walking all day long and big shower. We didn't have any problem with the maids bothering us if we wanted to sleep in as some former person posted. Just make sure you put a sign on your door if you. Restaurant attached for the breakfast was not very good. I would opt to go somewhere else and get a much better one! If I ever make it back to Barcelona again I would definitely choose this hotel to stay in. If anybody has any questions in regards to the hotel or about activites in the area feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Secret”
Reviews.Author: docspeed1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online not knowing where we wanted to sightsee in Barcelona after our cruise and we only had one day. Well, Royal Ramblas Hotel is right in the center of Las Ramblas, the main shopping and center of the city activities. We arrived at 9am, well before the 3pm check in time, and they did have one of our 3 rooms available and let us check in, move in our luggage and get ready for a day of sightseeing. When we arrived back at 4 for a short break, the other two rooms were ready and check in was a breeze. One of our rooms was on Las Ramblas and was only a 15 euro upgrade. The rooms were very neat, modern, and clean. We did not eat at the hotel as we were elsewhere at dining time. The lobby was large enough for seating for 15 or so. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room in great location!”
Reviews.Author: JeffnDana
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to our cruise. The room was very clean and comfortable and the location was perfect. Right on las Ramblas and easy walking to the Catalunya metro stop. La Boqueria, which is very near, should be experienced during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: barbsb20
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in prime location,helpful staff. Bed room was exceptionally comfortable,we upgraded to one of the Royal rooms which looked onto Las Ramblas. Buffet breakfast was plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ace17
Reviews.Content: Stafff was very helpful and professional. I will return to this hotel. Shopping and restaurants were just outside. Lots of activity, really feel a part of the city here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: nick_away
Reviews.Content: Centrally located with a garage, this modern hotel met all our requirements for a couple of nights in the city. The rooms, which have been recently updated, are smartly finished and remarkably quiet, given the location. The public areas are very limited indeed. The adjacent "restaurant", which bears more than a passing resemblance to a motorway service station is adequate for the satisfactory breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: busstudteacher
Reviews.Content: Excellent location,in the heart of the Ramblas. Bus stops and subway 5 mins away. Hotel has been done up as previous reviewers have said . We stayed in a Ramblas Design view room, very comfortable, anything you needed was available in the room. Reception staff were helpful,breakfast was okay,much what you would expect. Restaurant was good,plenty to choose from, reasonably priced and was always busy - a good sign. We were also there at the time of the Volcanic ash crisis,hotel were helpful with keeping our room on and helping us with other travel arrangements. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel--great location!”
Reviews.Author: arose3342
Reviews.Content: Our second stay here. Great location--right above the bird market & just across the street from the Gothic Quarter. Rooms are a little small but recently renovated & quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: lollipoplondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the Ramblas in a perfect position, rooms were spotless, spacious and staff were friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was ok nothing fantastic but sifficient. Would definitely recommend this hotel, we found the best price through Expedia we booked about six weeks before going and found it to be £100 more than we paid a couple of weeks before going, so best to book early. Love Barcelona well worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “PRE/POST CRUISE PACKAGE”
Reviews.Author: 2TravelingTheWorld
Reviews.Content: The cruise package is perfect for anyone going on a cruise. We did a one night pre cruise. The hotel transfer was there to pick us up at the airport waiting with a sign that had our name on it. The driver was very helpful with our luggage and dropped us right in front of the hotel...perfect. We had a beautiful/comfortable room with a Ramblas view. Breakfast was included the next morning and was very good, only problem was it is too crowded for use of a buffet easily and the coffee pot was not user friendly--too slow so people were pushing. The hotel is in a perfect location for sightseeing. We were then transfered from the hotel to the ship with no problems at all. We would highly recommend this hotel and package.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and all we needed for a city break”
Reviews.Author: ShellyBerkshire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay in Barcelona. Hotel Royal on Las Ramblas could not have been better situated for such a trip. We took the Aerobus (blue buses outside terminal) to Placa de Catalunya for only 5 euros each, then it was a 5 minute walk to the Hotel. The rooms which have been recently refurbished were very clean and comfortable. We were on the first floor overlooking Las Ramblas which gave us endless hours of compulsive viewing as it is constantly buzzing with activity. The rooms are double glazed so there was no noise from the street. The human statues were fascinating - the green man on his bike with skeleton works the hardest and deserves a medal. We booked room only and enjoyed our breakfasts in one of the many cafes. Trip on the tram and fenicular railway to the top of Tibidabo is a must.. If i ever return to Barcelona I will certainly book here again. Good value stay booked through lowcostholidays.com

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, best area of Las Ramblas, comfortable and clean.”
Reviews.Author: hometutor
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a birthday trip for my 21 year old daughter and very pleased I chose this hotel. Better end of Las Ramblas, 5th floor superb views of street entertainment, extremely comfortable beds and bedding - on par with Sheraton Hotels. Superbly soundproofed, very clean and reception staff are professional and very polite. Breakfast buffet not be the best in the world but there's something for everyone and it's very reasonably priced by comparison to other eateries in the area. Evening restaurant was run at a hectic pace and had very limited vegetarian option so only visited it once. Service was very disappointing and as there's an enormous range of bars and restaurants within walking distance that serve cheaper and better food it's probably better to go elsewhere. Internet charges of 7 euros for 30 minutes are steep for slow connection. The cleaners do a good job but like to start early even if you hang the "do not disturb" sign up, no chance of staying in bed any later than 8.00 am as you're either woken by the noise of cleaning or a knock on the door to tell you they're ready to clean. Not really a bad thing as there is so much to see and do either by foot, bus touristic, bike tour or segway, it also means you don't need to set an alarm or miss the breakfast buffet which seems to be very popular even with people from outside the hotel. Beware the taxi service to the airport. When checking with reception we were told the taxi is "about 28 euros however can be more depending on luggage". We weren't entirely sure what that would mean for 2 small weekend cases and were no clearer when the taxi driver decided to round up our metered reading of 31 euros to 40 euros. At 4am in the morning we were just glad to have arrived at the airport in one piece considering the speed at which the motorway bends were taken! I would recommend this hotel, and I agree it should be referred to as The Royal as that is the name at the front that we walked past when looking for Royal Ramblas. It's frontage may not be in keeping with the character of the road, but I certainly wouldn't swap, comfort, cleanliness and convenience for character. A very good hotel - 4 star Spanish standard, 2 star restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “I will choose this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: P450
Reviews.Content: The actual name of this hotel is HOTEL ROYAL. That is the name you need to tell the cab driver at the airport. The hotel is located on La Rambla street which is always in festive mood. There are lots of shops, tapas bars, good restairants, banks, pharmacies, ATM and etc. Within walking distance are Plaza Catalunya, the Cathedral, Picasso museum, harbor, La bouqaria market, and AeroBus stop to go to the Airport. Next door is a theater where we went for flaminco show. I will stay at this hotel again. The windows are soundproofed. Price is moderate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: seyhey
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Royal Ramblas after a cruise. The hotel is towards the top of Las Ramblas and has been recently updated. Very nicely done, the room is relatively large as was the bath. I had been quoted at the front desk 520 Euros for three nights (we were in Barcelona for 1 night before the cruise as well and stayed at another hotel - more on that in another review), but went on Expedia and got the same room for $368! The staff was friendly, the buffet appeared over-priced but decent. The only downside was there was no free wi-fi. I'd definitely recommend this hotel, especially if you book through a discounter like Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean functional rooms!”
Reviews.Author: segggy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is around a 20 euro taxi ride from the airport, this includes luggage supplement strangely added by catalan taxi drivers. When we arrived at the hotel the check in was smooth however we were allocated the wrong room than the one we paid for, but the hotel corrected their mistake promptly and put us in the junior suite in the royal floor, which is an amazing room, it has 2 lcd tvs in their (albeit only 3 english channels)! the jacuzzi in the bathroom is amazing and the amenties were good quality! The hotel is right on the footsteps of la rambla, with restaurants and bars scattered all around, it definetly is in a priveleged location. the metro is 20 meters away! all in all i enjoyed my stay, perhaps the lack of any leisure activities inside the hotel hinders its performance slightly, it literally is just accomodation, but still! good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel--but AVOID the restaurant!!!”
Reviews.Author: viajenj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight before embarking on a Norewegian cruise--chose Royal Ramblas for it's convenient downtown location in the heart of Las Ramblas. Only dining option onsite is the cafe on lobby level--they give you coupon to eat there when you check in, and it is appealing because it is a buffet breakfast. Plus, with young children, who wants to go wandering around to look for a breakfast spot in the AM? However, it is SO not worth the price!!! Scrambled eggs are absolutely nasty, bacon is swimming in a pool of grease, other offerings are meager and disgusting. Probably the only safe things to eat are the packaged yogurt and dry cereal. Restaurant itself would not pass a U.S. Board of Health inspection--counters are filthy, floors look like haven't been swept or mopped in a month of Sundays, and worst is that for the 25 euros you're paying for this joint, the staff are rude and indifferent!!! Best part of the hotel is the guy, Felix, who gives private car tours in his minivan--he speaks good English and will take you all over the city in a few hours--a real bargain!! He was recommended by the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Noirc'estnoir
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Barcelona for wife's birthday at the end of Feb. 2010. Delayed for four hours at airport so lost much of first day's holiday. Got the Aerobus from Terminal 2 Barcelona Airport (5 euro single) all the way to Placa Catalunia which was just a short walk to our hotel. The bus in took about 25 minutes, when we went back on Sunday light traffic meant that the journey only took 15 - 20 mins. A note to all Easyjet travellers the bus lets you off at T2B but you must walk about 500 metres on to the T2C terminal where all the easyjet check ins are. Then when you are checked in you have to walk about 750 metres back up inside the terminal building. It's a long walk for the able bodied so if you have any motability problems beware ! We checked into the hotel and i asked for a room with a street view as the hotel sits directly on La Rambla with all its activity and acts. We wre kindly given a room on the third floor overlooking the street. Great. Thank you Royal Rambla!. The room was fine, apparently recently renovated, with wall tv, double bed, mini bar, en suite etc. The safe was complemetary which i thought was a nice touch. No trouble with deposits or charges. Room was fine. We booked B/B which was reasonable, but always crowded as the staff only opened a small portion of the room at a time, which meant that guests were cheek by jowl all the time. I suppose they only wanted to have to clean and tidy a small part rather than the whole restaurant but it managed to ruin our breakfast Travelled to Monserrat by train (stopping at so many stations on the way), took the train up and the cable car down (never again - sooo scary). It was misty on our day at Monserrat but still a beautiful place!. But that cable car, never again! Took the open top Touristic bus around the city was quite expensive but a great way to see all the city. Watched the 'Find the Lady' gang from my hotel room window. Amazing . I counted seven in the gang - two lookouts at street corners - one player - and four fake players each moving in a carefully choreographed way - making bids and winning of course - until the innocent player joins in and taken for 50 euro than all scatter - only to meet up again some time later. Prices are so expensive along La Rambla, so holding tightly onto our possessions wec went off the beaten track and enjoyed much better value in food and drink. Be careful of the pickpockets, beggars, exhorbitant prices and steep cable cars, other than that, beautiful city, friendly people, lovely weather, nice food - can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent location, with fine staff, excellent place to be!”
Reviews.Author: Eagle0077
Reviews.Content: Go to this place and enjoy the hotspots on walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Aidan5046
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here and throughly enjoyed out stay. We arrived at 12pm well before normal check in time of 2pm and were given the room as it was ready. Room had 2 single beds but was changed as soon as I asked. The rooms were clean and tidy with room service each day. The rooms are not overly large but then rooms in Europe tend to be small. Not really a problem when you are out most of the day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Didn't eat in the attached restaurant but we generally never do as we like to try different places and avoid hotel food. The location is perfect for Las Ramblas and the rooms are indeed soundproof. The airport bus dropped us at Catalunya Place and it was a 2 min walk. The Metro is 1 min away and an excellent transport system. We went to a match in the Nou Camp and were back in the hotel 25 mins after the game. Try doing that after a game in Croke Park. If going again would defintly stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Adamh34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights early Feb. Had noted previous comments regarding refurbishment works which appear almost complete (highest floors still have minor touch up works being done). Our room was excellent. The Hotel has clearly just had a lot of money spent on it & is in very good order. Rooms are modern & contemporary. Very clean. Staff professional & helpful on reception. The key to this Hotel is its location. Around 500 yards from the top of the Ramblas & the Catalunya square. Perfect for all tourist attractions, shops, taxis, buses & trains to airports. Despite being on the busy Ramblas (and our room being to the front of the Hotel) we had virtually no noise as they have secondary glazing. We paid 125 euros per night which whilst not the cheapest hotel on offer, we felt given the location it was good value. No hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION...LOCATION..LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: jerryg68
Reviews.Content: spend 3 nites prior to a cruise in late november. what a great spot...our room was the design room ...ultra modern....faced the ramblas & totaly sound proof staff was very helpfull ...we are coming back this year again highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, with greater location”
Reviews.Author: isratraveler
Reviews.Content: me and my wife stayed there for 3 nights , and took the suprrior room with a view to the ramblas. the room was new and with much space. the best thing about this hotel is the location : on the rambls, 100m from catalunia plaza and 50 meter from the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, you can't beat it.”
Reviews.Author: kevinfromaustin
Reviews.Content: Great location on La Rambla. It is on the same block as the more expensive Meridian. The room was clean and modern in designs. You are 1000 feet away from La Boqueria market, a must see place with great sea food (not cheap!!) and 200 feet away from the Metro station. Barcelona was the most interesting city to visit in our recent 14 days Spanish trip. 5 days in Barcelona seemed to be short. We didn't get pickpocketed in La Rambla, WOW. I definetely would recommened this hotel. I have only 2 suggestions to this hotel. #1: charge for internet is too expensive. Most of the 4 stars hotels offer free Hi Speed internet. For people who don't want to pay for the internet, you can go to Starbacks one block away and use 45 minutes for free with your purchase of coffee. #2: the staff could use a little more smile, and say hello to guests when they pass by the lobby. Guests are not strangers or street vendors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, but Under Renovation”
Reviews.Author: MadeByMark
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the Royal Ramblas' location, as it is right at the head of the famous La Rambla, putting guests within easy walking distance to hundreds of sights, shops, restaurants, pubs, and boutiques. During our stay, the hotel was under massive renovation, with holes punched in the ceiling of the lobby, workmen on ladders, wires dangling from hallway ceilings, and the smell of paint very common in the mornings. We were out most of the day, and the bulk of the work seems to be over by 5:00 PM each day, so this was a minor inconvenience; however, we felt that, since we made our reservations directly with the hotel, the staff should have mentioned the construction issues to us. That said: our rooms on the first floor had very recently been renovated, and were spacious and well-appointed. The bathrooms are huge by European standards, and the blackout curtains and double double-paned windows (that's not a typo, by the way -- the rooms feature inner and outer windows, both of which can be opened), so we heard little street noise, even on New Year's Eve. The staff is chilly in general -- you won't receive a sunny welcome from anyone, and there's no flexibility at all in check-in time or room selection. But when our father grew ill and had to stay in one evening, they did respond very quickly and kindly to our request for a platter of bread and butter for him (the only food he could bear to think of eating) ... and didn't charge us a thing. The rooms can be booked with breakfast included. The primary benefit of dining in the attached restaurant is convenience. The spread is the same every day: chocolate breads and sweet cakes, breads, cured meats, scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, fruit, toast, coffee, and juice. The price runs around 10 euros; keep in mind that, with dozens of great little pastry shops and coffee houses nearby, you can probably get a better breakfast for about the same price if you don't mind a morning walk before eating. WiFi is available, but the prices are high, with the hotel charging about $40.00 US for three days or 10$ for 45 non-continuous minutes. Unless in-room WiFi is critical, save money, walk down the street one and one-half block, and get WiFi for the price of a coffee at the local Starbucks. This all sounds more negative than it should. In the end, the hotel is a good value. Once renovations are complete, I think most anyone would enjoy a stay here. If the staff were more friendly and flexible, this would be a little jewel of a place.

Reviews.Title: “lots of construction”
Reviews.Author: celbar
Reviews.Content: The room was very modern and clean. Woke up the first morning to the sound of a jackhammer above our heads. Could not believe the noise. The second morning we woke to a down stream of water coming out of the ceiling. The front desk staff were very unfriendly and cold. There were other quest also trying to complain about the noise and water and we never got the courtesy of a direct answer. We were very happy to leave

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: lampltr
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel through e-dreams from Italy...arrived following morning at 0930am from main airport with my wife who was ill. Manager stated we not reservation listing that to come back 1330hrs (WHAT!!) and they would would have a room ready. Pleaded for a ready room as my wife was very week but again was stated no rooms until after 1330pm so we departed to look for another (Moderno ie Top Notch, Great mgmt & immediate booking). Reviewing bank account after 2 days, was charged $104.75. Went back to Ramblas & same manager on duty. Was upset & stated we had booked the hotel (Again was told we were not on their reservations list) that we would be charged 1 night for a no-show. Was in no mood to create a scene so filed grievance with CC company.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Le Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: andienewzealand
Reviews.Content: Our two days stay at Le Ramblas hotel was most enjoyable, the staff were extremely helpful and spoke excellant english which was a huge bonus. Very central to everything, our lovely room overlooked the Boulevard which was wonderful as we could sit at the window and soak up all the atmosphere. A wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for location”
Reviews.Author: maggie_marie76
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a good value for the location and type of room (superior view overlooking La Rambla, soundproof windows, included breakfast). It was approx half the price of hotels on the same block and I imagine the rooms were similar. We checked in early (7am) and hotel was able to get us a room by 10am. Appreciated after an overnight flight. The breakfast is 10 euros/person if you don't purchase it with your room. Fairly basic breakfast, but we found that during the off-season not a lot of choices in the area aside from Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks (both on the same block as hotel). Another reviewer mentioned about work noise being at 8am and continuing to 8pm. We did experience this in the lobby, so while you don't hear it in the room - it is annoying to walk around each time in and out (small lobby). We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL IN FANTASTIC LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: theonivaz
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel. We booked a Family room on the Royal floor, as we were are family of 2adults and 3 children. Please note that the bedding for this room for a family of this size is a king bed (two twin beds joined as most hotels) and a double sofa bed). On our request the hotel added a rollway which is not normal hotel policy but wanted to make sure that all of our children were comfortable and we thank them for that. We arrived before the normal check in time and were advised that our room was ready and waiting and we could check straight in. Our room was spotless it was modern and it was very comfortable for our family. The Royal floor also has a room called the Salon which has magazines and books to read, tea and water for us to drink whenever we wanted and tables and chairs for relaxing in a space other than your room. The bathroom was spotless with all expected amenities. Wi-Fi is available in the hotel, if you need to bring your laptop there is a charge but this is not any more expensive than any other european hotel we have stayed at. The staff at this hotel went out of their way to make sure that our check in and check out was as smooth as could be and if a question was asked they would do their utmost to make sure everything was done for you. Their service was fantastic and some of the best we have experienced. The hotel is in a fantastic location on La Rambla only 100m from the Aerobus express transfer service from the airport (dont bother with expensive transfers this is cheap and quick) and right in the middle of all the excitment of the centre of town. Placa Catalunya is 2min from the front door and from here you will pick up the buses for any day tours you may take and also for the hop on hop off bus. The Metro stop is also just a little up from the hotel and a good way to get around town. Port Vell is at the other end of La Ramblas, you will enjoy the walk down past all the street performers, without stopping it will take you 10min, with stopping well it could take you all day. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants and shopping is right at this hotels door. The only thing i disliked about the hotel was the breakfast on offer, the restaurant lets the hotel down but you have the choice to eat or not eat there and we took up both those choices. Thank you to the staff at Royal Ramblas Hotel Theoni Vazouras

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: pfuzzibear
Reviews.Content: Whilst the hotel was in a good location for shops and tours etc the hotel itself was very disappointing for a 4 star hotel. What was described as a superior room overlooked a yard, the room itself was small and dark and extremely basic- there wasn't even a kettle supplied. Maintenance on the hotel commenced every morning at 8.00am with loud drilling and continued throughout the day until 8.00pm which meant we did not feel rested at the end of our trip. The breakfast was basic and overpriced for what you got. I definately would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mojito2009
Reviews.Content: Agree with all positive reviews there is about Royal Ramblas! Highly recommend this hotel!! We had recently renovated, beautiful and stylish room with a large bed and also that opening window to La Rambla. No need to watch TV, since there is always something happening in the street. The only very tiny thing was that some noices from the neighbours room came to our room through a separating door in between (could be used as a double room). Thank you Royal Ramblas!

Reviews.Title: “Would very happily stay here again”
Reviews.Author: satisfied-visitor
Reviews.Content: Went with my sister-in-law and mutual friend to celebrate a special birthday and stayed in a triple superior room overlooking the Ramblas. Apart from being so central for everything, the hotel was comfortable, clean and the room was great. Three people sharing a room and bathroom - no problem here. Roomed cleaned and replenished every day. We didn't include breakfast as we wanted to experience breakfasts at the market, which we enjoyed. Front desk staff were impeccable, welcoming and friendly, but so were the cleaning staff when we asked for anything. We would all happily stay at the Royal Ramblas again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at the beginning of Les Rambles - the most famous street in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Addicted2TravelUsa
Reviews.Content: We had the Superior Rooms Ramblas View which have been recently renovated. They offered windows that opened to the street which allowed us to watch to street performers and the interesting crowds from the comfort of our rooms. Of course we walked much of the 1.2k Les Rambles to see the sights. The rooms were clean, modern in design and had luxurious bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Tyres
Reviews.Content: The hotel suited our purposes perfectly we were in the mist of everything but we were able to rest comfortably and quietly. The market is just a short walk away, a grocery store is just a few doors down and there are many restaurants to chose from within a short distance. We were able to tour the whole city from this area without any trouble there is even a tourist information stand just outside the door on the Ramblas. We would recommend the hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff ,Location,and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaptBligh
Reviews.Content: We purchased the post cruise package with some trepidation but to our delight the "Las Ramblas and Barcelona Experience" was absolutely wonderful !Thanks to the marvelous staff and service at this most superbly located Hotel. The rooms was nice,the bedding superb and the rooms were indeed soundproof-a necessity on the Ramblas. We Will stay here on all of our return trips to this beautiful City. The driver who picked us at the cruise terminal and then took us to the airport on our departure date was beyond courteous,polite,and knowledgeable and was a delight. The front desk staff was beyond professional and helpful without being obtrusive. Great Experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: PomNJ_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located and within walking distance to many great sites. The customer service of the front desk staff was excellent. They were there to assist with your baggage upon arrival. We were early for checkin, but our luggage was placed in a very secure room so that we could enjoy our day while waiting to check in. The room was very clean and extremely quiet! Upon check out they assisted us to obtain a taxi. I would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: blutorpedo
Reviews.Content: I can't think of anything that was bad about this hotel. The room was very clean and well furnished. It was in a perfect location to explore Barcellona and the "Ramblas".

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: CdnHotelGuy
Reviews.Content: Excellent location close to the Plaza de Cataluna where all the tour and airport buses depart from. Good value for the renovated suites, large and spacious for four. The other renovated rooms on the Royal floor are also very nice and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the most convenient location”
Reviews.Author: satyabratamukherjee
Reviews.Content: The location was superb - literally within 100m from Placa cataluniya - the heart of the city. The room was spacious, clean and sufficient for two. TV allowed us to surf English language channels. Mini bar was well stocked. Breakfast was good. Could have been better. The two lifts in the hotel were the only sore point. They were slow and noisy (one was out of order for some time). Overall a great experience and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: familyfish
Reviews.Content: Very clean, helpful and polite staff, location was second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap, but god value”
Reviews.Author: BathB
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had booked a superior room for a four night stay and had to change plans within 24hrs of arriving to bring her nine year old daughter with us. The hotel was very efficient and it was no trouble to put another bed in our room. The room was also stylish and modern with flat screen tv, air con and a good en-suite bathroom with shower. A calm and pleasant place to stay in the hustle and bustle of Las Ramblas. The reception staff were also very helpful and quick to speak english if they thought we needed it. Nice people and not one sigh or frown when approached with a tourist map!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Ramblas Hotel - Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ladylee33
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was excellent, near the top end of La Ramblas, where you walk out of the door and you are amid all the street entertainment. The hotel restaurant served the most delicious food. Tour bus stops were a 3 or 4 minute walk away from this hotel with plenty of restaurants and bars a stone's throw away. We were very impressed with the Royal Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: defone
Reviews.Content: This was nice hotel. We stayed here year ago so can't recall all the details but overall this was nice experience. Rooms were standard size, downstairs breakfast was really great. Lots of items to choose from. But definitely the best thing is the location. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The only quiet place on La Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Smithal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Design Family room - modern, clean and very large room - with partial wall between adults and kids. The sound proofing is excellent, which is a good job as the Ramblas is noisy 24hrs a day. The hotel restaurant is reasonable, but there are plenty better wihtin a few minutes walking distance, as well as supermarkets.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: ellenjSouthLakeTahoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the most perfect location for a trip to Barcelona. It is right on La Rambla where a street show goes on almost 24 hours a day, but when you close the windows, you can't hear a thing. We splurged for the room with the street view and it was worth it. We started a month long trip here and it certainly aided our excitement. The Barri Gothic is walking distance. We didn't pick up our car until we were leaving Barcelona and I highly recommend not having a car. There is a shuttle from the airport that is very easy to find and it drops you off a block or two from the hotel. The decor is modern, nothing special. The beds were just a little hard, We had the breakfast only one day - we enjoyed finding other places to eat nearby. The orange juice in Spain is fabulous. I highly recommend this hotel for a visit to Barcelona, and I highly recommend Barcelona as a place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corina_d_giurgiu
Reviews.Content: We liked the rooms and the fact that the hotel is located on Las Ramblas. Rooms were clean and quite nice. The staff was not very friendly and we had a bad experience at the La Poma restaurant one evening when we went to eat there. Service was very bad and the waiter was so unfriendly that we had the feeling that they were bothered by our presence. But there are many good restaurants near the hotel so we could eat somewhere else. In general we had a very good time in Barcelona and we enjoyed all the beautiful things we have seen.

Reviews.Title: “Desirable Location, Nice Rooms, No Service”
Reviews.Author: barcelonabiker
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located right on La Ramblas, the main tourist street in Barcelona. Rooms are clean, comfortable, and we had no issues with noise despite our location. Front desk is understaffed and there is no concierge. Average breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Amaizing Location & Very friendly Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Tinez_Tinez
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for an evening stop over in Barcelona. The location is super central, right in the action where you want to be!! Reception staff were very pleasant and helpful. Room nice and clean and quiet considering how central the hotel is and how noisy it is outside. Had a car which was 20 euros to park for the night which we preferred to pay to know that the car is safe. The car park is under the hotel and is not for the faint hearted as the ramp is very very steep so is a bit scary to drive down but as I said we knew that our car was safe. I would stay here again and was very happy with the overall experience :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: GJerram
Reviews.Content: We went to Spain on our honeymoon and stayed at Royal Ramblas for 5 days. We stayed on the 6th floor in an upgraded room, and it had all of the amenities we needed during our stay. Our room was very quiet and we heard no noise from the busy street below. The location allowed us to walk everywhere and was close to the Metro station and Plaça de Catalunya where all of the tour buses pick up passengers. Royal Ramblas is also just a few minutes walk from La Boqueria, the famous (and huge) outdoor market. This is a must-see while you're in Barcelona. The only complaint we had about the hotel was the front desk staff. They were not very helpful when it came to dining options/suggestions or other "concierge" questions. I would, however, highly recommend this hotel if you want a nice, clean hotel that provides basic services and has a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: BAFECB
Reviews.Content: Definately worth upgrading to the Royal floor. We had the Family suite which was well appointed, comfortable and sufficiently spacious for the four of us. Kids loved the whirlpool bath, the two TVs and the sound proofing was excellent. Couldn't ask for a more central hotel. Only suggestion would be to include coffee and hot chocolate sachets in the Library area, along with the tea.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnHolywood
Reviews.Content: Superb location on the noisey and always busy Ramblas . However , the room was quiet and we were able to sleep . For this reason I would recommend this hotel but we also found it very basic . There was just a lobby with no bar and for any meals you had to go next door to a restaurant . However , there were bars and restaurants within a short walk , also we ate our breakfast in the market that was about 5 minuts walk down the Ramblas towards the port.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: aprilseven
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is excellent. We arrived at 11am and they had our room ready which was great. The only negative that we had experienced was that we took a metered cab from the airport and paid 25 Euros for it. We had considered taking the aerobus back to the airport which is located really close to the hotel and it would have cost us 12 Euros in total for 3 people. However, being that it was so hot we decided to take a cab back. They told us at the desk that it would run 30 Euros and called a cab for us. The cab had no meter and at the airport charged us 45 Euros for this 20 minute, no traffic ride to the airport. Traveler beware.

Reviews.Title: “location was good”
Reviews.Author: anonymosONE
Reviews.Content: the location of Royal Ramblas was excellent. The staff were okay, not very friendly. Beds were VERY hard and not comfortable. No free internet in room think 4 star hotels should offer this. Would be nice to provide coffee/tea facilities in room and also a bottle of water. Safe in room did not work and we reported it but was not replaced and no discount was offered. No bar in hotel and the restaurant was next door. The breakfast was not cheap and the choice for the price was very very poor ate there once. Tried again at night with pizza (which was good) service was bad and felt like they did not want us there even though we were ready to order more drinks. Lots of great places to eat around hotel so suggest use them and not the hotel. would recommend it but a lot better hotels around there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TtravellerUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location - perfect for 'people watching' (well worth paying the extra for a street view room). The hotel staff were friendly. Breakfast is not really worth it - there are limited places to find for a hot breakfast though. Although on the main La Ramblas the hotel is very quiet. Was good to stay mid-week because it got very busy on the Friday night.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - would stay again - great location”
Reviews.Author: SLin96
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can not be beat. At the upper end of Las Ramblas near Plaza Catalunya. You can take the Aerobus from the Airport and walk to the hotel from the Catalunya stop. Easy. It's the nicer part of Las Ramblas. Note if it's more than 3 people - you may just want to take a taxi from the airport. We payed 20 Euros for our taxi from Airport to the Hotel (3 people) so it wasn't much more than the Aerobus. Reception let us check in easily at 10am. We payed for a triple room. It was unfortunately a double room with a rollaway bed making it a "triple". Spacious bathroom with tub and bidet. Room was on the smaller side with somewhat worn furniture but clean. I refused to pay their ridiculous Internet rate of 14 Euros for 24 hours (or 8 Euros an hour)and instead went to an Internet Cafe south of the hotel a few blocks down on Las Ramblas for 2 Euros for an hour or 30 minutes. They do have a computer in the lobby but it is not free. I would avoid the hotel breakfast which to me was very limited and not a good price at 9 Euros for hotel guests. The Pans and Company and other places around - you can eat breakfast for as little as 2 Euros (pan oglio and coffee) - I really enjoyed the Pans and Company just a couple doorways down. There is also a McDonalds up on Plaza Catalunya but if you are looking for an Egg McMuffin or Hash Browns they do not have it. Also location is great for hopon hopoff Barcelona tourist bus as 2 of the lines start there. (at Plaza Catalunya). Great location, reasonable rate - just save your money and don't eat at the restaurant (my friends ate breakfast there) as there are so many other options and avoid the Internet there. I would stay there again. I would rate it more as a decent 3 star than the 4 star rating it apparently has.

Reviews.Title: “At the heart of all the action”
Reviews.Author: mjynn
Reviews.Content: We were in Royal Ramblas for 5 nights and we were so happy we found a hotel that we know we will keep goiing back to everytime we visit Barcelona. We paid a little more to be in the newly refurnished wing of the hotel, where our rooms opened up to the La Ramblas hustle and bustle down below. We had a splendid time exploring La Ramblas and its immediate surroundings because the hotel offered us such great proximity to everything else. The rooms are huge in European standards (think Paris and Rome where you can literally step into the bathroom from the bed itself). Because the room overlooked the busy La Ramblas, the noise factor was rather high. But, we didn't mind the noise, having come from a big and rowdy city ourselves. But we can already imagine some people making a huge fuss over all the noise below. All in all, we were very happy with our choice and the hotel had all the simple understated amenities for those of you willing to explore and find your way around La Ramblas. (i.e. there's a hypermarket down the road, less than 5 minutes walk away fro the hotel and the main market is another stone's throw further down the road).

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Keninnova
Reviews.Content: You couldn't be better located at a reasonable price. It is on the Ramblas, and one block from the open air tourist buses, and Catalunya Square (SP?). The street performers are wonderful. Front desk is helpful and it is a quick taxi ride to the airport. Rooms are comfortable. We weren't right on the Ramblas, so it was very quiet. Good friends that traveled with us were right on the Ramblas and said that due to double-pane windows, there was very little street noise. The restaurant next door is OK for breakfast, but I would honestly go around and try some of the tapas bars. Barcelona is a beautiful, vibrant city that I was not expecting, and fell in love with it. Part of the overall feeling was the comfort at this small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jgdula
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the nicer hotels in Europe. The room was modern and overlooked La Ramblais. The bathroom was large and well appointed. The fromt desk was friendly and helpful. We used their service to arrange our transfers from our cruise ship to the hotel and then from the hotel to the airport and it worked without a hitch. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location And Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: ciloskik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Ramblas for 7 nights. You could not ask for a better location. East to get to from the airport (Aerobus to Placa Catalunya + 5 min walk for 4.25 Euros pp) and located in the most lively part of the city. Only steps from the Placa Catalunya, which is the most central place for designer shopping and Las Ramblas. Designer room had magnificent view of Las Ramblas action, including statutes, street dancers, etc, while providing perfectly sound proof windows. Only complaint was the bed was very hard, and given that this was the most expensive category of room, would have expected differently. Hotel staff speaks great English and is happy to help with finding your way around and booking tours. Compared to surrounding hotels, this is a wonderful hotel for half the cost (Approx 900 Euros for the week). (Use the link in the packages section for multi-night stays for the best price.) Restaraunt option - try Bello Italy on Las Ramblas for a good Italian meal with great personal service. Same side of street as hotel, about a 5 min walk toward the Columbus Monument. They have the best Alfredo! BEST part of this hotel was that it was the best location that you could ever want - even better than 5 star hotels down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good standard”
Reviews.Author: ebennike
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the Royal Ramblas. Professional reception, good English, and the rooms were nicely furnished, however somewhat small. We chose a room towards Las Ramblas for a small extra charge, which was well worth it, and nice to keep track of the funny stuff going on there all day. Paid 130€ for the room, which was not a bargain, but fair rate.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel within a few steps from the heart of all action..”
Reviews.Author: ms_aouda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Ramblas for four nights and took advantage of the "Stay minimum 4 nights, get 20% off" promotion which turned out to be a good deal. The location of the hotel is just phenomenal. Actually walking from Plaça de Catalunya to the hotel for the first time, you can appreciate the proximity. All public transport is in close vicinity; you can walk within minutes to the Barri Gotic, El Raval or to Passeig de Gracia. Occasionally dropping by at our room in the middle of the day or before dinner and taking a short rest proved to be a lifesaver. If you stay in a room overlooking the Ramblas, you won’t need any TV, just watch the action day and night without being bothered by the noise. The staff was friendly and responded kindly to all our needs. Buffet breakfast at the nextdoor restaurant at an extra charge of 9 Euros per person was satisfactory for keeping us up and going for long walks in the city. The room has all basic commodities, however, a few minor details could be enhanced, such as a few complimentary bottles of water and slippers. Excellent value for such superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Right location, right size, right everything!”
Reviews.Author: prismpr
Reviews.Content: We stepped off the cruise ship at nine AM and cabbed to the Royal Ramblas for our two night stay. When we asked if there was a chance of early check-in, we were told, "Certainly." Just 30 minutes later we were in our "designer room," overlooking La Rambla, the most happening street in Barcelona. The room was beautifully designed in contemporary shades of brown and beige with rich wood flooring, opaque glass closet and bath doors and exquisite tile. Not as large as an American Hotel but appointed perfectly and very comfortable. The double windows blocked all outside sound and were covered with drapes and shades that lowered at the press of a button. The twin beds were very comfortable and there were extra pillows and a soft throw for additional comfort that I used on the little divan set under the window. Our view was of the ever changing Rambla near the flower street vendors. Performance artists provided a constant show. I had done my research and read some negative reviews claiming noise, poor service and other problems, but not once did I encounter any of these problems. The staff was excellent, spoke english and responded quickly to any request -- even the 5 am taxi request for our departure. The buffet breakfast was adequate and discounted ($20) If I was more familiar with the area I might have eaten elsewhere. The location is ideal. A 4 minute walk to Placa Cataluna to pick up the Hop-on/off tourist bus, the subway or shopping. Across the street you can stroll into the Bari Gotic's winding streets that lead to plazas filled with a variety of shops, reataurants and museums. If you don't want to wait until after 8 for dinner try The Attic directly across from the hotel. It's upstairs and also gives you a view of La Rambla. The hotel enabled us to enjoy a totally fantastic ending to our trip and well worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a great view!”
Reviews.Author: ELR114
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights - even got a discount for staying multiple nights. Because of the discount we upgraded to a Superior room with a view of Las Ramblas - and were very glad we did. We could see the street, street performers, and all of the people passing by right from the comfort of our own room. We were a little nervous that the room would be noisy because it was right on the street, but were very happy that the room was so quiet even on Friday and Saturday nights. I am a light sleeper and didn't even have to use ear plugs once! Housekeeping was great - even cleaning and straightening our room at off times (we slept in some days and they came late in the afternoon without having to be called). The front desk was very helpful in arranging taxis, giving estimates of taxi costs to the airport, etc. Also, the attached restaurant (La Pomme) was fantastic. We ate there twice it was so good. Good food and good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent deal”
Reviews.Author: KarenTurek
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona for business but we had a chance to go a few days before to know Barcelona. My choice for Royal Ramblas was made after reading the reviews and I should say that's the hotel is a keeper! I've booked a triple room by email and I had no problems at all during our check-in. Besides some reviews that were written Royal Ramblas is a great hotel located just a few meters from Plaça de Catalunya and right in front of the 'exit' to Bairri Gòtic' The staff: Very polite and helpful The rooms: We'd stayed in a triple room with three comfortable beds; cable tv and a great bathroom. Very well cleaned room. The room was located in the 1st floor; no view from the street which was great due to the noise and we didn't have problems with cigarette's smell. The breakfast was included and was ok. No bad comments needs to be done since we were there to enjoy the trip and not to demand what we like or dislike for breakfast. A cup of coffee with milk; bread and cheese; fruits; juice and cereals it is ok, right? As usual the internet is charged and we didn't use it; but you can find lan houses at Ramblas if you don't have anything else to do besides use the internet. Overall hotel is clean, great helpfull staff and safe. If someday I return to BCN, Royal Ramblas is the choice!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay but too expensive for the kind of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: artcor
Reviews.Content: This way of charging breakfast for a night stay is too ridiculous when they reach a high amount of money. The breakfast should be included on a standard kind, and if clients that want more to eat they could be charged. Usually we need just a toast and a cup of coffee and it's much cheaper to go across the street than to pay a full meal at the hotel. We ate 4 times in the street for the amount of money the Hotel wanted to charge us for one time. I think the Hotels loose more the way they are doing. Suppose the night is 100 euros. The Hotel says it's 110 but breakfast is included (toast, milk, cereal, coffee ). People would still go and the Hotel would still be making high profit. Also, in this Hotel internet was charged (HIGH!). Clients should have it for free. Other Hotels in the near by have pool. This one doesn't. I think there is a star too many here.. We didn't have a car but garage price was high too. Corridors smelled to tobacco..and a bit in the room also, although it was non-smoking. Other than that, it's very clean, kind staff, excellent location and safe.

Reviews.Title: “too convenient!!!”
Reviews.Author: jwylam
Reviews.Content: Right on las ramblas, 5 minutes walk from the airport bus - main station at catalunya place. 20 second walk to the metro station!. though breakfast wasn't included in my hotel nights, i could easily find restaurants and cafes near by the hotel. i stayed in the superior rooms, and i must say the pictures on their websites does look A LOT MORE bigger than it really is, but it is spacious enough for visitors to sleep and just chill around. The bathroom is quite spacious, and clean, receptionists were very helpful providing free maps and recommendations. Only thing that is not so nice is that royal ramblas being a 4 star hotel does not provide free internet service. and the cost to use internet is actually quite expensive. But it is definately worth staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great position, great room, perfect service, conveniant garage. Price acceptable.”
Reviews.Author: klinika
Reviews.Content: Although it could always be cheaper, this hotel gives great value. It is everything that is advertised on the internet, and it is not what I used to see on my travels. Reservation process is easy, and I had great time in Barcelona, and great deal of my relaxation is connected to cozyness of this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “well located, service and room great”
Reviews.Author: nowvoyager23
Reviews.Content: We travelled as two single women, and this was one of the few places in Las Ramblas where a superior room had two single beds. You are blocks from everythings here, including the Airport Bus. Online photos are accurate. Large bathroom-- updated room amenities, including a refigerator to house the goodies from La Boqueria (the city market) nearby. Windows open, to supplement the air and hear. If you are noise sensitive, ask for an upper floor room as Las Ramblas attracts crowds of all ages day and night . Skip the extrra price for the breakfast in the hotel. ... there are so many other choices!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay 1 night pre 1 night post cruise.”
Reviews.Author: r00m_with_a_view
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal for 1 night before our cruise and 1 night after. Excellent location right on Las Ramblas, just a short walk from Catalunya Square where the airport bus arrives and all the tour buses depart. There are 3 types of room Petite double Standard Ramblas view. I would recommend the newly refurbished Ramblas rooms - ours was on the second floor and triple glazed so we didn't hear a sound from outside. Very smart with flat screen TV and very good quality furnishings. The front desk were very helpful and looked after our luggage after check out so we were able to have a look around Barcelona before we joined our ship. When we arrived back at the hotel at 8.00am we were able to go straight to our room - so very welcome .Next morning we had breakfast - though we did not rate it very highly. There's plenty of places nearby for breakfast - though the breakfast at The Royal was convenient. When next we travel to Barcelona we will say here again - highley recommended and a very good online rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jessandspark
Reviews.Content: We picked the Royal Ramblas mainly because of it's location, which is perfect. It is directly on Las Ramblas near Placa Catalunya and a short walk from the port. Also because it had it's own parking (20 Euro per day). You have to reserve a parking space with the hotel beforehand as they are very limited and a real tight squeeze! Make sure you get good directions as our Sat Nav got very confused as did we even though we'd been to Barcelona before. The rooms are nice and the beds are very comfortable. We had one at the back and it was lovely and quiet and after skiing in Andorra we needed a good sleep! If you want more excitement it'd be worth getting paying a bit more and getting one overlooking the Ramblas, though it would be noisier. Staff are friendly and helpful and rooms are nice and very clean. You can book directly with the hotel online and I got a special offer with them which was cheaper than through any booking company at the time, but shop around. The one thing missing for me in the room was tea and coffee making facilities. As I had read reviews, I brought my own, but it would be far easier to have them included. There is a supermarket practically next door and lots of cafe's and restaurants. Our favourite is the Hard Rock in Placa Catalunya, great fun. If you like to do things the easy way like us, get the open top tour bus where you can get on and off as you please, it's a good starting point to get to know the City. Enjoy !!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel to visit Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Lanzarote_travel
Reviews.Content: On arrival the staff at the reception were kind and efficient, everything was under control. We hade made the booking directly in the hotel website. The room was very nice big, very clean, no noise and good views to Las Ramblas. Breakfast was good too, enough for what we expected. Private hotel parking was a must at a reasonable price, and forget to look for parking around the streets! The hotel is situated exactly where we needed it to walk around the main streets of Barcelona, Las Ramblas, Plaza de Cataluña, Paseo de Gracia Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but we expected more.”
Reviews.Author: rodolfo3200
Reviews.Content: We were flying from Paris, high expectations and everyone told us the Ramblas walkway was the spot to be in Barcelona, we took the airport shuttle service to the Ramblas and walked a block and a half to the hotel entrance. ARRIVAL: Our room was ready and unfortunately it was way smaller than we expected, it could barely fit the luggage, felt like a 2/3 star hotel (in terms of size) although they claimed to be a 4 star. The staff was friendly and promptly took us to our room. HOTEL/CONCIERGE: The hotel was ok, we were served a nice buffet breakfast and they had all kinds of typical and standard international breakfast dishes. They hotel lobby was kind of dark and our room unfortunately faced nothing, just another building's wall, the air conditioning worked well though, and we had no problems during our stay, the room was small but somehow cozy. STAFF/SERVICE: The staff was alright, we didn't use much room service but the front desk was always helpful and we got great advices from them about restaurants and nearby shopping areas. LOCATION: The Ramblas are really cool, there you can actually feel Barcelona, it's overly crowded and everyone seems to be in a hurry even after midnight, there are countless typical seafood paella restaurants all over the place and you can easily reach the beach, tour bus stops and public transportation, the hotel cost/benefit was great, I would have asked for a room facing the avenue but there was no availability at the time. OVERALL IMPRESSION: Although the hotel was nice I'm not sure if I'd stay there again, not because it was not good enough, but because the location was too crowded for my likes, I prefer quiet resorts or small unique boutique hotels, for those looking for a shocking experience with endless gastronomic possibilities it's a nice choice though.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: lolostcloudmn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Royal Ramblas Hotel mid Jan. for one night before our cruise then 2 nights after our cruise. The rooms were large and comfortable with good closet space, a safe and roomy bathrooms. They had flat screen TV's in the rooms we were in! We know from previous stays in Barcelona that some people are up all night and you may hear them on Las Ramblas but you bring earplugs for that. Our rooms were a bit warm and we couldn't really adjust the temp but were able to open the window for some cooler air. We didn't take the package with breakfast as we usually just grabbed something quick on our way to a tour or explore on our own. The front desk people were friendly, helpful and fairly easy to understand (we don't speak Spanish) and we would certainly consider staying there again should our travels bring us to back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Not good and not four star”
Reviews.Author: holitimegirl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Royal Ramblas Hotel. It is anything but four star. I would say this was a two star. The room was not four star standard and there were stuffy. The air condition did not work and when I phoned down to the reception to clarify this...I was told that it did not work in the winter!!! They did however supply me with a fan - Big deal! The room door did not close correctly and you had to close it about three times, before it shut properly. Again the staff were not over helpful with assistance. It was a good location, but that really was the only thing good about it. Their website over promises. If you want a nice four star hotel – DO NOT GO HERE

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanFromDerry
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in mid Jan 2009. Got a good deal where you stay 4 nights and get the 5th night free. Really nice hotel, great location, lovely rooms, friendly staff – no complaints at all. We stayed in a room only basis and didn’t have any breakfast so can’t comment on the breakfast. I did have a pizza in restaurant adjoined to hotel one evening and it wasn’t great – not bad but nothing special. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay with an amazing twist”
Reviews.Author: gilati
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. The location can't be beat, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff extremely helpful. I left my wallet in the hotel safe after we'd checked out and discovered it when we were already on our ship. We called the hotel. They sent the wallet to us immediately, by taxi. My credit cards and cash were all unntouched, remarkable!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: GGMc
Reviews.Content: Perfect central location to explore the city and the view of Les Ramblas from the balcony was an added advantage. Great value for money. Very clean. Excellent, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: pyarem
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location. Walk everywhere. Quiet even though we faced Las Ramblas. Staff was good, no issues except with the chronic complainers on this site. Walk out the door and you are in the middle of things, 15 minutes to the sea, 2 minutes to the metro. We had a super time without breaking the bank for a hotel room. Really nice place at a good price compared to others. Our friends were totally happy with their room as well. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: crwydwr
Reviews.Content: Room was OK plenty of space but why oh why dont continental hotels not have tea/coffee making facilities? Breakfast had to be taken in the restaurant next door. Staff were not overly friendly r helpful. Location is good for La Rambla, but is more of a 2/3 star hotel in UK. Expect more from a 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “christmas weekend away”
Reviews.Author: greenff
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Royal Rambles before back in 2006 with 20 others from the Fire Service it was great then. It was just as good this time. Its in prime position 100m from Catalunya sq on Rambles when we go back to Barca we'll stay there again. Clean polite helpful loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DublinTravelgal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights in December. Great hotel and the location is superb. Found the staff helpful and the late checkout for an extra €10 is good value. Room was nice anc clean. Would recommend to anyone looking for a convenient base in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel. location and staff”
Reviews.Author: spaintraveler2008
