Reviews.Content: Royal Ramblas Hotel La Rambla 117, Barcelona 08002, Spain My wife & I stayed at the hotel 2 nights 11/16 & 11/17/2008 and found the location wonderful to sights & shops and found the hotel staff to be wonderful in helping us daily with our plans & booking our stay. We would recommend this hotel to any one. being on the Ramblas is the best. Wonderful activities on the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: RedStar13
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for 4 nights and we had a room overlooking Las Ramblas on the 6th Floor. Even though the street below is noisy the room was very quiet and also had excellent decor. The best part of the hotel is the location with easy access to all the main attractions whether you go by foot or use the Met. Staff were effecient and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ramblas Royalty”
Reviews.Author: rudeman
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing about our stay at the Royal Ramblas was that we only had one night there. It's a very nice hotel right in the heart of Las Ramblas, yet it's quiet as can be even though our room overlooked the Ramblas. Check-in was easy and we had help with our bags. The room was better than expected with a nice, large bed, a beautiful bathroom and a nice overlook of the action on Las Ramblas. Breakfast was plentiful (for 10 euros each) in the attached restaurant, where we also had a decent evening meal. Checkout was easy and they called a cab for us. All in all, a very nice stay. Again, wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Feel”
Reviews.Author: LondonGeet
Reviews.Content: We Stayed 2 nights (2 adults and 12 and 9 year old girls) at the Royal Ramblas and the whole experience from beginning to end was fantastic. We booked a designer family room on the Royal Floor (Room 10). As soon as we walked into the room it was clean and tidy. Nothing was out of place. The kids had their own TV with disney channels and we had our own. The beds were very comfortable. There was a minibar. Lots of storage space. Complementary safe and the bathroom was absolutely gorgeous!!!. The hydrobath was very welcoming after a hard day sightseeing. We checked in without any problems. There was always a cleaner on the Royal Floor who would smile and greet you as well. There was also a lounge area with books, magazines and tea/coffee making familities and mineral water which we thought was a nice touch. The staff were courteous and always greeted you with a smile. Nothing was too much for them. We didn't have breakfast included in our price but one morning when we wanted some tea and couldn't get into the lounge area on the Royal Floor as it was booked for a meeting, they told us to get it from the dining room. The breakfast looked very plentiful and fresh so it might be a bit pricey but there seemed to be a lot of choice. The staff in the restaurant were also very friendly and helpful. We would definately recommend this hotel and would definately stay here again. As far as location goes you can't get any better. You are right on La Ramblas which is always buzzing. Within 10 minutes walk you can get to the port. You must go and see the magic fountain (free). Be aware of pick pockets. Read the reviews and the scams around. Keep valuables out of sight!!! Enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLoust
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, very close to Placa Catalunya, and right on La Rambla. Getting around is done on foot, with no problems. Taxis are also readily close. If shopping, eating, drinking, nightlife, beautiful days, easygoing people, easygoing sightseeing into culture are your ideas of a great trip, the Barcelona is your destination, and the Hotel Royal is your home. Cross La Rambla and you are on headed to Barrio Gotica, Walk behind the hotel and you are outside the University. Turn to the right and you will find the Boqueria, continue down and you will be at the port. The hotel staff is impeccably professional, accommodating, and quite polite. They helped with arranging for car rental, early morning taxi to the airport, pretty much anything we needed extra assistance with. The hotel is also very clean and modern, very comfortable. It is right on La Rambla, which never sleeps. However, the windows are double-paned, and can be opened in sections. So the noise does not bother. In fact, we opened both, and still slept soundly. I recommend this hotel to anyone ready to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but dodgy area”
Reviews.Author: MarkBell
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, helpful staff, clean rooms. Was pickpocketed right outside the hotel by organised gang. Police not interested, they just watch! Take care on the Rambla, if someone approaches you be ready to defend yourself, it's the only way you'll keep your money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Ramblas!”
Reviews.Author: coollongdog
Reviews.Content: Our Barcelona stay at the Royal Ramblas was excellent! Our room overlooked the Ramblas and was very quiet...if you opened both sets of windows only then could you hear street activities. The room was warm and very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is great, easy walking access to sites, as well as bus, metro and cabs available. Even with a very wet and dreary day we were able to appreciate the view from our windows. Next time, definitely a longer stay in Barcelona and another visit to the Royal Ramblas. The Burkes

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location in Barcelona. The Hotel is average. The Staff is rude.”
Reviews.Author: MWrobel
Reviews.Content: Royal Ramblas has the best location in Barcelona. On "The Ramblas, close to the plaza Catalunia and La Boqueria. The hotel is average. Small rooms, clean but with a terrible shower. They gave me a back view room. The Wi-fi acess was not free, was very expensive. But the worst thing in the hotel was the rude Staff. When I arrived, My safe box was out of order. After 3 phone calls, nothing happened. I tried to fix it during my 3 days stay, without any success. There was a construction (and noise too) just beside my room (a neighbor building). The same happened... I called the front desk several times, and even with the promisse of a room change, nothing hapened. The worst of all: The whole hotel became out of lights at midnight. On the next day, when i spoke to the manager about all that mess, he only said: That is not my problem. It is the Light concessionary problem... What a shame... One the day before my departure, the front desk forgot to wake me up... If it happened one day later, I could lost my plane... I am giving a 4 star quotation for the Hotel, just because of the location (is absolutely the best). Otherwise, it would be a 2 star rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rewp
Reviews.Content: the hotel is right on the Las Ramblas where the pedestrian traffic flows day and night. The hotel was very clean, fairly modern. The hotel staff were very friendly, outgoing and very helpful in answering any questions or meeting your needs. booking on the internet saved us money as well. I would not hesitate to stay here again on future visits. The hotel is near the subways system, bus system and numerous restaurants. The fruit market is a couple of blocks down the street and a very modern grocery store is located 4 doors down. Overall the hotel was a great place to stay. We had a room off the main street which was fine with us. The windows are double up so you donot hear any of the noise or music coming from the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but clean, modern, good quality”
Reviews.Author: GreenwichNick
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight before a business meeting the next day. I wanted somewhere in an area that I could walk around in the hour or so I had free in the city that evening. The location of the Royal Ramblas was great for that - I was able to walk down La Rambla and then into the Barri Gótic. Room was small, and bathroom was tiny, but was clean and quiet, and decoration and fittings were modern and of good quality. Getting here from Sants station took about 25 minutes in a taxi and cost about €12. My meeting next day was in El Polígono De La Pedrosa, which also took about 25 mins in a taxi for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Right on Las Ramblas!”
Reviews.Author: rrobynec
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights post cruise with my son and daughter. We had requested a triple room, which ended up being two twin beds and a roll away bed. Our room overlooked Las Ramblas, even though we did not book a superior room. I give this hotel a above average rating, due to it's ideal location right on Las Ramblas, 1/2 a block from Plaça de Catalunya. Plaça de Catalunya, a large square, is were you purchase tickets for Bus Turistic and has a subway stop. The room itself was clean, and modern. Bathroom was large and included a shower/tub and bidet. The room also had an in room safe and mini bar. I would recommend this hotel for it's excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: kruutje
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a super location! Friendly reception which was very helpful and they also suggested a great restaurant. Comfortable rooms, although located on the Ramblas little to no noice from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ballr00mdancer
Reviews.Content: Confortable room but we would like to make some suggestions: There was only one small soap for the sink and the shower - you could supply the room with more soap!!! It was very cold in our room and there was no heat available - wonder when the heat is turned on for the comfort of your guests? Margaret Escoffery

Reviews.Title: “A Little Dated”
Reviews.Author: MerseysideDee
Reviews.Content: Would not class this hotel as a 4*, but did however stay in an older style room at the back of the hotel. Tea making facilities in the room would be avantageous considering hot drinks machine out of order during our weeks stay.Minibar a plus but expensive( supermarket a few metres away, far cheaper!) On the plus side room quiet, but could be very dull and dark, due to limited natural light. Room service very good, clean sheets and towels whenever needed. Shower awful if you have long hair to wash.Lobby area not up to standards of a 4* hotel- no bar. Buffet breakfast excellent and so too were both restaurants. Staff professional at all times.Would benefit from a make-over,but overall enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel close to the centre”
Reviews.Author: wanderingfemaleuk
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very well situated right on Las Ramblas so close to everything. The rooms were very clean and the service very very good. In all the Hotel is an excellent Hotel. The only fault was the Breakfast, NOT worth the extra money which was charged IF you ate Breakfast at the Hotel. We ate our Breakfast out after the first day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: ivernj
Reviews.Content: We chose the Royal for our honeymoon and couldn't have been happier about it. The location put us within easy walking distance of the major museums and buildings we wanted to see, and it was an easy stroll out to the Barri Gotic or the Passeig de Gracia for dinner. Service was excellent, and the staff went above and beyond to help make our stay more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location yet still quiet indoors”
Reviews.Author: samsazzle
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my partner for 3 nights at the Royal Ramblas Hotel in Barcelona. The hotel was easy to find and one of the best locations. Room was large and bright and thankfully the aircon worked as it was very hot outside. No noise at all from the street. One small niggle was the low water pressure in the shower but overall, a great hotel which allowed us a late checkout for a small surcharge. We did not eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: marrom
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The hotel is in a great location but that is probably all I liked. On arrival we were allocated a room that absolutely reeked of smoke even though we'd requested non-smoking. I was 4 months pregnant at the time and the smell made me want to be sick. We complained and they eventually agreed to move us to another room. The room didn't smell of smoke, was more spacious so we were really pleased! Until it got to 4am the next morning and we could hear two guys in the room next to us using the toilet, talking etc etc! It was awful! Perhaps we were just unlucky and got the rubbish rooms but I would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bren H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and very quiet (rather important on La Rambla). We up graded to a superior room with a view over La Rambla and the double glazing worked a treat and as a lot of the previous reviews stated, we slept very well despite being just above all the street life of La Rambla. Don't bother with the 10 Euro breakfast buffet at the ajoining restaurant, it wasn't really worth the money and the eggs tasted very weird. Only problem we had on our last day/night was drilling and banging from 8am to 8pm, despite calls to reception at 7pm requesting that they sort it out as we had come back from a long day sightseeing and wanted to catch a nap so we could see some of Bacelona's night life,but nothing was done to stop it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views of Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: TucsonDesertwillow
Reviews.Content: Had one of the upgraded rooms, very nice/modern. Looked out on the Ramblas. No noise from street as promised, yet you can open the windows if so desired. Definitely right where the action is. Don't miss the open Market just down the street, same side towards the ocean. Staff very friendly and helpful. Restaurant also very good. Restaurant is on Rick Steve's list.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: KahunaSteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after a recent cruise. I picked it for the location and was glad I did. Everything is right out the door. Stayed on the "Royal Floor". Very modern, quiet and clean room with a great view of the Ramblas. Very firm beds. Nice breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Building work taking place at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: gillsy
Reviews.Content: My visiit to this hotel took place in Mid June. We had booked a double superior room and were given a very small, dark and gloomy twin room with very small single beds(the lights had to be on all the time) Room 101 (!!!) overlooking Las Ramblas. We were checked in late at night after a long journey by an efficient but unfriendly member of staff. We didnt complain about the room that evening as it was late and we just wanted to go to bed. The next morning we were woken up with the sound of banging from above our beds. After a long, hot day in Barcelona we returned to our room to have a rest before heading off for a special meal for my birthday. No sooner had we put our feet up and the drilling and banging started and this went on for several hours. When we could stand it no more we left the hotel (at 7.35 pm) despite our restaurant booking not being until 9pm. I had been down to reception to request that we change rooms (to a double room as booked and to a quieter location) and to ask about the noise. I was told by a very rude male receptionist ( he answered the telephone interrupting our conversation and didnt bother to apologise after he continued speaking to someone else for several minutes )that I should ask in the morning as there was nothing he could do that evening and that the noise was due to the third floor being renovated and some problems with the water pressure and the drilling, banging etc did not start until 10 am each day and finished by 6.30 pm. Both of these facts were untrue. It is clearly unacceptable to still be making this amount of noise during the evening when guests are returning to the hotel and have paid a lot of money to stay in this location, in what is after all meant to be a 4 star hotel with a price tag to match. This receptionist then merely shrugged his shoulders at me when I told him that we were not informed that building work was taking place at the hotel when we had booked only a week before as we would not have considered paying this amount of money to have this noise the whole time you were in the room. I was really upset by his attitude and went back to the room very angry and tearful .Even something small such as the offer of complimentary breakfasts to make up for the noise would have gone a long way to making up for the inconvenience and upset that we had encountered. I would not stay at this hotel again or recommend it to others despite its fantastic location because customer service is clearly not a proirity here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: PlymouthSurgeon
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location - a few minutes walk from the Airport Shuttle bus-stop at the top of Las Ramblas. Friendly helpful staff. Room very comfortable & great view over Las Ramblas (We'd paid extra for the room - it was worth it) We also paid extra for Buffet Breakfast which was great value & meant we didn't need lunch (Just a big Icecream). The area the Hotel is in is superb - very lively. Would have liked Tea / Coffee making facilities in the room for the price, but you could get a reasonable coffee from a machine in the foyer for a euro. A bar with a TV would also have been nice to watch the Spain - Italy Euro match in comfort. Thought 5 euro to store our luggage on the day we left (Flight @ 2230) was a bit mean. These however are minor niggles (& stop the Hotel getting an Excellent rating) & both My Wife & I would thoroughly recommend the Royal Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Royal Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Pearly7
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Royal Ramblas Hotel was a very pleasant experience. We had a front room which was fantastic. Did not hear any noise due to the great soundproof windows. The hotel was also very clean, staff were extremely helpful and the breakfast was fantastic. The location was superb - right on the ramblas. Would really recommend this hotel and it is worth the little bit extra for a front room. You need not look any further!!! There were no negative points and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LouisianaYankee23
Reviews.Content: We took a cruise this month in the Mediterranean which left from and returned to Barcelona. In searching for hotels online, I found the Royal Ramblas. It sounded good from the description; the reality was even better. First, it's right on las Ramblas, the street that extends up from the harbor and is host to hotels, cafes, restaurants, flower and pet sellers, and strollers at almost all times of the day and night. Second, the room was modern and very clean with a comfortable bed and excellent room service. Third, it's about a block or so from the Placa de Catalunya and the bus turistica that takes you all over the city, as well as a major department store, several great cafes for breakfast, tapas restaurants, and some Gaudi buildings, an ideal location. If you can, get a room that overlooks las Ramblas. The people at the desk were very helpful and friendly. All in all, a great experience...and we can't wait to go back to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: ElliottWestSussex
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 'Royal' Twin Room. Very comfortable with wonderful views of The Rambla. Access to lounge with tea-making facilities. Good buffet breakfast. My husband left his radio in the room and this was forwarded on to us the very next day for the cost of the postage. All-in-all a wonderful three-day break in an hotel in a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “incredible hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: cadiz001
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was just incredible. The room was bigger than I expected and very clean and well kept, and so was the bathroom. The staff was very helpful and courteous, the housekeepers always did an great job, and you just can't beat the hotel's location right on the ramblas. I had no need for taxis or the metro as everything is within walking distance from the hotel. I am definately going to stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: babsNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: I have just returned form the Hotel Royal after a trip with my mum. I stayed here 3 years ago with my husband and son and was dissapointed that our room was not over looking the Ramblas, as it was last time. The room was small, overlooking a wall, it was v dark and you could only see what the weather was doing outside by opening the window and literally sticking your head out!! There were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room which should really be standard in a "4 Star" hotel. The shower was not very powerful, however the bathroom was spotless as was the bedroom. The room was nice and quiet at night for sleeping. Staff were very pleasant. The best thing about the hotel is the location. We didnt use the resaturant for breakfast - we used the cafe across the street (Moko) which was €2.80 for coffee and toast, lovely sitting outside eating breakfast watching all the traders getting set up the day. Hotel is also brilliantly placed to get the airport bus, it stops at Placa Catalyuna (beside El Cortes Ingles), it only costs €4.10 one way and was v quick - 20 minutes and goes every 20 minutes. All in all its a good hotel but definately not a 4 Star by UK / USA standards, however if its only a clean, safe, quiet hotel in a great location then its ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel - great value and service”
Reviews.Author: SeriouslyLinda
Reviews.Content: We arrived early morning from a lovely cruise. We were surprised that our room was ready at no extra charge. The person at the desk helped us with our very bulky luggage. The breakfast (not included but a value at 9 euro), was superb except for the literally raw American style bacon. The room was quiet with not just a double paned window protecting from the noise of the Ramblas, but two separate windows on either side of the casing. The room itself was not 4 star by US standards - it was small with a view of an adjoining rooftop. But the location - literally ON the Ramblas, with none of the noise, and the friendly, kind, family-style service, was 5 star-5 diamond. We paid 145 Euro, in mid May, which we thought was a good value. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location!....but.....No definitive lounge/bar area.”
Reviews.Author: Lindango
Reviews.Content: My partner & I, together with our 13 year old daughter, stayed at The Royal Ramblas for 4 days in April 2008. We had a family room of three single beds. Great room with lots of space, storage & spotlessly clean. Unfortunately we were in a room at the back of the hotel which didn't overlook The Ramblas so our view (literally) was a brick wall. We decided not to upgrade to a 'Rambla' view as we were out & about all day anyway. An upgrade would be worth considering if you intend to spend longer periods of time in your room however. We were in Barcelona at the time of the Manchester United semi final Champions League match against Barcelona. My partner & daughter were very disappointed that the hotel did not prescribe to the tv channel broardcasting this match - something to think about if you're a footy fan & want to watch a local match on tv in your hotel room. Our only negative comment about this hotel is that there are no designated, private & comfortable lounge, bar & restaurant areas. These are through a sliding door to the restaurant & bar next door - 'La Poma'. The food here is very good but expensive - it is also open to the general public & this distracted from the cosy intimate atmosphere of the quintessential lounge/bar we expect of a 4 star hotel. Overall, a good hotel but we have have stayed in better 4 star hotels. Probably wouldn't stay here again but only because of the lounge/bar/restaurant arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: BizarreDub
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights on the way back from Ibiza. Great room, we had a 'Designo' double as there were no suites availble, but the r0om was excellent, as were the desk staff. No bar as such in the hotel but it's right on the Ramblas so this isn't really an issue. Only (very slight) blight on the two nights was the grumpy little fellow who brought our wine to the room!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary on Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: ageing-urchin
Reviews.Content: The hotel certainly lived up to being a 4-star. The rooms were excellent, warm atmosphere,nicely decorated with real wood finish, so refreshing contrast to usual modern format. Well appointed bathroom. Service was good and very helpful, room service being efficient with low friendly profile. Air conditioning ensured a comfortable room temperature, easily adjusted to individual preferences. Our rooms (3rd Floor) looked out onto the Ramblas but the windows kept out virtually all the noise from below, but when opened allowed a pleasant view on the antics below, a nice way to settle on our Spring evening! We had breakfast each day in the hotel, which was an excellent self-service buffet, which set one up well for the day. With the numerous restaurants nearby, a relaxing stay (5 nights) was easy. Would certainly go back to the Royal, and thoroughly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel in a Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: rustygWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Royal Ramblas Hotel and found it to be everything proclaimed on their website. Staff were helpful and friendly. The location was excellent. Having booked a room overlooking the Ramblas, we were not disappointed. The hustle and bustle during the day was fabulous. The atmosphere until late in the night was unbelieveable. Breakfast was very good value and had a superb choice of food. We would have no hestitation in recommending this hotel to anyone travelling to Barcelona. And we would most definately stay at the hotel if we were to return to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Las Ramblas Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kinderteacher4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location to experience Las Ramblas. It was in the center of all the good hotels and restaurants. It was close to museums and historical churches. The hotel staff was friendly and spoke English. The room was a little small and the beds were small too. I think that is just the way they are in Spain. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: winequaffer
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a great city. The staff were friendly, and spoke english well. The restaurant was decent for in-hotel with a great breakfast. The air conditioning didn't work too well but it was very hot while we were there. The location was fantastic. We could walk to all the action and fantastic restaurants. Would highly recommend the hotel and the city.

Reviews.Title: “great Location”
Reviews.Author: JoanNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: After i had booked Royal Ramblas was a bit worried, because it had two bad reviews in February . I need not have worried, yes one of the guys on receiption was not pleasant, but so what, he was the only one. The hotel is ideally situated at top of Ramblas, great for arriving late at night when your not sure where to go. Breakfast was great! it was included in our package, room we had was spacious although it was situated at back of hotel, but i had requested a quiet room and thats what we got. Would stay here again, hotel is spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moshee
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 4 nights - special treat for my husband's 50th birthday. Thought I would go the extra for somewhere special as the occasion was special. What a mistake!! Reception area was minimal, bedrooms were very small to say the least. Yes there was a lovely big bed there - 4* bed - that was all. I was so disappointed. Complained at reception - he said I had the 'superior room' - God help the ones booked into the normal rooms!! Overall, it was a 2* Hotel and definetly not anywhere near a 4*. The location was perfect, and to be fair, the hotel refunded me the next 3 days, as there was no way I was staying there any longer. Ideal hotel for young couples - that's it & much too expensive also for the poor quality.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Hotel - Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: DJB_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location if you want to do the whole tourist thing around the Ramblas. It's located right on the Ramblas near the Placa de Catalunya and within easy walking distance of the Born area and such like. The cost is about what you'd expect to pay for the location. I stayed in one of the small double rooms. It was fine as you don't really go to Barcelona to stay in a hotel room. The rooms have most of the standard facilities and are clean and comfortable. I've stayed in this hotel on a number of occasions on business trips as well and the staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bully1959Canaries
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in terms of location. On the rambles close t o restaurants and bars and local sites. Bar is small and not good for socialising. Rooms excellent good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: momonorth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is supposed to be four star - not in my world it wasn't! The staff were surly on the desk and the rooms were dismal. The bed had a plastic undersheet that russled every time you moved and made you feel like you were staying in a care home for the elderly. My room was too hot the air con wasn't switched on and on opening the window for air the room stank of frying bacon from the kitchen I suppose. I complained but was told there was absolutely nothing that could be done. I got no sleep as the next door room were obviously rekindling their love life and the sound proofing was non existent. I had the pleasure of visiting the hotel's restaurant - though restaurant is not what I'd call it. The staff were even more repugnant and the pizza I had was unbelievably bad. This whole experience cost 250 euros for two nights - my advice is don't ever ever ever stay at this hotel it was a revolting experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: mrsm2007
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay at the Royal. We are frequent travelers and a bit fussy, but I booked this hotel based solely on the reviews on Trip Advisor and hoped that the reviews were accurate. We could not have been more pleased. We booked a Designer Room on the Royal floor (2nd floor) with a perfect view of the Ramblas. There were double proofed windows so there was absolutely no noise from the street. The location could not have been more perfect, and the staff was extremely helpful when approached with a question. The hotel was immaculate and the shower was amazing! If you are on the Royal floor, you get the benefit of free wireless, which worked for us because we brought our laptop. There was nothing that we felt the hotel was lacking in. We had breakfast in the hotel one morning and although I felt that it was a bit on the expensive side, it had quite an extensive selection of well-prepared food. I can't say the same for the dinner that we had in the hotel one evening. It was really quite mediocre. Try "The Attic" for dinner. We thoroughly enjoyed it, as we did the tapas at a restaurant called ""Tramoia" which was a short walk away. Both are a little bit pricey but well worth it. We love Barcelona and the Royal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Rooms! Good Service!”
Reviews.Author: kambbado
Reviews.Content: We had 2 connecting rooms overlooking Las Ramblas. Our rooms were large, clean and well maintained. The location is perfect. Easy walk to everything. Great restaurants! Next to the hotel is a little restaurant that serves good draft beer and great sandwiches at a reasonable price. I enjoyed visiting the St Joseph Market (St Josep Mercat - La Boqueria), a 3 minute walk from the hotel. Try the Passion Fruit Gelato. Barcelona is famous for it's Paella, we had the best Paellas for lunch at Barnabier by the water.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: NellBolton
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel blind from about 40 on the web. What a great choice, small friendly hotel, directly on Las Ramblas; central for everything; near to the buses, shopping, markets & shore. We booked B & B - the breakfast was great, just what you need for a day's site seeing. They have a restaurant attached which is good value, plus there are numerous restaurant of varying prices in the surrounding areas. Ask for a room at the back - so quiet! - those overlooking Las ramblas may have the view - but also have the noise until very late at night. The room was fine, comfortable bed, en suite with all the expected soaps, shampoos etc. We would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: IndianaTravelingal
Reviews.Content: I had a most pleasant experience while staying at the Royal Hotel. Check-in was Nov 30th and they had a room available for my early arrival. The front desk staff , as well as the bellman were friendly and spoke English. The room itself, tho a bit narrow, was clean, providing twin beds, a table with 2 chairs, ample closet and shelf space, a safe, and a refrigerator. The frig was filled with various drinks and snacks. The only problem was if you wished to purchase your own water and store it inside, they would remove it. Did not like that. A televison was also available but I did not turn it on so can't comment on what was available for viewing. The bathroom was large enough with a nice tub/shower, good water pressure with plenty of hot water, nice sink area with room for personal items, and a hair dryer. Computer access was wireless and easy to use. You could buy minutes or get the daily plan, which was the most cost efficient. Naturally you would need a converter if you are from the states. The hotel was definately convenient to Los Ramblas, which was right out the door. Tho my room faced that street, the noise was minimal even with the window slightly open. I was located on the top floor so that may have helped cut down on noise. The hotel was also convenient to the subway system, restaurants, shopping (with a grocery store just a few doors away) and to the port, which was where I would be headed after my stay. The only drawback is the lobby area. It is on the narrow side so at check out , it was a bit tight with many people attempting to leave at about the same time. To their credit, the bellman did hussle to get everyone a taxi and on their way. The price I paid was about $240 per night. Some might think it was too high or maybe a better deal could have been available through a *cheaphotel/priceline* site. I was ok with what it cost. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location-location-location”
Reviews.Author: pabell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here Nov. 29-Dec3,2007. We arrived on the A1 bus from the airport for 3.90 Euros per person to a bus stop at the head of Las Ramblas. About a 5 minute walk. This hotel was perfect for our needs. Book a room facing the street. There is a supermarket 2 minutes downhill from the hotel. The only downside is the 2 twin beds pushed together to form the bed. It is clean and the staff was wonderful. We left our luggage behind after checking out to tour the city until boarding our cruise ship. Beware Americans, our dollar is worth almost nothing in Europe. A Miller beer costs $7.50. The room was over $220 a day. Go anyway, Barcelona is The most beautiful city we have seen. Get a two day pass on the tourist bus to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing Viewl”
Reviews.Author: Wood7
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from The Royal, and were very disappointed with our room, we were situated at the back of the Hotel, so just looked onto other rooms. (I know someone has too), but request front facing rooms. The bar area was poor, as other reviews have suggested, and also the lack of Coffee/Tea facilities would suggest its not really a 4 star hotel. Also the inability of the night time staff to order a taxi was disappointing, The location of the hotel is ideal, with easy access to many bars/restaurants, turistic bus etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for week end break”
Reviews.Author: honeyMalaga
Reviews.Content: Never been to Barcelona before but booked this after much research. We had booked a room overlooking La Rambla and no noise! even though it is always busy. Hotel close to tour buses, bars, restaurants, tapas bars you name its there. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, rooms exactly as photography on their website, always plenty of hot water, very clean and our room was ready even when we arrived earlier than we had specified. Didnt use the restaurant as so many other places so closeby couldnt try them all in the limited time we were there. Would definately recommend this, a good 4* hotel in an unbeatable location, with easy links from airport.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel on the ramblas”
Reviews.Author: jimmicks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in a superior room, which I found to be excellent. The view from the room was good, and there was no noise from the ramblas due to the excellent double glazing. The room was kept immaculately clean and fresh and sheets and pillow cases were changed daily. We could make tea at any time as there was a facility room adjacent to the corridor where there were tables, and books etc left presumably by fellow travellers. Staff were efficient and friendly. The hotel restaurant, was open to the general public, and although the food was good, being a very busy restaurant, staff made no difference between residents at the hotel and people dropping in from the street. There is a lovely local type restaurant, which served good breakfasts and meals, at a very reasonable price, in the street to the left directly opposite the front door of the hotel. The restaurant was named SantAna and was aprroximatley 100 metres along that street on the right hand side. The hotel could not be more central or easier to reach from the airport. If you are lucky enough to have one of the rooms looking on to the ramblas, see if you can spot the team of about 10 people, who operate the the scam with the domino type game. See the slim man with baseball cap leaning against the traffic light outside the restaurant window, and the man who leans against the tree at the other side of the street. They are lookouts..See if you can spot the blonde and brunette who pose as holidaymakers but stop to play the game as if by chance. Then there are the players themselves and their other lookouts. It can be fun watching them and how quickly they disappear when the police appear

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Whittierjames
Reviews.Content: Great location! Right on Los Rambles. Our room looked out onto the street. Staff very efficent and helpful. Easy walk to the hop on/hop off buses for touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: sharper126
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Royal Ramblas is a beautiful hotel in a great location! It is right in the middle of the Ramblas and all of Barcelona's best action. We were able to catch a tour bus just a couple of blocks away, which took us to all of the city's best sights. Great breakfast, too! After our stay, we were able to take a short taxi ride to the port, where our honeymoon cruise left!

Reviews.Title: “loved the royal”
Reviews.Author: smokey629
Reviews.Content: hotel is in excellent location on La rambla ---close to everything to see and transportation. room was attractive, clean, adequate size and very quiet even though faced on La rambla. restaurant was convenient and good for all meals though lots of small restaurants in area provideding easy access for meals. Desk staff very helpful and pleasant---would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed the Royal Hotel Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: World_Travelers8
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Barcelona before so we had to guess where a good location would be. I searched centrally located hotels using a tour book map. Las Ramblas seemed a good location for sightseeing throughout the city. I found the Royal Hotel in a list of hotels on a travel website. Using the hotel's own website (which was very good), we decided this hotel would be where we would want to be. We were a little concerned about noise being right on Las Ramblas, but the hotel ensured that the windows were double sealed. The Royal Hotel far exceeded our expectations. The location was absolutely perfect. We took the express airport bus from the airport directly to the Playca Catalunya which was only a few blocks walk to the hotel. The checkin was very easy, and having just endured an overnight flight across the Atlantic, we were very pleased to be able to checkin earlier than expected. The room itself was very nice (it could have used more drawers for clothing) and the bathroom was nice too. Our room looked directly onto Las Ramblas and we truly enjoyed watching the constant parade of people at all hours of the day and night. The hotel was correct in that the room was well insulated from noise, considering the location. We opted to include the daily breakfast downstairs each day (for 9 euros per person per day). It was a great selection of food and the service was good; everyone was very nice. One evening, after a long day of sightseeing, we even used the restaurant for dinner (really good pizza). You can't beat sitting at the big windows overlooking the parade of people on the street and across to Las Ramblas. We would stay here again and recommend it highly to any visitors to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: sven-gnome
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Royal is a wonderful choice for a short vacation in Spain. It's location is within walking distance of the Picasso, Chocolate and other museums. It is also very close to the Playa du Catalanya which is where the main bus tours of the city begin. The only glitch was a little bit of trouble with the deadbolt on the door. Otherwise, the reception and other hotel staff were excellent. They gave us recommendations for nearby bars and restaurants which were excellent choices. The room was clean, spacious by european standards and well appointed. We had a wonderful view of Las Ramblas which is a cultural experience in itself. We will stay there again on our next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, i suggest it”
Reviews.Author: claudio_climb
Reviews.Content: Great location., at city center on Rambla near catalunya square. Visit the city from this hotel is easy, Transport facilities like underground (6 lines) and bus stops are along Rambla near the hotel. Rooms are large and clean. Reception services are good, you can leave your luggage in hotel after check-out without problems (your bags will be stored in a closed room and identified by a personal number). The restaurant is lightly expensive but nearly there are several kind of restaurants (Tapas bar, pizzeria, ecc.). Great hotel,I'll return.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SwedenTurist
Reviews.Content: I stayed 8 nights. The position of the hotel was excellent, close to a supermarket and all the stores. Nice and professional staff. I did not hear much from the La Rambla streets, but sometimes from the neighbour next door. Do not eat at the restaurant, you will be very disappointed, no one finish their meals there. The breakfast is ok, but very expensive (9 euros for each person). Do not eat at restaurants located on La Rambla. I would go back to Royal and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: juhanims
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights with my family in Royal Hotel. Over whole the Hotel services was very good. Being in the Ramblas the location is excellent for family stay. The only complaint we had was the Beds Mattress was not 4 stars hotel quality. M. Aljuhani, Saudi Arabia.

Reviews.Title: “A Boutique Jewel”
Reviews.Author: SATX2
Reviews.Content: With only 2 days in Barcelona after an 11-day tour of Italy, we decided we wanted to stay right where we heard the action was in Barcelona. Though it was a little pricey, we settled on the Royal Floor of the Royal Hotel. We can't speak for the rest of the rooms, but these boutique-style, modern rooms with large windows overlooking Las Ramblas were wonderful. Even though people are streaming down Las Ramblas at all hours, there was no problem with noise. The rooms were very clean and clean smelling. The beds were comfortable. The huge shower was amazing. Free high-speed Intenet access (free, I think, limited to the Royal floor) was an unexpected amenity. The adjoining restaurant had a nice breakfast buffet for about the usual you would expect in the US (9 euros, 5 for kids). Being an early riser, my only complaint was that the restaurant opened at either 7 or 7:30. Fortunately, they provide a vending area just off the lobby that has an excellent coffee vending machine. The desk clerks were helpful when we needed to find a particular sightseeing spot, providing maps and directions. Aside from the great experience at the Royal itself, there are many places to eat, drink, catch a tour bus, withing walking distance. We would definitely stay at the Royal again, and on La Planta Royal (the Royal Floor).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location on The Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Helsinki16
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on the Rambla. Walking distance from Catalonia Square and the beaches, PIcasso Museum etc. Nevertheless no noise at night. Clean hotel with very good breakfast buffet. Clean room and extreamly tidy bathroom with marble walls and floor. Water came and went very well. "I'll be back".

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4-star hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nul
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in Royal Hotel. The hotel website where we booked shows quite a modern hotel with spacious rooms but does not show the true picture. When we booked our room was shown as a standard room. There was barely enough room for the bed and table. There was one window in the room but the only view was the building directly beside the hotel - it was impossible to tell whether it was night or day - the room was so dark. I do not understand how this hotel warrants 5 stars - I have stayed in better BandBs.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: ChesterBirthdaygirl
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel makes it perfect for a weekend stay. We had a superior room overlooking las ramblas, that perhaps didint warrant the 'superior' title, but nothing to complain about. being so close to catalunya square meant the taxi rank, metro and bus stop for city tours were literally two minutes away- we opted for a 10-ride metro ticket at 6 euros to get around and couldnt fault it! we ate at the adjoining restaurant one night, and it was nothing to write home about- its worth venturing off the ramblas for cheaper and more authentic food, but the royals location means that everywhere is easily accesible. would return there for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LofAyr
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Royal for 1 night pre-cruise. This property was everything it claimed to be. From the moment we stepped out of the cab and were welcomed by the doorman to the time we checked out the staff were pleasant and very helpful. We had requested a nonsmoking room overlooking La Rambla. We had been warned that European hotels had different standards to those in Canada and the US. We were pleasantly surprised to find our room to be spotless and a good size. The new double glazed windows eliminated all sound to our third floor room from the street below - yet provided a wonderful view of the carnival like atmoshpere of La Rambla. Ideally located on La Rambla, we were able to walk to Port Vell, The Barri Gotic and Placa de Catalunya. Before we left on our vacation we received a "welcome" email reconfirming our plans and upon arriving home had a "thank you" email. Something we have never had from hotels before!! We would return to Hotel Royal without hesitation!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Royal...”
Reviews.Author: haysi_fantayzee
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Royal Ramblas in May. We found the hotel on Tripadvisor and advised our travel agent to book. We could not have picked a better location. Right at the Northern end of this legendary boulevard, access to the Gothic center, the best artisan and designer shopping plus the central produce market, is all within a ten-minute walk The hotel was mostly good. We felt that the room was a little small but was kept scupriously clean. The breakfast buffet was among the best of the sixteen hotels we encountered on our tour and as it is located on the ground floor, right on the street, feels like a proper café. We especially liked the tortilla. Not many hotel kitchens offered food form the region for breakfast during the tour. A tip for eating in Barcelona - be wary of any of the restaurants on the Ramblas itself. Much better option is to venture a little into the side streets. You do not have to go far to experience excellent offerings. Do visit the Market for a look and breakfast or lunch – lots of fresh fruit salads and juices plus all the Jamon and olives you can eat. Overall a very good hotel and efficient front desk staff who had good English speaking skills.

Reviews.Title: “A central and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: AESCH
Reviews.Content: I have visited several times this property and must say that I have always been pleased. Room not huge but pleasant and in a good state of repair, everything was working. Bathroom quite adequate. Bar is very nice and the barman knows his job. Staff quite pleasant, helpful and knowledgeable. Excellent buffet breakfast. No restaurant but the one next door is quite good, food and service more than acceptable and reasonable pricing. The location is quite good but I do not like driving in Barcelona, finding a parking space etc and have opted now for hotels outside Barcelona, but this has nothing to do with the ROYAL. ALL IN ALL I WOULD CERTAINLY RECOMMEND THIS PROPERTY.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: travelthree
Reviews.Content: Very central hotel with helpful staff ideally located to explore sights of city. Metro entrance & Tourist info booth right outside and 2mins from tourist bus starting point. Easily able to walk to the Port area and Gaudi's Casa Batlo in short time from hotel. Stayed in a lovely medium room with no view but we were out and about more often than in hotel! Large bathroom with great shower and walk in wardrobe with safe. Breakfast was simple continental at 9euro each while watching the street performers warming up. Restaurant in evening was little overpriced but loads of other places nearby including Attic opposite (yum!) & Les Quinze Nits and Taxidermista are 5min walk away beside a couple of lively Irish bars in Placa Reial.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ciaomishi
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful location on La Ramblas. Really enjoyed our stay here and found the staff to be most helpful. The room was acceptable and clean. Highly recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, first impression not so good, but don't be put off by this”
Reviews.Author: SolihullRainman
Reviews.Content: When you walk into this hotel the first impression is disappointing. There is a lack of public space in this hotel but you are right at the top of the Ramblas so pretty much everything you need is close by. The location is fantastic and the room is clean and the furnishings are of a good standard. The bathroom was spotless and kept that way throughout our stay. There is no tea making facility in the room and room service finishes at 9.00pm so you are unable to get a hot drink in your room. Once you get used to this you take care of your needs before going back, but it would be nice to have this facitity for the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: LancashireRover
Reviews.Content: We took a short city break in Barcelona last week and selected the Royal primarily for its location but the hotel more than met our expectations in every conceivable department.. At the top of the bustling Ramblas, between the beautiful Barra Gotic and the more sensory Raval district, with the Mediterranean at one end of the street and the main transport hub of Playa Catalunya a few steps away at the other, the location is indeed unbeatable. Though residents have all the activity they can require right outside the front door the hotel is a haven of peace and tranquility. The staff were unfailingly courteous and helpful, the ambience was businesslike yet informal, the furnishings were top-notch and the view from the high floors (we were right at the top) was fantastic. On a short break and with a multiplicity of dining options available nearby - the seafood in the Port Olimpic area was a particular magnet in the evening - we unfortunately found only time for one breakfast at the hotel but it was first class. The city of Barcelona is far more beautiful than I expected and three nights was simply not enough. We plan to return later in the year and we now wouldn't consider staying anywhere other than at the Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Royal disappointment”
Reviews.Author: PreciousBob
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I booked a three night stay in Apr 07 at the 4 star (?) Hotel Royal on Las Ramlas. It worked out cheapest to book directly with the hotel via the website however we feel, after staying, that the hotel is over-priced and over-rated. In our opinion it should only just scrape a 3 star rating. The hotel is bland and unwelcoming although the reception and housekeeping staff were friendly. There are absolutely no facilities within the hotel so you really are just paying for a room. The tv was old and could only pick up one English speaking channel - CNN. We appreciate that you don't go away on a city break to watch tv but it's nice to have the option as it is a facility advertised and one which you are paying for after all. If you like to iron your clothes before an evening out, take a travel iron as the hotel does not have one you can use. Also take a travel kettle as the rooms do not have tea/coffee making facilities. The adjoining 'restaurant' was expensive and the menu limited and unimaginative especially for vegans/vegetarians. The pizzas look better than they taste and the complimementary olives tasted stale. The salad consisted of a handful of mixed leaves and half a tomato! Overall, we would not recommend this hotel and will not be returning to Barcelona. Apart from some nice architecture, the city is dirty, overcrowded and really you could be in any other city in Europe... plenty of Starbucks, Mc Donald's and Burger King's if that's your thing. We were particularly upset to see caged birds of all varieties for sale along Las Ramblas and the pet shops were also archaic selling puppies on show in glass fronted cages. If you are still tempted to visit, stay in a hotel off the Las Ramblas as I think you will get a much better deal. Transport around the city is good so getting about is easy. Use the Aerobus to and from the airport - cheaper and less hassle that the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: E.Clements
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Royal a couple of times and cannot find fault with it. Excellent location right on the Ramblas. As my husband and I are retired we found the rooms nice and quiet at night. We will be back later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “A refreshing break”
Reviews.Author: NellBolton
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 day trip to Barcelona on the web through BMI baby .com. Chose a hotel at ramdon which turned out to be just right for a short break - The Royal Hotel directly on Las Ramblas. Very comfortable, with all we needed, bed & breakfast and at a reasonable rate. It is ideally placed for walking, reaching the bus services and the restaurants in the evening. For a short break this hotel is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Better deals around the corner”
Reviews.Author: Phobot
Reviews.Content: I booked our hotel through Expedia for only 2 nights, just in case I didn't like the hotel. I'm glad that I did, too. I suggest that anyone thinking of staying here go around the corner (2 min walk) to Hotel Inglaterra. Here's why: 1. Our hotel room was freezing cold, colder inside than out, it seemed. I called the front desk to make sure I was operating the A/C correctly and was instructed over the phone what settings to put it on. The room was still freezing the next day, so someone came up and told me that I had actually turned the thing off. I don't think either was correct because I tried every possible setting, the temp was as high as I could set it, and our room was cold the entire time. 2. The wireless internet is expensive, 15 euro per day per computer. I paid for the internet and yet I couldn't get a signal. The front desk did rectify this problem by sending me up some big clunky antenna. It worked, but still annoying. When using a laptop, the less wires the better, right? 3. The hotel room was very mediocre. It was not 4 stars and definitely not worth the price. The room was boring. I'm not super into decor or anything, but it was basically furnished like a Motel 6 or something. It was clean, but very basic. The television was old and didn't work properly. This hotel is not terrible, but it's just OK. I highly recommend going around the corner to Hotel Inglaterra, where I stayed for the rest of my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: shooshi-lou
Reviews.Content: Hotel Royal on Las Ramblas seems to get quite varied reviews. Mines is a favourable one. I chose the hotel primarily for location. It certainly lived up to that. Very central, at the top of Las Ramblas and at Place Catalunya. You are within walking distance to shops, bars, restaurants and metro stations. Appearance wise I think it is quite typical of a 4 star Spanish hotel. We had a decent sized room on the 6th floor which most importantly was very clean. I found the hotel staff we dealt with efficient and helpful, although we didnt really need a lot of assistance from them. If you are looking for a well located, clean, pleasant and not overpriced hotel in the city then this is a good choice. There is so much to see and do in Barcelona - La Parc Guell, Sagrada Familia (both must see's). We navigated our way around using both the metro and bus system. Fairly simple and saves on taxis. If you walk straight down Las Ramblas, heading to the beach you will come across Maremagnum. A self contained entertainment complex of shops, bars and restaurants with lovely views out to sea and the harbour area. We spent our last night there. Very nice relaxed atmosphere. A great end to a great holiday. Drinks wise, stay off of Las Ramblas. A pint and a JD and coke came to 19 euros in a bar on the main drag. It is worth venturing into the side streets for much nicer and cheaper bars. If you are a fan of cocktails, seek out Rita Blues. An average round of 2 cocktails came in at 13 euros. This was our first time in Barcelona and cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: CazNorthumberlandUK
Reviews.Content: Booked the designer rooms x 3 in September 06 only to get an email 2 days before we were due to arrive saying the rooms were not available! We were put in superior rooms but nothing superior about them. I admit they were clean with ok furniture. Bathroom big enough. This is not a 4 star hotel more like a 3. The best thing about this hotel is the great location right on The Ramblas. Staff were just ok. Self service bar area from vending machines. 25cl bottle wine 3 euro. The bar area is just off the small reception and has approx 10 seats. No atmosphere what so ever. Barcelona is a fab city to visit and would definately go back but stay at the 1898 Hotel on the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “only use royal floor”
Reviews.Author: melini
Reviews.Content: prime location on las rambla,no need to book breakfast which is served in restaraunt next door as countless coffee shops in immediate area.same applies for bar facilities,dont need a hotel bar when you are surrounded by them in streets on and off las rambla.go off the main drag for cheaper prices. used barcelonahotels.com to book 4 months in advance and got a great deal(130 euros per night +7% tax) for a room on the royal floor.only thing missing from our room was the jacuzzi stated on the hotels website!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location”
Reviews.Author: Northeastlads
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a excellent central location right on the La Ramblas, the hotel is very very clean the staff where average when it came to assistance and friendlyness I think this was because it is not a family run hotel and is part of a chain. Like all places around europe you just need to be assertive and try not to be to British and agree with what the staff want. Would stop there again but the price was above what we would usually pay. Colin & Shaun, Durham England

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: charliedebby
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this hotel from 29 December to 2nd Jan. I have stayed in many 4 star hotels and as such would not rate this hotel as 4 star for the following reasons: Hotel bedroom was far too hot and when we tried to put the temperature down we couldn't. When contacting the reception they said it was not possible as it was winter! This hotel advertises that it has climate control rooms. Having said this the staff were very helpful in getting us a stand alone fan but really a 4 star hotel should have the facility that individuals can control the temperature of their room. Very basic toiletries in the bathroom - enough for 1 person even though it was a twin room. They state it has WiFi and then charge you 15 euros per day to use it. The signal strength was very low and it kept logging off! Took me over an hour to get it sorted. Meal we had in the Hotel restaurant was not good and expensive for what we had. The Hotel lobby/lounge area was that of a 2/3 star hotel offering a couple of vending machines for drinks! They advise Satellite English TV - this was CNN and Eurosport! The only thing that was good about this Hotel was its location. It is on top of everything. As far as facilities it offers I would definitely rate this as no more than a 3 star charging 4 star rates.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy surroundings”
Reviews.Author: itsasmallworld
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 design rooms (2 doubles and 1 family suite) on the Royal Floor for 4 nights starting on 12/27. I was attracted to this hotel because they had a family suite and the location, but unfortunately, I was quite disappointed with the hotel for a number of reasons. Although there were a few good points, I would choose not to stay here again: Pros: •Room price was very reasonable: 130 euros for first two nights/195 euros for last two nights on double rooms; 250 euros for family suite. •Location on Las Ramblas (if you like very busy surroundings). It’s near Placa Catalunya (transportation hub), shopping and the interesting Barri Gotic area •Design room had two sinks in the family suite; pefect for a family of 4 •Double rooms on the Royal Floor faced Las Ramblas. This made for great people-watching. •Rainshower and Jacuzzi bath were nice to have available after a long day of touring •La Poma Restaurant is next to the hotel and they provide room service. Their pizzas were OK, pastas not too good, but surprisingly, their paella was pretty good. •Elevators were always readily waiting on the ground floor. •There are lots of good restaurant nearby, but best to choose one on the side streets off Las Ramblas (because of price and quality) •3-5 minute walk to Boqueria market •Convenience store a few doors down. We bought our water and soda there when lines weren’t excessively long as they tend to be in the later afternoon. Cons: •Although rooms were sound-proof from the noise on the streets, there was constant noise from the restaurant below, which you could clearly hear from our rooms (#8, 9 and 11) You can hear them moving chairs around, vacuuming and generally moving things around until 2am. Other reviewers mentioned this as well. •Some nights were so busy on Las Ramblas that it was a chore just to walk through the crowds. Hotel staff said this is typical of weekend nights. •Staff was cordial, but not very helpful. They did not offer restaurant recommendations, but rather, gave me a map with restaurants shown. I asked for their personal preferences in the area and was told on 2 occasions that most of the restaurants are good – they just didn’t say which ones! •Had to have our keys for the family suite re-programmed 3 times. Reception was apologetic, but did not know why this was occurring. •There is no coffee/tea service in the room. There’s a Royal Salon for those staying on the Royal Floor which provides tea service but the Salon opens at 8am or 8:30 or 9am – depending when staff decides to open up. I asked the front desk about this, but they said it should open at 7:30am. You can, instead, grab some coffee in the breakfast room which opens at 7:30 or purchase in the machine in the lobby for one euro. So, if you’re an early riser, like me, you’ll have to wait for your morning beverage!There’s no concierge or phone book available. I had to rely on the reception staff who were not openly helpful. •This is not a four star hotel in the “traditional” sense. They might have received a 4 star rating because there’s a restaurant and because of the location. It couldn’t possibly be because of the services or amenities. Please beware - the lower Ramblas (toward the water) is a bit seedy, especially at night. If I were to return to Barcelona, I’d choose a location on the Passeig de Gracia. It’s amazing how much less crowded and crazy things are on that opposite side of Placa Catalunya - but, of course, it’s considerably more expensive. We had the most amazing and wonderful tours with Spanish Trail. I’ll post a review under tours in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “100% Location”
Reviews.Author: cops
Reviews.Content: fantastic location I booked a superior room. I was very dissapointed and thought it would be special, it was only comparable to a 3 star. Had twin beds, i'd asked for a double, no tea/coffee in room, minibar expensive. but room was clean, if a little small. I wonder if things had been better if i had requested a non smokers room? do the smokers get the bad deal?? however i'd go again, but pay for basic room, afterall, there is so much to see and do in this city, you'd spend very little time in it anyway!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and style”
Reviews.Author: BiggerAl
Reviews.Content: We were attracted to the hotel by the excellent location at the top of La Rambla and its good ratings. We were not disappointed. The designer room was well worth the extra cost if only for the great wet room rain shower. The sound proofing kept out the noise of the city when we wanted it to and the discrete blinds gave you privacy without blocking out the view of the entertainers below in the street. . The breakfast started early but went on late till long after 10 am and that meant you could be a late riser after a night out and still have time for a leisurely start to the day. The food choice was very good. If you fly into the city, don't waste your money on a taxi. Get the Aerobus from the airport to Placa Catalunya for only 3.75 Euro and the hotel is literally a few minutes walk across the square into La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: HJCF
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room on the royal floor, which was perfect for 4 of us. The room was lovely, and very clean. Incidentally, no security problems as there was a safe in the room which we used at all times. The breakfast was not very good - only used for convenience! Not cheap, but not many places with family rooms in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: jazi
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Royal and would definitely return. We splashed out and stayed in a family design room (2 adults & 2 children) on the Royal floor which was lovely - modern, spacious and very clean (and I am very fussy!). The tea-making facilities/magazines in the lounge next door and the rain shower /jacuzzi bath in the bathroom were a real plus. The children enjoyed the sweets left for them by the maid at bedtime! The location cannot be beaten - we were able to walk to most places or take the metro (station is right outside the hotel) and felt we were in the heart of things although the hotel was very quiet inside. We ate breakfast in the hotel on our first morning which was only just o.k. but not worth the 9 euros per person - the best thing about it was being able to eat whilst watching the street entertainers on La Rambla outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Leong's
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great location if you like to shop, use the hop on/ hop off tour buses, and be close to a lot of activity. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The first room we got was very smokey smelling. The hotel was booked for the night but the next day they were able to move us to a non-smoking room. The windows to the hotel face the busy Ramblas but with the double windows you can't hear all the activity going on outside. I was very pleased with the cleanliness and location of this hotel especially for the price. Make sure you walk down the Ramblas to the open air market were you can but fresh squeezed fruit juices (try the mango juice it was very good).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Royal was great”
Reviews.Author: bjfp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Royal for a pre-cruise stay. It was a lovely hotel right on Las Ramblas. Great location to walk just about everywhere in the main part of Barcelona or to access the Touristic bus. We loved Barcelona - lots to see and extremely clean even in the little windy alleyways in the gothic quarter. We would go back in a heartbeat and stay at Hotel Royal!

Reviews.Title: “Be very careful”
Reviews.Author: jbegs
Reviews.Content: Good location but doggy hotel as Passport disappeared from our room in the hotel room when the staff cleaned. Passport magically reappeared a day later after reported to hotel Management, Police & Consulate. Would never return again to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pick a better spot”
Reviews.Author: donkr
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this average hotel that is priced above average. The room was pretty nice but there was nothing in the hotel beyond that- the lobby is very small with only facilities being a couple beverage despensers. The elevators were small. We didnt eat there as it was expensive.The staff was ok. It is just not anything special for 140 E excluding tax and no breakfast. Confirmation said internet facilities yet there were none.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Royal on Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: DWAH
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights staying at the Hotel Royal in Las Ramblas. The location is perfect. It's at the top of Las Ramblas, about 150m from the Placa de Catalunya and around 400m from the Liceu metro station (which is about half way down Las Ramblas). The main tourist buses leave from Placa de Catalunya and a number of metro and train lines intersect there. The hotel is also 40m away from the 'Champion' supermarket on Las Ramblas. If you don't want to pay hotel minibar prices or fancy a quick snack you can just nip to the supermarket (although you won't be short of places to eat on Las Ramblas). We bought bottles of water from the supermarket (19 cents each) and stocked our minibar with those - althought that probably annoyed the maid! Overall, we were happy with the hotel although we had a couple of minor issues (see below). We found the staff helpful and professional. The room was clean with a view over Las Ramblas, although the decor was slightly dated in the room we had. The TV had the usual satellite fare (ie. apart from the Spanish channels it was one channel per language). The safe was electronic. The rooms are very well sound-proofed and even thought it's the busiest street in Barcelona we could hardly hear a thing. Although the service had a few personal touches (eg. the porter taking the bags up to the room), it seems to be a hotel that focuses on professional rather than personal service. Having a room with a view over Las Ramblas cost an extra 20 Euro's per night but we thought it was worth it. The street is busy until late into the night with a variety of performing artists. After returning from sightseeing (between 7 and 8pm) and before going out for dinner (sometime after 9.30pm) we would just sit and just watch the street. We had 2 minor issues. When we first arrived we were put into a smoking room (when we had booked a non-smoking room). It stank, as almost all smoking rooms do. It also had a connecting door to the adjacent room and we could hear everything that was going on. We immediately asked to move to a different room and we were moved as soon as an appropriate room had been prepared (which was about 10 minutes). When we arrived in the new room it was much better although it had no toiletries. A quick phone call to the reception and toiletries were provided within a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel on Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: TravelingZZZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Royal right in the heart of Las Ramblas. When we checked in, there was some confusion as to our reservation, which was I had confirmed, cancelled, and confirmed again on line. It was not the fault of the hotel and they were very accommodating by giving us a room, with a great view. The service at Hotel Royal was great. The room was nice and the buffet breakfast was very good. The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. It was located in a the middle of Las Ramblas which was great for walking to the port or for the city tour buses. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spainmarbella
Reviews.Content: The Royal Hotel is very average. I saw pictures of the Royal Floor in the hotel lobby and those rooms may have been a bit more luxurious, ours was very average. We could have been in a Holiday Inn or any other basic hotel in any city. They should upgrade all rooms rather than have one "fancy" floor. The bed was similar to what you may find in a college dorm - it felt like there was a big plastic bag around the matress. Strange. The bathroom was good, nice amenities. The staff was very friendly and spoke English, always helpful! The location cannot be beat - you're in a great area on La Rambla. The Picasso Museum, Market, Gaudi House, Barri Gothic are all within walking distance (if you don't mind walking). I would recommend the Royal, just don't expect anything 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: joeyv2001
Reviews.Content: Really friendly folks, the room was clean and quiet. the location was fantastic...subway was a block away...you are right on las ramblas. I would stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Filli24
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights stay at Royal Hotel while on a road trip around Europe with my boyfriend after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor.com. While I agree that the hotel is in a great location (our Lastminute deal got us a room overlooking La Rambla), it is a pretty standard hotel without much character at all and left us feeling that we could have been anywhere in the world, including an airport hotel in UK... Staff were very helpful and welcoming on arrival but didn't mention the fact that we had to pay extra for the car parking which i feel they should have done just to clarify things. The first room we were put into had dodgy air conditioning so we complained to reception and then waited 1 hr for somebody to come and repair it. When nobody came, the guy did apologise and put us into another room. The bathroom was really nice and clean with a good shower and nice little freebies but the decor of the room was your usual business hotel type interior. We chose not to have breakfast as at 10 euros each we easily found many other places to choose from at half the price. So all in all, Royal Hotel is in a great location with good staff but is a rather old-school hotel lacking in style and character which is disappointing when you're in a city like Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: choward1
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week long stay at the Royal Hotel, absolutely great hotel, we paid extra for a designer room with a view of La Rambla - well worth. The room was ultra modern with a big window opening up on to La Rambla. It was sound proofed which is an absolute must if staying on La Rambla. The room was spotless and very comfortable and reasonably spacious. The floor we were on had a room with tea and coffee facilities which is great in a European hotel where a kettle in the room doesn't exist!!! The staff were helpful and had good English. However the hotel breakfast is overpriced for what you get as in all of the hotels on LaRambla, try the cafe across the road beside the Citadines Hotel. The location was brilliant, the hotel is at the Placa de Catalunya (where all of the tourist and airport buses leave from) end of La Rambla, which was a safer and nicer area after midnight. Barcelona itself is a great place for a holiday, totally recommend the tourist bus - definitely worth the money. Also be sure to visit Montserrat - outstanding sight and worth the trip. The aquarium is too expensive for the twenty minute walk around it. Visit both Gaudi houses, as La Predrera is worth seeing for the roof and Casa Batllo for the apartment. Sagrada Familia is definitely worth a visit but not the climb - not much to see at the top! And goes without saying - watch your bag and pockets!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Quality...”
Reviews.Author: Ubie
Reviews.Content: We just loved our 3 week trip to Spain, including Barcelona as our last stop. And what a destination - so much to see and do....a beautiful city ! Our stay at the Royal Hotel, right on La Ramblas, is definitely the place to stay ! We had booked our reservation via internet; the Long stay promotion 4 nights & more, and had decided to splurge and book their twin Design Room on the Royal Floor. The pictures and comments do not lie. You do have a view directly on La Ramblas, the place to be, with a very large window (double panes), therefore blocking all noises from this very, very busy street. The room was very modern, but not over the top, large marble shower, beds were very comfortable and everything was new & clean. Rooms on this floor, also included free internet access.
