As an added touch, only clients of this floor have access to the Royal Lounge where a selection of teas and sparking wine (yes it's true) , little black chocolates, a basket of apples and magazines are available from 8:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. You can relax right there (where a few tables are set up) or bring your champagne flutes or cups to your own room. It was really a very enjoyable bonus. The Royal Hotel is indeed very close to Plaza Cataluyna where the touristic buses & the metro are located. By the way, it is an excellent way to visit Barcelona as you can hop on & off to visit the sights. The city is so big, that we were very happy to have taken the 48-hour pass (24 hour is also available). The Royal Hotel is very, very centrally located- close to the Gothic quarters, side streets full of charm, shops, restos, down the street is the Port & Marina. And what to say of La Ramblas! Alive ! Restaurant terrasses, very creative street performers, shops, flower stands, theaters... Needless to say, if you do not like crowds, stay away. However, if you like to be right-smack in the action and stay in A-1 hotel, then the Royal Hotel is the place to stay!!! We were very satisfied and will recommend this hotel to all our friends and family. Before we left we asked to view one of their regular, standard rooms, and must say they also seemed very comfortable with tradtional Spanish style furniture. Same double-pane windows - good size rooms, clean, large bathrooms. One thing did surprise us as this is truly a 4-star hotel - there was no lobby-bar. It really didn't bother us that much. However, it would definitely be a plus for the hotel instead of their vending machines. They were, however, in the midst of opening a wall from the hotel right into the Poma restaurant, so I guess it may kind-of solve this little inconvenience. A five minute walk will take you to a little jewel of a restaurant we found - the L'Oliva on Calle Jovellanos where the food was excellent, really not expensive, service great. Their salmon al cava cooked in a sparking wine was to die for. It literally melted in your mouth. Please note they are closed on Sundays - we very disappointed cause we really wanted to go back. Have a great time in Barcelona ! ! !

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean & great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Meemers333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal for 3 nights during our honeymoon. Honestly, I have no complaints about the room, the service or the location. The room was nice, modern, and really clean. The staff were so friendly and helpful. And, most important, the location....right on Las Ramblas!!! I would definitely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from an 8 night stay at Hotel Royal and what can I say - it was GREAT! The location could not have been better - right on Las Ramblas, close to a major subway station, and in walking distance to just about everything you'd want to see or do in Barcelona, from shopping to sightseeing and museum hopping. The hotel itself actually exceeded my expectations. I was in a triple and was concerned that we would feel extremely confined, but the room size was sufficient and our ammenities included a minibar, an in-room safe, and even a bidet in the bathroom. The hotel is very clean and modern, and the staff, from the front desk to the cleaning women, were all very friendly and helpful. It was truly the perfect place for us - we kept saying to one another "I love our hotel!" While in Barcelona we passed many of the other hotels that we considered for this trip, and not once did we wish we had stayed at one of these other establishments, including ones that were much more expensive. So, for value, location, ammenities, and stellar service, Hotel Royal is a great choice. I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal!”
Reviews.Author: VoyageurMontreal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Royal. The location of the hotel was perfect for walking to everything you wanted to see and do on the Rambla, around the Port, the Plaza Catalonia, even the Gaudi sights, which were nearby. The metro, bus and taxi services are a minute walk. The hotel service and staff were excellent: friendly, helpful and always greeted you with an hola and a smile. Their restaurant recommendations were great. The hotel restaurant (La Poma) was convenient yet a bit pricey...The food was very good though. The breakfast was great: eggs, fruit, cheese, sausage, bacon, pastries, cereal, and open til 11, to allow vacationers to sleep in if they wish. We only have great comments and would definitely recommend the Royal to our friends and family. Our first trip to Barcelona was so memorable, also thanks to the Royal Hotel!!! Barcelona is a vibrant and colourful city to visit: the cultural and architectural diversity are one of a kind.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CMowbray
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at the Royal last March, and the location was excellent, a short walk away from the airport bus stop. The Hotel is very clean, with decent size rooms and friendly staff. We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel and would recommend it to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Royal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. Enjoyed the view. Windows open to the Ramblas. Mini serve-frig and a lock box in the room. The quality of the room was very good. Breakfast was excellent and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: location, location, location! walking distance to all major points of interest. rooms soundproof is real and effective (6th floor); spacious and clean room. should we ever go back to Barcelona, we would no doubt book the Royal again. breakfast is not one of the best we ever had, absolutely, but starts at 7am for those who wake up early, and it's ok - 5 in a range from 1 to 10.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SDAndrew75
Reviews.Content: We walked into the Royal Hotel after the NH de luc Victoria refused to honor our reservation. The Royal Hotel staff was incredible, multi-lingual and very helpful. We had two rooms, one huge suite, and one standard size room. Both were great, with very comfortable beds. The hotel is right on the placa de catalunya/La Rambla, with hundreds of street performers and some great deals on oil and water color paintings. Recommend Cafe Zurich for a cafe americano and a baquette to start your day off!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We only spent a few days at the Royal but were impressed and pleased with the accomodation. We were assigned to the new Royal Floor, which is on the second floor. At check-in I was concerned about the noise level from Rambla, so I was a little suspicious since we requested a quiet room. Not to worry - the rooms are double glazed, with 2 separate heavy glass windows(which can be opened). In fact the second night we stayed Barcelona won the European soccer championship and within an hour there were at least 10,000 screaming fans setting off fireworks, flares, blowing horns, and generally going insane from 11pm to 2am - we had an incredible view of the celebration. Even with all this going on with the windows closed it was reduced to a tolerable rumble. On a normal day it was uncanny looking out the window- like a human aquarium - you could see all the activity on the street, but couldn't hear a thing! The newly remodelled Royal Floor rooms are gorgeous - very sleek and well thought out and a decent size. Also on that floor is "private" lounge area for those on the floor, featuring complimentary tea, water, candy, fruit and chilled Cava! For the price (130E) we thought it was an exceptional value and would recommend it highly (be sure to ask for the Royal Floor!)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Royal, la rambla”
Reviews.Author: Lisa80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from the night Barcelona won until Saturday. i also had a room overlooking the courtyard which was very quiet. Room was very small however and dark. Bathroom minute. Location excellent though. Staff were mostly friendly. They would not however give me an iron. i had to pay someone to do it for me. Ok since on business but every other hotel I have been in has always provided an iron. Security reasons apparently :-) Room service was acceptable. Breakfast was ok if you eat a lot. if you just have a croissant and coffee, it is better to eat out on one of the cafes.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for its location!”
Reviews.Author: shah_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and were amazed by its location- right on the placa de catalunya and at the beginning of La Rambla. The rooms are a good size and clean- staff attentive and multi-lingual. Breakfast expensive but with the huge amount of cafes around, you shouldn't go hungry. Overall, an ideal hotel to see Barca!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Royal excellent for sightseers”
Reviews.Author: BrownwolfSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and were impressed by the helpful and efficient reception staff who spoke good English. The porter can also store your luggage and call taxis on request. The room was spacious and well decorated with an excellent bathroom, plus hairdryer, tv & mini bar. We were lucky to get an "interior" room with a window to the central courtyard/well, as Barcelona won the Champions League on our first night there & the loud celebrations went on into the night (although the hotel say that all rooms are soundproofed)! Breakfast was served from 7-11 and cost €13 for an extensive cold buffet plus a couple of poorer hot items. Again the staff were helpful. Although breakfast could definitely be bought more cheaply elsewhere it makes for a relaxing start to the day. The hotel is located at the top of Las Ramblas, near the metro and Placa de Catalunya, making it an excellent base for sightseeing. All in all we would highly recommend this hotel for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend The Royal”
Reviews.Author: JulieWilson66
Reviews.Content: Having recently stayed at the Royal Hotel Barcelona. I can happily recommend it. the location is excellent right on the Ramblas. The staff are freindly and helpful. We hadn't opted for a deal including breakfast but did choose to have breakfast in the hotel, the choice of food and the freshness were excellent and well worth 13 euros. We hadn't opted for the room with the Ramblas View, this is only 15 euros more and definitely well worth the extra. I would definitely recommend the Royal and will stay there again as I reaaly enjoyed Barcelona. Next time I will opt for the room upgrade as whilst my room was clean and comfortable it was very dark.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: weejin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal for 2 nights and enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in a fantastic location, right on the Ramblas. We had a superior room overlooking Las Ramblas and it was great to be able to see what was going on when we were in our room. As we had booked a superior room we hoped it would be larger, we felt it was fairly cramped for a superior room. A slight gripe is that the furniture is across the window and it is difficult to get access to what is one of the best points of the room (the view) we got round this by moving the furniture around. The rooms are very well insultated from outside noise so that is not a problem. The breakfast is nice and the breakfastroom is spacious and with the view over the Ramblas a very nice place ot eat in the morning. We were told that there was no restaurant in the evening, however, on passing the hotel during tour last evening it did appear that the restaruant served food in the evenings, so perhaps worth investigating. The staff at the Royal are very attentive and I would most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: SwedenGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Position: Excellent Room: Very good, clean. Had a room with a view over the Rambla, yet soundproof. Breakfast: Excellent Staff: Very helpful We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Main plus point is it's location”
Reviews.Author: Ali921
Reviews.Content: Location was great but the rooms although a fair size were too hot and stuffy and you cannot control the temperature. Advertised complimentary tea and coffee was no longer complimentary on arrival. Breakfast was acceptable. Not a hotel for people who want to come back and relax with a drink etc

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelVA
Reviews.Content: My family (two adults and a 15-year old child) had a very brief stay at the Royal (arrived at midnight and left the next day). The hotel was fine (like a US Holiday Inn), but definitely not luxurious. Our room had three twin beds (the third bed was made up like a day bed) which worked well for us. The room was quite and average in size. The bathroom was a bit cramped. The hotel's location is excellent and the staff held our luggage well past check out. We took the aerobus to Placa Catalunya as another reviewer suggested. That worked well (definitely a great deal at about 4 Euros/person), but keep the following in mind. It looks like the bus is used by locals ( we were the only tourists and no one else spoke English). The bus was packed - lots of standing passangers. We arrived at Catalunya at midnight and although the hotel was only about a five minute walk, making our way through Las Ramblas (lots of people at outside bars) with luggage didn't feel very comfortable. From what I could understand, the bus driver tried to advise us to hide our money (I think ;-). We considered taking the bus to the airport the next day, but it looked like there was a long line.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Uxbridge_UK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a weekend break at this hotel. The location is great. Step out through the hotel entrance and you are right in the centre of this energetic and stylish city. Step back though the door to escape the same! We booked a Superior Design Ramblas View room. These are on their own "Royal" floor. They are modern and stylish, but the room we had was small. There was no separate bath tub, but the shower room was excellent. Overall for our short stay we were happy with our room. Noise insulation from the bustle of Las Ramblas was very good, which had the downside of making the internal noise of the hotel more noticable on ocassion. On the Royal floor is a small "lounge" area of a few tables and chairs with some complimentary Cava, Tea, and Mineral Water. We enjoyed a glass, or two, of Cava before we went out for the evening. We had breakfast in the Hotel, which unsurprisingly is more expensive than you can find at local cafes. The breakfast room over looking Las Ramblas was pleasant, and the buffet breakfast offered a good choice. The staff were polite, professional, and very helpful. When we return to Barcelona we will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Royal welcome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Getting to the hotel by rail is quite easy (try to travel light)from Sants catch the L3 Metro to Liceu or Catalunya stations. The reception is clean and welcoming with exceptionally polite and helpful staff. Despite the location the rooms fronting La Ramblas are well insulated from the hustle and bustle outside. The bedrooms and en suite bathrooms are clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. A bit pricey in season but if we were to go to Barc again, we would endeavor to stay at the Royal, as we have twice before. Far better experience than staying at the Expo near Sants. Usually eat breakfast out of the hotel, so can't comment on their "first meal of the day".

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: Applegreen
Reviews.Content: Located in the centre of las ramblas this is a great hotel. Went as a large group from work and the hotel accomadated us very well. Staff were great. Breakfast was good, worth getting out of bed for. Rooms were spacious and clean. Prices for minibar etc not exhorbitant as we expected having emptied a few. This is a great place to stay to experience Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: BrotherSmith
Reviews.Content: Summary: If you are in Barcelona for a few days and want clean comfortable centrally located lodgings, then the Hotel Royal is perfect. When and why we stayed: My wife, son and I stayed at the Hotel Royal for 2 nights in March 2006. We were in the city as my son and I had tickets for the Barcelona versus Deportivo football match (Barca won 3:2). Cost: We booked the hotel with flights and match tickets from expedia. Room: The room and furnishing were old but most importantly clean and quiet. The beds were very comfortable and we all slept well. The bathroom was spacious with a combined bathtub and shower. The room also had a TV and table & chairs. There was also a minibar but we didn’t use it as the supermarket nearby (turn right out of the hotel’s front door then walk for a minute) was much cheaper for water (€0.30 for 1.5 litres) and beer (San Miguel €0.60 for half a litre). There is a free to use safe in the wardrobe. As we booked a triple room we were unable to obtain a room with a La Rambla view – these are doubles. The Hotel: The staff are friendly and when we when requested help to access our safe we received prompt assistance. We didn’t eat the hotel’s €13 breakfast as there are much cheaper options nearby. La Nurnia (turn left out of the hotel’s front door then walk for 2 minutes towards Placa Catalunya and the restaurant is on the left) was very good and served reasonably priced set menus. Location: Perfect. The hotel is at the top of La Rambla, near Placa Catalunya, which is a major transport hub with a Metro and railway station as well as stops for buses. There are dozens of restaurants and bars nearby. The 9th floor café/restaurant in the El Cortes Ingles department store in Placa Catalunya is a marvellous spot to chill out over a coffee whilst you admire the magnificent city panorama there is a Starbucks near the hotel, at Ramblas 109. The Jules Verne bar a few doors away (towards Placa Catalunya) shows live English and Spanish football. The city: Barcelona is one of the great cities of the world. It is: cosmopolitan; alive; happening and radical. There’s lots to see and do. A visit to the Camp Nou is a must. Our visit for a match was memorable – a tremendous spectacle with outstanding exciting football played. If there isn’t a match on you can tour the stadium and visit the club’s museum. The Bus Turístic is a great way to see the city’s main sites if you are short of time. The Tourist Bus has 44 stops along three routes: Northern Route (red), Southern Route (blue) & Forum Route (green) You can get on and off as many times as you like along the journey. The nearest stops to the hotel are in. Placa Catalunya A one-day ticket costs €18 or €22 for two days. Feel free to E-mail me if you require further information.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right on La Rambla on the doorstep of the Metro system. We had booked one of the recently rennovated Designer Rooms on the Royal floor, it was well worth it. The standard of the room was excellent and the added touch of being able to use the facilities within the Royal Lounge was nice, excellent Cava!

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: vinnie.55
Reviews.Content: great location. great staff. we had superior rooms overlooking the ramblas. booked direct with the hotel who emailed the booking confirmation price etc so no probs when it came to check out. a really great location at the top of the ramblas. read one review about having breakfast at the nuria resturaunt, its great 6 euros compared with 13 euros plus tax at the hotel. out of the hotel turn left about a minute walk brings you to the nuria. if you come out of the hotel go to the end of the buliding and turn left down the narrow street two good resturaunts there on the right hand side. definatley stay at the hotel royal again. take the city tour for two days 18euros one day 22 euros two days. you need two days to get round it all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: impavidus
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal in late January. The hotel location is excellent, with amazing views of las Ramblas, yet totally soundproofed rooms. The rooms are spotless, breakfast is good and the staff are helpful. Can't really fault it!

Reviews.Title: “A Great La Ramblas View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there on the Week of Nov 14, 2005. I did my reservation over the Internet and got confimrations by email. I changed my reservations a couple of times, called the staff each time, and they did it with no problem. Great thing about thoe hotel is the lcoation viewing the Ramblas. But don't worry about noise as the double glass window will make your stay as soundproof as possible. Resturant food variety is not much but it also views the Ramblas so you can enjoy eating and watching, but then who would think of eating in the hotel with all of the restuarants around you. Staff is very friendly and they help in finding the right places for food an shopping. Last, when I returned home, they sent me a Thank You letter. Next time I go to Barcelona, Hotel Royal will be on top my list.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Mrhreid
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights with some friends. Had decided to go for one of the more expensive rooms as a treat but we ended up in room 1 which I think was one of the smallest rooms in the hotel despite the price! Having said that the room was very stylish and the shower was excellent. Great view on to the Ramblas and the quadruple glazing did the job in terms of keeping the noise out at night. You're very much paying a premium for the location of the hotel - right at the top of Las Ramblas but it does the job in terms of good beds, good security and good showers, but you don't get a great deal of bang for your buck. Be warned as well - keep hold of your wallet at all times on the Ramblas (even at this end) and especially at night

Reviews.Title: “4-Star DIY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon at the hotel, a total of 8 nights over the New Year. Having stayed in Barcelona before, we expected the 4-star rating to be slightly lower quality than other European hotels, and Hotel Royal was no exception. The rooms are quite small and pricey, beds are hard, no gym or pool, and room service should be avoided. But the location is unbeatable. Situated close to Placa de Catalunya, the hotel is a short walk from an amazing variety of great restaurants, shops and sights - and only about a ten minute walk from the Marina. There's a supermarket virtually next door (good for cheap bottled water to stock up the mini-bar), an internet café two minutes round the corner (go out the hotel, take first left, then left again) and an amazing foccacceria called Buenas Migas that serves the best hot chocolate in town (go out the hotel and turn left down the side alley). There's also some great places on Passeig de Gracia (Tapelia as an example, it's beside the cinema on the left hand side). The list is endless - avoid the hotel's food, and don't dine on La Rambla, way too much money for gross food. The hotel is decent, and we found the triple-glazing to be effective, but the staff are not prone to being helpful, and the front desk does not display information on theatre, tours, etc. Housekeeping is great, but, honestly, avoid room service. The little cafés around the corner are much, much better!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Royal for New year. We were only there for three nights and thought the hotel was fabulous! We booked on Lastminute. We requested a double room and a view of La Ramblas, which is the main street the hotel is located on. All of our requests were satisfied and we had a magnificent view. The rooms have triple glazing so you cannot hear any of the noise from La Rambla. The location of the hotel is spot on! located at the top of La Rambla with a view of Placa de catalunya, the main square at the top of La Rambla. We were able to enjoy the atmosphere of the new year street party right from our hotel window so we were not caught in the 50,000 people who were on La Rambla that night!!The metro is a 30 second walk away from the hotel and everything is nearby, perfect location. The room was superb. It was spacious and very clean. A mini bar and electronic safe were provided. The safe was no extra charge which we found unusual.... The bathroom was huge! It had a huge bath and power shower and a huge marble sink. It was a very pleasant stay at the Hotel Royal due to the lovely rooms, easy access to Barcelona sights and the staff who were very welcoming. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who really wants to get out and about and see the sights of Barcelona, great value for money! Just be careful of pick pockets as they are everywhere especially where the street entertainers are performing... Do not eat Tapas on La Rambla or any food for that matter as it is extremely expensive and crap. There are many restaurants off La Rambla down the side streets but be careful in the evenings as the side streets seem quite sinister.... We can recommend a brilliant italian restuarant. It's called La locanda just around the corner from the cathedral, Dr.Joaquim pou is the street name. Best food we had all weekend and really good value for money. Genrally we found the Spanish food to be extremely bland and over priced! General summary, beautiful city, awful food!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Bcn”
Reviews.Author: DAKOTABLUE
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Royal with my husband 09-11 Dec. We were celebrating our second wedding anniversary and booked one of the new rooms of Hotel Royal called Design rooms. They are all overlooking Las Ramblas and they are only some EUR more expensive than the standard rooms but it is worthy because We could enjoy the life on the Ramblas through our window and the room was very comfortable and all new!!! Breakfast was super!!! We had breakfast overlooking Las Ramblas early in the morning whilst you watch people walking up and down (going to work). It is a real awakening of Barcelona!!! Although there is no bar at the lobby, you can pop in the restaurant next door (the hotel's restaurant called La Poma)which it is also a cafeteria. The vending machines at the lobby are also ok, they are in a very comfortable and quiet place to stay where you can have a beer at a cheap price after your excursions. We will never forget our stay in Barcelona and Hotel Royal made it even more special!!!

Reviews.Title: “One great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one great hotel and deserves a 4 star rating. For 105 euros (tax included) (December 1-4, 2005), it was a great deal. It is at a great location. The construction is very good and the double windows were effective in keeping the noise out. Open the windows and enjoy the Rambla from your room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely go back there again. Tip: Do not take the train from BCN. They have changed the schedule and it is confusing and inconvenient especially if you any luggage. Train from BCN is 2.30 euros. Take the Aerobus directly to Plaza Catalunya from BCN for only 3.60 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdamgirl
Reviews.Content: A great place. Nice rooms, no noice at all, even for the location. The staff is very helpfull. The breakfeast is good. We have stayed here already 3 times. In september 2006 we will return. One of the best hotels in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “best barcelona hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: LJ-UK
Reviews.Content: Have been to Barcelona more than a dozen times now and have got to say this is the best hotel I have stayed in. The location is brilliant right on Las Ramblas within easy reach of everything and every where. Our room over looked Las Ramblas, the double glazing is superb we hardly heard a noise from outside. The room was big clean and tidy everything in it that we needed, a good maid service and a wonderful bed. The largest double bed I have encoutered in Spain and a proper bed not two singles pushed together and so comfy. Breakfast was included and what an experience to sit overlooking Las Ramblas watching the world go by. The food and choice was excellent.The staff were polite and helpful. The only downside is the bar/lounge area which is help yourself from a vending machine and although clean and tidy is very impersonal but we hardly spent any time there so this is nit picking. Overall a splendid hotel and one which I will stay in on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: magruf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a couple of weeks ago, the most comfortable bed to be slept in. The amenities could not be faulted, the dinner plate sized shower head provided the most invigorating massage that one could wish for after a day's walking/sightseeing. Not the most spacious of rooms we have stayed in but spotlessy clean and maid service excellent. We had a room with a view over La Ramblas, what entertainment!!, close the windows and no sound at all. The breakfasts were more than adequate for us. The staff we found very friendly and helpful. The situation of the hotel is perfect - you are within walking distance of so many tourist attractions, shops, restaurants and theatres. We will certainly be back at some time to visit Barcelona, staying at this hotel which is so close to all the important attractions that are available. Thank you Hotel Royal

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i've just returned from a girls' weekend away. We were really impressed with the hotel from the outset - its location, cleanliness and courteous staff. There were 6 of us & luckily for us they gave us 2 rooms that had a connecting door, so we felt like we were all in the same room - brilliant. We'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone. The only down side to it was that there isn't much natural light in the rooms, nor is the lighting adequate. But hey ho - you don't go to Barcelona to stay in the hotel room do you!

Reviews.Title: “Get room overlooking Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights this September before a cruise. They gave us a back facing room the first night, even though we had requested a Rambla facing room when we made reservations. It was very clean but small and dark, since it was overlooking another wall of the hotel. We were moved the next day and what a difference a front facing room made! It was larger and brighter with a wonderful view of La Rambla. The windows opened so we could see and hear some of the street artists, but when we closed the windows there was not a sound. The bathroom was all marble with very nice toiletries and hairdryer. All in all it was a very nice stay but the two rooms were not at all comparable so make sure you get a front facing one.The breakfast buffet was included in our room rate but I agree it was not worth the money. There were plenty of places to get breakfast on Las Ramblas. Watch your pockets because my husband had a failed pick-pocket attempt. He wrapped his neck pouch around his belt and kept the pouch in his front pocket so when one person poked his pants very low on one side the other guy tried to pull out the pouch on the other side. He couldn't get it fortunately but we learned that when people were following too closely we would stop and turn and make them pass us. Otherwise Las Ramblas is a circus- Street artists everywhere each very clever.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DogAgility
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day stay at the Royal Hotel in Barcelona. I would highly recommend it! Terrific location right on La Rambla - close to everything and tons of restaurants nearby. The rooms are huge, big bathrooms - everything is clean and quiet. The staff is helpful and attentive - and they spoke English. They even have a parking ramp nearby. Almost all of the main sights are within walking distance. We didn't end up taking the metro/subway, but the stations are very close to the hotel. We walked to the beach, the Barri Gothic, the Guadi houses and the several museums.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hoyel”
Reviews.Author: DDDMarie
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I along with our husbands went on a cruise in July 2005 so we deceided to stay the night before at the Hotel Royal in Barcelona. We were impresed by the friendliness of the Front Desk Staff. We were given rooms as soon as we arrived. (After 10 hours of flying from the USA and running through airports in France). Our rooms were on the 6th floor facing the famous "Las Ramblas". The rooms were spacious and the most important thing for us, in a Non Smoking floor. The bathrooms were inmaculate clean. The entire facilities were inmaculate and the beds very confortable. At night, we were serenated by a guy playing the flute in front of my window but the music was very good. The rooms are sound proof so it did not bother me much. The next day we went to the hot and cold buffet breakfast which was very good. I had the best chocolate milk in years!. The Hotel Staff made arrangements to have a van pick up us at the Airport and on the next morning to tour around the City of Barcelona and to take us to the pier to go on our cruise ship. ( This went on without a hitch in spite of the fact that we were six adults with tons of luggage). This is an excellent hotel (4 stars) which I would highly recommend to anybody. I would be looking forward to stay there again in my future trips to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “crowded barcelona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel 8th - 13th sep 2005 . hotel in superb position quite room at back of hotel with double glazing. rooms very clean didn't eat here because of high cost of breakfast - 13 euros.breakfast could be taken in bars on ramblas for 4- 8 euros. I would also recommend using the underground to visit tourist sites instead of the tourist bus as traffic in barcelona is horrendous and if using the tourist bus all your time is spent in traffic jams

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Set on the Ramblas - an extremely clean and lovely hotel. We were on the 4th floor directly overlooking the main street, and even though it's busy there constantly, the windows were double glazed and hardly any noise got through. The hotel is in the perfect place. The harbour is just down the road with a lovely shopping centre, the beach is within walking distance and all the tapas bars and the Hard Rock Cafe are just yards away. Take the tourist bus for a good day out - getting on and off where you like. The frequency of these buses is around every 5 minutes so not much hanging around. We ate breakfast in the hotel every morning. The hours are 7-11 a.m. and its a buffet so you can just help yourself and the selection is really good. Lots of other tourists use La Poma (the restaurant that belongs to the hotel) as well - it was always full. We were warned about pickpockets before we went but we didn't see any trouble at all and there was a police presence around which made us feel safe. The only thing I would warn about are gypsy women with babies that are begging constantly. You just have to have common sense and don't wander off down any narrow alleyways (keep to the main areas). I would definitely go back to the hotel and we had a very enjoyable stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Located at the top of the Ramblas near the square, so really handy for getting the bus from the airport and not having to walk far once you arrive. Hotel was very clean and our room was big, although we did have a room that looked into the middle of the hotel so no view, next time I would ask for a room overlooking the Ramblas as the windows are triple glazed and I'm sure you wouldn't hear anything from the street. You can walk everywhere which is great, but take good walking shoes as there is so much to see and do on your doorstep! Found a lovely restaurent opposite called 'Attic' which was really good food and good priced. Do not have breakfast in the hotel, it is one price of about £10 per person and all I could eat was 3 slices of toast! There are loads of places to get food, so not to worry. Would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Allenba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned fron the Hotel Royal with our 10 year old son. We would highly recommend it as it is located right on La Rambla! Our room overlooked La Rambla which was buzing all day and night but as there was triple glazing in the room noise was never a problem. Only thing to mention is that we booked a standard room (the offer was that child under 12 goes free)-however it means we all had to share a kingsize bed-if we wanted another bed it was another 206 Euro!. The bed however was enormous and it was not a problem. Fully air conditioned spotlessly clean and a safety box in the room. We would definately stay again (one other point , when going to airport on your return home dont get hotel to book taxi -we were charged double compared with our arrival-taxis are plentiful accross the road).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Earthman
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because we wanted the essence of Barcelona at our door step and because of the reviews both here and in the various guides. Our family of three ended a 3000 km drive from Southern Italy here and planned to meet another family disembarking from some cruise line. The location could not have been better! All arrangements were made using email and the response from the hotel staff was tops. I would give it ****! DO pay attention to the reviews and try to book rooms only on the TOP TWO floors if you want peace and quiet from the constant surge of humanity on La Rambla below. There is a double paned window and a second window that are all easily opened to let the city in. This reduces the noise to nearly inaudible. Our group had five rooms, all clean, quiet and good AC. The staff is most helpful, and the small "super market" next door is very convenient. Try the cafe Santa Anna across from the hotel and down the side street a few doors for some fine paella.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Royal for three nights before our cruise. Contrary to a couple negative reports, we found the hotel clean, comfortable, and the staff was very friendly. The hotel is located about half a block from Placa Catalunya right on La Rambla. Our room overlooked La Rambla and although there was still activity on it at 4 AM there was no noise in our room since the windows have double pane glass. One thing I have found out. is that most European hotels do not provide wash cloths since it is a very personal item. Would recommend that you pack a couple of disposable ones if you plan to stay there. In addition to the tour of Monserratt and the city,we had a fabulous time just walking La Rambla sampling the food and watching the mimes. They are fabulous. If I ever return to Barcelona, I would definitely stay at this hotel again again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 19 - 22 June with my daughter the hotel is in an excellent location right in the centre of the Ramblas. The Royal is very comfortable and clean - ask for a room overlooking The Ramblas you will not suffer from the noise outside as all the rooms are triple glazed to prevent this. Hotel staff very helpful, breakfast very pricey for the content but convenient nevertheless. Don't eat in La Poma - very mediocre surroundings and food to match. Only downside was the lack of any sizeable publice area e.g. bar and public loos (you have to use the ones next door in their restaurant). Definitely will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Such a bad experience, never again...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, the staff is unhelpful and rude, the rates are overpriced and the rooms are like a youth hostel. I was very disappointed at the fact that this hotel was rated and priced like a 4 star hotel when it was in fact really a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is listed as 4* and deserves that classification in almost every respect. The rooms look a little old-fashioned to be sure. However, our room was large and comfortable, the service swift, freindly and helpful and the location outstanding - you couldn't want a better position for a base for exploring barcelona. The only major downside is the lack of facilities - no pool, spa, not even tea & coffee making facilities in the room. The best thing of all is that you get all this for a price bracket more befitting a 3* hotel, which this certainly isn't! I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who isn't on the tightest of budgets.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: mgpant
Reviews.Content: Location is great..and my room size was good.. Staff were nice and we enjoyed our stay.. probably a bit expensive i think..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Missi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Hotel for 4 nights in May to celebrate our Silver Wedding Anniversary. We booked the Royal after reading the reviews on this website. We were not disappointed. The staff are extremely helpful. Our room was on the sixth floor overlooking La Rambas. It was a lovely room with a beautiful en suite bathroom. Breakfast was included in the price we paid though we would not choose to eat there had it not been included as we did not think it was value for money. Also the breakfast room was quite small. On the whole though we had a fabulous time. The hotel location is ideal for touring Barcelona on foot, by bus or metro.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at a few hotels in Barcelona in May 2005, and we were extremely disappointed with the Royal Hotel. It is listed as a four-star hotel, and this is absolutely not the case. The room we got was VERY small (I would estimate 10 x 10 feet maximum) and the hotel looks like it hasn't been renovated in years. There was no view from our room (we looked onto a white wall that was about 5 feet away from our window), the room was musty and dark and the decor is very old and dank. The hotel is well-located in the heart of La Rambla, but this did not compensate for the poor upkeep and style of the hotel. The hotel lobby and reception desk are fine (although the photos make them look nicer than they actually are), but once you head up to your room, it is all downhill. I would strongly recommend finding another hotel in Barcelona because there are many with better value and better cleanliness. I would not even recommend this hotel to budget travellers or students, since it is relatively expensive. The only people that should stay here are people who only care about location and really want to be in the center of the city - you can walk almost anywhere from this hotel. Having said that, there are plenty of hotels in the neighborhood that may have nicer amenities at the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Mumwithchild
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights beginning of May. Nothing was too much trouble. The night staff were particularly helpful. Twin room, with folding bed for our 3 year old. Room very nice, no noise problems - we were on 4th floor. First time used the tripadvisor and the Royal was one of the only hotels available (Grand Prix was on at the same time). It was exactly as the reviews had said. Would definitely recommend and go there again. So ideally placed to visit the Gothic area, lovely walk down to the port. Didn't eat breakfast there as there was so many places to eat. On the whole the city is very reasonable and spent our time popping into tapas bars. No wonder they don't eat until 10pm + . Our flight wasn't until very late at night and the hotel held onto our luggage and were delighted to do so! Excellent customer service. Go enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Karin1234
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is optimal for touring around Barcelona. You can walk the Ramblas at night and be close to home, jump on the metro at any time (its only a block away). The bathrooms are clean and well stocked with anything you could need including a toothbrush and toothpaste, razor, soaps, creams, shampoo, etc. The rooms are plenty large and the double paned windows are a blessing when PC Barcelona (football) won their championship game and the festivities took to the Ramblas for the entire night! Our room faced the Ramblas and although we could still hear the fireworks and M-80's being lit off, with my ear plugs, I still got some sleep. They have a wonderful lobby, great doormen, good service and very very clean facilities. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. On the negative side (there always is one), they make you sign an agreement when you use a charge card to accept their conversion rate. Our 88E dinner in their adjoining restaurant turned into $250 US. That seemed like a bit much. But you're pretty much stuck when it comes to their credit card policy. My advice: stick to cash and travelers cheques. There is a cash machine right across the Ramblas from the hotel that you can use. In addition, the thermostat in our room never seemed to work correctly. We wanted it cooler and it wouldn't go below 25C no matter how low we set it. There is a great grocery store a few doors down the street. Don't miss the downstairs in the grocery store: 3.3 Euros for a litre of Sangria, .5 Euro for a baquette, 2 Euro for some cheese and .20 Euro for desserts. Great deals for a quick dinner in your room while watching the people on the Ramblas! Also the open air fruit and vegetable marquet (Boqueria?) down the street a bit was a great place to shop as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Highly Recommended !”
Reviews.Author: Just&Rach
Reviews.Content: Myself, my Wife, and my Mom & Dad stayed here a few weeks ago for three nights in order we could explore the great City of Barcelona. We used the reviews on this site whilst browsing which hotel to book, so thought the least we could do was to do a quick review of our own! We found the hotel to be exceptionally clean, in fact one of the cleanest hotels we've ever stayed in. The staff were friendly and the room service and the maid service were faultless at all times. Contrary to what has been mentioned on a couple of other reviews, the bar is fine, clean, tidy and modern, with reasonable prices although it was quite small. We stayed in two rooms, both overlooking the Ramblas on the 5th and 6th floor, and had barely any noise from the streets below. The aircon worked a treat and the mini bar came in handy. One minor fault is that the lifts broke down on a couple of occasions which meant a bit of a walk to the upper floors, but it helped work the Tapas's off! We were lucky enough to see Barcelonas last league game of the season (incredible experience if you get the chance) and the hotel looked after and stored our tickets from the agency (Barcelona-football-tickets.) without any problems. So to summarise, all four of us can definitely recommend the hotel, and should we ever go back to Barcelona wouldn't hesitate to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Tyrone Supporter
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a three night stay at this hotel and couldn't have picked a better location. Chose this hotel solely because of the reviews on this website which were 'spot-on'. On arrival asked for a room overlooking Las Ramblas which we were given, even though we didn't check in until approximately 7.00 p.m. Found the reception staff to be very helpful. Were given a room on the first floor which was perfect - were not disturbed at all by noise from the street below. Only point to make about noise were the pipes coming from the bathroom which seemed to rattle quite a bit during the night!! However, it didn't spoil our stay. Barcelona is a fantastic city and found the Bus Turistic fantastic value at €21 for a two day ticket. We weren't leaving for the airport until 5.00 p.m. but the hotel allowed us to store our suitcase in their luggage room after check-out at 12 noon. Definitely recommend this hotel - clean, friendly and fantastic location!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Position, Spotlessly Clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I have just returned from spending 3 nights in the Hotel Royal. Reviews on this site had recommeded requesting a room at the front but when we did so, we were informed that all triple rooms were at the back. However, the room was very spacious, comfortable and clean, and being on the fourth floor was quiet enough that we could have our window open all night. The hotel is in a fantastic position, and it was easy for us to pop in and out during the day to deposit bags of shopping and freshen up! The best place to have breakfast is at the Nuria Restaurant which is just a few doors up the Ramblas, next to Burger King. Just 6 euros for a full English breakfast. We would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two 28 year old girls stayed here for three nights in April 2005 and found the hotel to be in an excellent location. The rooms could not have been better, very clean, spacious and with a nice bathroom. We asked for a room overlooking La Ramblas and got one on the sixth floor which was sound proofed and had a great view. The staff were friendly and I would definately stay at this hotel if I was going back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Hotel .Watch the pickpockets”
Reviews.Author: babybuny
Reviews.Content: Very helpful on reception desk. Negotiated a better deal by phoning them instesd of using the website. Booked 3 rooms which were all ready when we arrived at lunchtime. Very clean and smart. Bathrooms nice and clean with marble. fridge in room and there is a cheap supermarket next door so dont bother bringing drinks etc. if you have a Ramblas facing room insist to be on the 6th floor or you will hear the noise. Ramblas busy even at four in the morning so be warned.Dont book breakfast. Awful and expensive. The cafe up the strret near burger king did great breakfasts for 6 euros ( the whole works). Much less busy and relaxing. Watch the pickpockets. Mother had bag stolen from harbour area. They are on bikes and rollerblades and are like grease lightening. They take from your knee if sitting down so be paranoid or it could be you. There is a Safe in hotel roomso dont take passsports etc with you. Hotel is at the very top of the Ramblas so good for shopping but not so good for the harbour. Avoid restaurants on Ramblas. Head for gothic area. 4 cats was very nice but busy. Ask for a table upstairs if there are only 2 of you. Worth going to. Cable cars a long walk to get to. Taxis much cheaper if you just get one outside airport. Would recommend the hotel as it was so clean. Not a romantic city. More of a party place with lots of English coming in from cheap flights ( saw loads of hen groups and stag groups)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: servicecounts
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Royal. The location of this hotel could not be better, near the top of La Ramblas and only a minutes walk to Placa de Catalunya. Port Vell is at the other end of La Ramblas and is about 15 minutes walk, although this will usually take longer as there is so much happening on La Ramblas. When we arrived we got the Airport bus A1 from the Airport to Placa de Catalunya. The hotel is only a minute or two's easy walk even with luggage and children. The open topped tour bus's also go from Placa de Catalunya. When we checked in I asked for a room at the front overlooking La Ramblas, the hotel staff happily arranged this. The room was clean and spacious and had a great view of over La Ramblas. The soundproofing ensured a good nights sleep. The mini bar in the room was well stocked but expensive, I would have prefered tea and coffee making facilities. Breakfast is 13 euro, but the choice was good, and is a great place to enjoy a leisurely breakfast if you enjoy people watching. The hotel has a small bar area, which did lack atmosphere, but was a good place to relax after a long days siteseeing/shopping. Overall the localtion of this hotel is excellent, the service good and the hotel rates are reasonable. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 26 March 05. Very good location, a stone's throw form Cataluna Sqaure, where the bus form the airport drops you off (A1, roughly 3.5 euros). Def. ask for a top floor room (these are all no smoking rooms), as this affords you a good nights sleep in a city that never sleeps! Clean, nice rooms, very large, spacious accomadation, this really is a geniune four star hotel. Great, loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “friendly clean and great location but get a room at the front”
Reviews.Author: prettyfishes
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great location and very helpful, friendly staff. Our room overlooking Ramblas large and sunny with good sound proofing. Our parents room at the back of the hotel, small and dark with no view at all except a dark courtyard (however staff would have been happy to change this) make sure you book a room with a view (although we did request this and didnt get it anyway). Breakfast not worth the money. Not great on atmosphere/ambience. But no real problems and would consider staying here again as long as it was in one of the front rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel Royal in Feb. The location is fine but the hotel is just ok. The staff were civil but not at all helpful. The halls and lobby are very dark and while the hotel is very clean it has a dreary quality about it. Lots of british soccer fans were staying there when I was there (Chelsea vs Barca) which was fun, but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location was best feature”
Reviews.Author: J0mac
Reviews.Content: Initial impressions of this hotel were that it looked very modern in the middle of much older more beautiful buildings and inside it was a fairly standard, characterless affair. There is a bit of a bar at the back of the entrance lobbyand the check -in desk is to the left. We found the staff to be courteous and helpful and we were very lucky with our room - on the fourth floor overlooking the Ramblas which was a great source of entertainment. The room was very comfortable with every modern convenience (except perhaps, tea-making facilities) and we really appreciated the double-glazed windows and the thermostaticlly-controlled heating as it was quite cold when we were there in February. The en-suite was small but adequate. The one complaint we had about the room was that the walls were very thin and we could plainly hear our neighbours talking and moving about their rooms. The breakfast room was not very attractive and the breakfast itself was mediocre for the price of 13 Euros - better to go into one of the many cafes nearby. The location of this hotel could not be beaten with all the beauty and vibrancy of this great city on the doorstep and for this reason we would recommend it to friends and would stay there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about the location!”
Reviews.Author: shamrocker74
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fantastic weekend in barcelona. First of all you just will not get a better located hotel in barcelona. Its about 100 yards from the Placa de catalunya and right on the famous Ramblas. If you are coming from the airport dont waste your money on a taxi. Get the airport bus for €3.60 and it will drop you within a 2 minute walk to your hotel. You are within walking distance to the beautiful and lively marina. Not only that the hop on hop off tourist bus is again located just a minute away. And so to the hotel. Just make sure you request a room overlooking the Ramblas. It will make all the difference. This is not a 4 star by irish standards. Maybe only an average 3 star. The staff are friendly and the hotel is clean. The room was small and unfortunetly for some strange reason we got two single beds pushed together in our double room which made things a bit uncomfortable. I'm not sure if this is the case in every room. One important factor is that the walls are paper thin and you can hear virtually everything in your neighbours room. The Ramblas is heaving from morning to night but when the windows are closed you cant hear a thing (except your neighbours). Watch out for those windows as they open fully and have a low ledge! The hotel has a small bar hidden away in the lobby area. Its not very comfortable and a bit stuffy. Best to do any drinking in the cafes nearby. Having said all that the location by far outweighs these drawbacks and I would recommend this hotel to anyone on that basis alone and thats why I will give it an above average rating. One last thing Barcelona is the most stunning city I have ever seen. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Central and well looked after”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona for 3 nights in Hotel Royal. It is cituated in La Rambla which is the most touristy area of the city. Also close to the metro and buses and I would say an ideal location. We had a room on the fifth floor looking at the back. No view at all. Just facing a wall. Not nice but we had booked via Expedia.com and the price was on offer. The good thing was that it was quiet. Breakfast was not included in the price. The room was good and very clean. Good facilities and well looked after. The attidude of the staff was neutral. Not very friendly or helpful but not rude. Overall good experience and probably I would recommend it because of it's location.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Bet”
Reviews.Author: pico74
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on the net and spent 4 nights here last week. Had a room on the 6th floor looking out over the ramblas but no problems with noise - 2 thick windows and 3 sets of curtains kept it nice and quiet. Clean bedrooms made up several times a day! Very helpful staff All in all a great hotel in a great location - didn't give it the full five stars as the restaurant belonging to the hotel is very average. Otherwise no problems at all

Reviews.Title: “A great, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bruin4life2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Royal is right on La Rambla, which, while touristy, is extremely central and a great place to stay. It was perfect for first-time visitors and allowed us to get our bearings. We stayed here for five days in January and I would recommend it to anyone. The rooms were nice and clean, and I cannot say enough about the hotel staff. They spoke English and were very helpful, always answering our questions and offering suggestions. If you can, try to get a room overlooking La Rambla. You don't have to worry about the noise (soundproof rooms), and it is so much fun to look out the window and see Barcelona life below. You will not be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JockScot
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 5 day family trip. Hotel was great. Chosen purely on feedback from this site. Asked in advance for 2 adjacent rooms and a view of Las Ramblas (front of hotel) - delivered on both accounts. Location of hotel is superb - only 100 yds from Catalunya Sq. at the top of Las Ramblas and within walking distance of stacks of shops. Rooms were v clean and tidy and maid service efficient. Breakfast albeit in a smallish room caters for all tastes. If going back would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of Hotel Royal, It is central to everything and although it is on the main thoroughfare it is totally soundproofed and comfortable. Staff are very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Why go anywhere else...excellent..excellent”
Reviews.Author: oceanwitch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here October, '04 and am still congratulating myself for choosing this hotel. It has everything...wonderful, very well kept room . Noise reduction windows.. blackout curtains. We had a room overlooking La Rambla and were not bothered at all at any time despite all the fantastic goings-on right under our noses. Bathrooms are modern and immaculate. Staff exceedingly helpful. Why go elsewhere?

Reviews.Title: “Affordable comfort with convenience”
Reviews.Author: Ryan.W
Reviews.Content: Efficent and friendly front desk staff, clean lobby, comfortable rooms, and an excellent location. What more does a traveler need?

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed at the Hotel Royal between 25th Aug-29th Aug. We booked our accommodation based on the previous glowing reviews of Hotel Royal and I can gladly say that they were absolutely spot on!! EVERYTHING about this hotel is fantastic - the rates, location, staff, cleanliness etc - could not have been better! We fell in love with the city and will definitely be back very soon! We will book with Hotel Royal for sure!!
